original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshigs bla dags zhes bya ba ni ming yin no //
analyzed: tshigs bla dags zhes bya ba ni ming yin no //
translated: The term “ultimate” is a name.

original: de lhag par 'di'i dmigs pa yin pas /
analyzed: de lhag par 'di'i dmigs pa yin pas /
translated: Since that is the object of that contact,

original: de'i phyir tshig bla dags kyi 'dus te reg pa zhes bya'o zhes grag ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig bla dags kyi 'dus te reg pa zhes bya'o zhes grag ste /
translated: it is called contact with the ultimate.

original: ji skad du mig gi rnam par shes pas ni sngon po rnam par shes kyi sngon po'o zhes bya bar ni rnam par mi shes so //
analyzed: ji skad du mig gi rnam par shes pas ni sngon po rnam par shes kyi sngon po'o zhes bya bar ni rnam par mi shes so //
translated: As it is said, “Visual consciousness is aware of blue, but it is not aware ‘This is blue.’

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pas ni sngon po yang rnam par shes la sngon po'o zhes bya bar yang rnam par shes so zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pas ni sngon po yang rnam par shes la sngon po'o zhes bya bar yang rnam par shes so zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: Mental consciousness is aware of blue and it is aware ‘This is blue.’”

original: gcig ni rten gyis rab tu phye ba yin no //
analyzed: gcig ni rten gyis rab tu phye ba yin no //
translated: The first is distinguished by its basis.

original: gnyis pa ni dmigs pas rab tu phye ba yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni dmigs pas rab tu phye ba yin no //
translated: The second is distinguished by its object.

original: gzhan dag na re yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni tshig gi dbang du byas nas don rnams la 'jug gi lnga po dag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni tshig gi dbang du byas nas don rnams la 'jug gi lnga po dag ni ma yin te /
translated: Others say: Mental consciousness engages objects in dependence on words, but the five sense consciousnesses do not.

original: de'i phyir de ni tshig bla dgas yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni tshig bla dgas yin no //
translated: Therefore it is called contact with the ultimate.

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i reg pa ni tshig bla dgas kyi reg pa zhes bya bas gcig ni rten gyis rab tu phye ba yin no //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i reg pa ni tshig bla dgas kyi reg pa zhes bya bas gcig ni rten gyis rab tu phye ba yin no //
translated: Contact associated with this view is called contact through designation.

original: gnyis pa ni mtshungs par ldan pas rab tu phye ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni mtshungs par ldan pas rab tu phye ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The first is distinguished by its basis; the second is distinguished by its association.

original: yang reg pa drug po de dag nyid gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang reg pa drug po de dag nyid gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: These six contacts are also of three types:

original: rig dang ma rig dang gzhan reg / rig pa'i reg pa dang / ma rig pa'i reg pa dang / de gnyis las gzhan pa rig pa yang ma yin ma rig pa yang ma yin pa'i reg pa'o //
analyzed: rig dang ma rig dang gzhan reg / rig pa'i reg pa dang / ma rig pa'i reg pa dang / de gnyis las gzhan pa rig pa yang ma yin ma rig pa yang ma yin pa'i reg pa'o //
translated: contact with knowledge, contact with ignorance, and contact that is neither.

original: de dag kyang go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: de dag kyang go rims bzhin du /
translated: They are respectively:

original: dri med nyon mongs can lhag ma //🔽yin par rig par bya ste /🔽rig pa'i reg pa ni zag pa med pa'i reg pa'o //🔽ma rig pa'i reg pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi reg pa ste /
analyzed: dri med nyon mongs can lhag ma // yin par rig par bya ste / rig pa'i reg pa ni zag pa med pa'i reg pa'o // ma rig pa'i reg pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi reg pa ste /
translated: pure, afflicted, and the rest.

original: rig pa dang ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig pa dang ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One should know that contact with knowledge is pure anasrava, contact with ignorance is afflicted klista,🔽and the other is neither.

original: lhag ma ni gnyis ka dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir rig pa yang ma yin ma rig pa yang ma yin pa'i reg pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni gnyis ka dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir rig pa yang ma yin ma rig pa yang ma yin pa'i reg pa'o //
translated: The other contact is neither cognition nor non-cognition, because it is not associated with either.

original: lag pa yang gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: lag pa yang gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is the contact of the hand?

original: dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: It is contact associated with wholesome thought and thought that is non-obscured and undefined.

original: ma rig pa'i reg pa yang dang yang du kun tu 'byung ba'i phyogs gcig smos pas reg pa gnyis su 'gyur @134b te ;
analyzed: ma rig pa'i reg pa yang dang yang du kun tu 'byung ba'i phyogs gcig smos pas reg pa gnyis su 'gyur @134b te ;
translated: There are two kinds of contact, because one part of the contact of ignorance is mentioned:

original: gnod sems rjes su chags pa'i reg / gnod sems dang / rjes su chags pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod sems rjes su chags pa'i reg / gnod sems dang / rjes su chags pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: contact of malice and contact of attraction, because they are associated with malice and attraction.

original: yang thams cad bsdu na /🔽bde ba myong 'gyur la sogs gsum //
analyzed: yang thams cad bsdu na / bde ba myong 'gyur la sogs gsum //
translated: When all are combined,🔽there are three kinds of contact, contact that is conducive to pleasant experience, etc.

original: bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa dang / sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa dang / sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Contact that is conducive to pleasant experience, contact that is conducive to unpleasant experience, and contact that is conducive to neither pleasant nor unpleasant experience.

original: bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i phyir ro //🔽yang na de myong bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i phyir ro // yang na de myong bar bya ba'am /
translated: because they are similar to the experience of pleasure, etc.

original: myong bar nus pa'i phyir myong bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: myong bar nus pa'i phyir myong bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Or else, they are to be experienced because they are capable of being experienced.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is it that is to be experienced?

original: tshor ba yin no //🔽'di la bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba yod pas na bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa ste /
analyzed: tshor ba yin no // 'di la bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba yod pas na bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa ste /
translated: Feeling.

original: gang la bde ba'i tshor ba yod pa'o //
analyzed: gang la bde ba'i tshor ba yod pa'o //
translated: Contact that is to be experienced as pleasant is contact in which pleasant feeling is present.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin pa'i sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba dag la yang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin pa'i sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba dag la yang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: Contact that is to be experienced as unpleasant or neither pleasant nor unpleasant is contact in which unpleasant or neither pleasant nor unpleasant feeling is present.

original: de dag ni reg pa bcu drug yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni reg pa bcu drug yin no //
translated: These are the sixteen types of contact.

original: reg pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: reg pa bshad zin to //
translated: Contact has now been explained.

original: tshor ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: tshor ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: Feeling will now be explained.

original: de la reg pa rnam ba drug sdar bshad pa gang yin pa /
analyzed: de la reg pa rnam ba drug sdar bshad pa gang yin pa /
translated: The six types of contact that were mentioned

original: de las byung ba'i tshor ba drug / mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i tshor ba drug / mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'o //
translated: the sensation that arises from the contact of tongue and taste,🔽the sensation that arises from the contact of body and tangible,🔽the sensation that arises from the contact of mental faculty and the elements.

original: de dag las /
analyzed: de dag las /
translated: Among these,

original: lnga ni lus kyi'o sems kyi gzhan //
analyzed: lnga ni lus kyi'o sems kyi gzhan //
translated: five are bodily, the other is mental.🔽The five sensations that arise from the contact of eye and form,

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba lnga ni dbang po gzugs can la brten pa'i phyir lus kyi tshor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba lnga ni dbang po gzugs can la brten pa'i phyir lus kyi tshor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: of ear and sound, of nose and smell, of tongue and taste, of body and tangible, are called bodily sensations because they are based on material sense faculties.

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba ni sems tsam la brten pa'i phyir sems kyi zhes bya'o //🔽yang ci tshor ba reg pa'i 'og tu 'byung ngam /
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba ni sems tsam la brten pa'i phyir sems kyi zhes bya'o // yang ci tshor ba reg pa'i 'og tu 'byung ngam /
translated: The sensation that arises from the contact of mental faculty and the elements is called mental sensation because it is based on the mind alone.

original: 'on te dus mnyam du 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dus mnyam du 'byung zhe na /
translated: Do the sensations arise after contact or do they arise simultaneously with contact?

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re phan tshun du lhan cig tu 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dus mnyam mo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re phan tshun du lhan cig tu 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dus mnyam mo zhes zer ro //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say that they are simultaneous because they are coexistent causes of each other.

original: ji ltar na lhan cig 'byung ba gnyis skyed par byed pa dang bskyed par bya ba'i dngos por 'grub /
analyzed: ji ltar na lhan cig 'byung ba gnyis skyed par byed pa dang bskyed par bya ba'i dngos por 'grub /
translated: How can two things that arise together be established as that which generates and that which is generated?

original: ji ltar mi 'grub mthu med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ji ltar mi 'grub mthu med pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are not established as that which generates and that which is generated because they are powerless.

original: chos skyes zin pa la ni chos kyi nus pa med do //🔽lhan cig 'byung ba nyid skyed par byed pa dang bskyed par bya ba'i dngos po med do zhes bya ba gang yin pa de nyid chos skyes @135a * //
analyzed: chos skyes zin pa la ni chos kyi nus pa med do // lhan cig 'byung ba nyid skyed par byed pa dang bskyed par bya ba'i dngos po med do zhes bya ba gang yin pa de nyid chos skyes @135a * //
translated: A factor that has already arisen does not have the power of a factor.

original: zin pa la ni chos kyi nus pa med do zhes bya ba yin pas dam bcas pa dang bye brag tu med pa yin no //
analyzed: zin pa la ni chos kyi nus pa med do zhes bya ba yin pas dam bcas pa dang bye brag tu med pa yin no //
translated: That which is called the nonexistence of the state of being that which generates and that which is generated of two things that arise together is the same as that which is called a factor that has already arisen does not have the power of a factor.🔽Therefore, there is no difference between the thesis and the reason.

original: 'o na ni phan tshun du skyes par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni phan tshun du skyes par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If that is so, then it follows that they are generated together.

original: 'dod pa'i phyir nyes pa med de /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i phyir nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault because we accept that.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu la phan tshun gyi 'bras bu nyid du ma 'dod pa kho na'o ;
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu la phan tshun gyi 'bras bu nyid du ma 'dod pa kho na'o ;
translated: But it is not asserted that coemergent causes are reciprocal results.

original: /'di ni 'dod mod kyi reg pa dang tshor ba dag phan tshun nam 'bras bu nyid du 'dod ba 'di ni mdo las mi bzhed de /
analyzed: /'di ni 'dod mod kyi reg pa dang tshor ba dag phan tshun nam 'bras bu nyid du 'dod ba 'di ni mdo las mi bzhed de /
translated: This is asserted, but the sutra does not assert that contact and feeling are reciprocal results.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa la brten nas mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba skye'o //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa la brten nas mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba skye'o //
translated: The sutra states: Feeling arising from eye contact arises in dependence on eye contact.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba la brten nas mig gi 'dus te reg pa skye ba ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba la brten nas mig gi 'dus te reg pa skye ba ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Eye contact does not arise in dependence on feeling arising from eye contact.

original: skyed par byed pa'i chos dang 'gal ba'i phyir yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i chos dang 'gal ba'i phyir yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also illogical to say that they are reciprocal results because they are contradictory phenomena that generate each other.

original: chos gang zhig chos gang gi skyed par byed par gnas pa de ni de dang dus tha dad par grags te /
analyzed: chos gang zhig chos gang gi skyed par byed par gnas pa de ni de dang dus tha dad par grags te /
translated: Any phenomenon that is posited as generating another phenomenon is known to be temporally distinct from it.

original: dper nas bon snga la myu gu 'phyi ba dang / 'o ma snga la zho 'phyi ba dang / bsnun pa snga la sgra 'phyi ba dang / yid snga la yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'phyi ba zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dper nas bon snga la myu gu 'phyi ba dang / 'o ma snga la zho 'phyi ba dang / bsnun pa snga la sgra 'phyi ba dang / yid snga la yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'phyi ba zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: For example, the seed is prior and the sprout is posterior, milk is prior and curd is posterior, the striking is prior and the sound is posterior, and the mind is prior and the mental consciousness is posterior.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag snga phyi'i dngos por ma grub pa yang ma yin mod kyi lhan cig pa'i dngos por yang 'grub ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag snga phyi'i dngos por ma grub pa yang ma yin mod kyi lhan cig pa'i dngos por yang 'grub ste /
translated: It is not the case that cause and effect are not established as prior and posterior, but they are established as simultaneous.

original: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams dang / mig dang gzugs dag dang / 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams dang / mig dang gzugs dag dang / 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams lta bu'o //
translated: For example, eye consciousness and so on, and the eye and form, and the primary elements and the derivative form.

original: de la yang dbang po dang don dag snga la rnam par shes pa 'phyi ba dang / 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur ba rgyu tshogs pa snga ma las phyi ma 'byung ngo zhes bya bar 'dod na dgag pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de la yang dbang po dang don dag snga la rnam par shes pa 'phyi ba dang / 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur ba rgyu tshogs pa snga ma las phyi ma 'byung ngo zhes bya bar 'dod na dgag pa ci zhig yod /
translated: If it is asserted that the sense faculty and object are prior and the consciousness is posterior, and the primary elements and derivative form arise from a prior collection of causes, what is the refutation?

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re'o na ni myu gu dang grib ma dag ji lta bar reg pa dang tshor ba dag kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re'o na ni myu gu dang grib ma dag ji lta bar reg pa dang tshor ba dag kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say: In that case, contact and sensation would be like the sprout and its shadow.

original: gzhan dag na re reg pa'i 'og tu tshor ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re reg pa'i 'og tu tshor ba 'byung ste /
translated: Others say: Sensation arises after contact.

original: dbang po dang don dag ni snga la de'i 'og tu rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po dang don dag ni snga la de'i 'og tu rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The sense faculty and the object are prior, then the consciousness,

original: gsum 'dus pa de ni reg pa yin no //
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa de ni reg pa yin no //
translated: and the coming together of the three is contact.

original: reg pa'i rkyen gyis skad cig ma gsum pa tshor ba 'byung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: reg pa'i rkyen gyis skad cig ma gsum pa tshor ba 'byung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Sensation arises in the third moment through the condition of contact.

original: de lta na ni rnam par shes pa thams cad la tshor ba yod par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta na ni rnam par shes pa thams cad la tshor ba yod par mi 'gyur la /
translated: In that case, sensation would not exist for all consciousnesses,

original: rnam par shes pa thams cad reg pa yin par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa thams cad reg pa yin par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and all consciousnesses would not be contact.

original: de ni nyes pa @135b med de ;
analyzed: de ni nyes pa @135b med de ;
translated: There is no fault.

original: reg pa phyi ma la yod pa'i tshor ba reg pa snga ma'i rgyu las byung ba yin pas reg pa thams cad kyang tshor ba dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: reg pa phyi ma la yod pa'i tshor ba reg pa snga ma'i rgyu las byung ba yin pas reg pa thams cad kyang tshor ba dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Sensation that exists in a later contact arises from the cause of an earlier contact, so all contact has sensation.

original: rnam par shes pa thams cad kyang reg pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa thams cad kyang reg pa yin no //
translated: All consciousnesses are contact.

original: 'di ni rigs pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni rigs pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is not reasonable.

original: 'di la mi rigs pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: 'di la mi rigs pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is unreasonable about this?

original: 'di lta ste reg pa dmigs pa tha dad pa dag reg pa phyi ma la yod pa'i tshor pa reg pa snga ma'i rgyu las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste reg pa dmigs pa tha dad pa dag reg pa phyi ma la yod pa'i tshor pa reg pa snga ma'i rgyu las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Namely, that the feeling which exists in a subsequent contact cannot be the effect of a previous contact, since the two have different objects.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: rigs mi 'dra ba la dmigs pa'i reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba gzhan la dmigs par 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: rigs mi 'dra ba la dmigs pa'i reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba gzhan la dmigs par 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: The feeling which arises from a contact having a different type of object would have a different object.

original: yang na sems gang dang mtshungs par ldan pa de las gzhan pa la dmigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: yang na sems gang dang mtshungs par ldan pa de las gzhan pa la dmigs par 'gyur /
translated: Or else, the feeling would have the same object as the thought with which it is associated.

original: 'o na ni de'i tshe reg pa ni gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa tshor ba med pa yin la /
analyzed: 'o na ni de'i tshe reg pa ni gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa tshor ba med pa yin la /
translated: But, at that time, the consciousness which is the contact would be without feeling.

original: de'i sngon rol gyi rnam par shes pa'i tshor ba dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni reg pa ma yin te rkyen ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sngon rol gyi rnam par shes pa'i tshor ba dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni reg pa ma yin te rkyen ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And the consciousness which is prior to that and has feeling would not be contact, because the conditions would be incomplete.

original: de lta yin na nyes pa ci zhig yod //
analyzed: de lta yin na nyes pa ci zhig yod //
translated: What is wrong with this?

original: sems can thams cad las mang po pa bcu yod do zhes bya ba sa mang bo pa'i nges pa nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad las mang po pa bcu yod do zhes bya ba sa mang bo pa'i nges pa nyams pa yin no //
translated: The Vaibhāṣika theory that all sentient beings possess the ten universal mental activities is contradicted by the Abhidharmakośa.

original: nges pa 'di ga las grub /
analyzed: nges pa 'di ga las grub /
translated: What is the source of this theory?

original: bstan bcos las so //
analyzed: bstan bcos las so //
translated: It is taught in the treatises.

original: kho bo cag ni mdo tshad mar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni mdo tshad mar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: We accept the sūtras as authoritative,

original: kho bo cag bstan bcos tshad mar byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: kho bo cag bstan bcos tshad mar byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: but we do not accept the treatises as authoritative.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde la brten par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde la brten par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Bhagavat said, “You should rely on the sūtras.”

original: yang na sems thams cad la yod do zhes bya ba 'di sa mang po pa'i don ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na sems thams cad la yod do zhes bya ba 'di sa mang po pa'i don ma yin no //
translated: Or, if you say that the ten universal mental activities exist in all minds, then the meaning of the term universal is not tenable.

original: 'o nas mang po pa'i don gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o nas mang po pa'i don gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the term universal?

original: sa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: sa ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three levels:

original: rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa dang / rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam dang / rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa'i sa dang / dge ba'i sa dang / mi dge ba'i sa dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sa dang /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa dang / rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam dang / rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa'i sa dang / dge ba'i sa dang / mi dge ba'i sa dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sa dang /
translated: the level of investigation and analysis, the level of no investigation but only analysis, and the level of neither investigation nor analysis.

original: yang gsum ste /
analyzed: yang gsum ste /
translated: There are three more levels:🔽the level of virtue, the level of nonvirtue, and the level of neutral states.

original: slob pa'i sa dang / mi slob pa'i sa dang / slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: slob pa'i sa dang / mi slob pa'i sa dang / slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'i sa'o //
translated: the stage of learning, the stage of no more learning, and the stage that is neither of these two.

original: de la gang dag sa 'di dag thams cad ni yon pa de dag ni sa mang po pa yin no //
analyzed: de la gang dag sa 'di dag thams cad ni yon pa de dag ni sa mang po pa yin no //
translated: The factors that are found in all of these stages are called the universal factors.

original: gang dag dge ba kho na la yod pa de dag ni dge ba'i sa mang po pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag dge ba kho na la yod pa de dag ni dge ba'i sa mang po pa yin no //
translated: The factors that are found only in the wholesome are called the wholesome factors.

original: gang dag nyon mongs pa can kho na la yod pa de dag ni nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag nyon mongs pa can kho na la yod pa de dag ni nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa yin no //
translated: The factors that are found only in the unwholesome are called the unwholesome factors.

original: gzhan dag na re de dag ni ci rigs par rnam @136a * //🔽grangs kyis yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de dag ni ci rigs par rnam @136a * // grangs kyis yin gyi /
translated: Others say that these are all found in their respective stages,

original: thams cad cig car ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: thams cad cig car ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: but not all together at the same time.

original: mi dge ba'i sa mang po pa rnams ni 'don pa'i zhar la de khong nas drangs kyi sngon ni ma bstan to //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sa mang po pa rnams ni 'don pa'i zhar la de khong nas drangs kyi sngon ni ma bstan to //
translated: The unwholesome factors are mentioned here in the text as a supplement, but they were not mentioned previously.

original: gal te reg pa'i 'og tu tshor ba 'byung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te reg pa'i 'og tu tshor ba 'byung ngo zhe na /
translated: If it is said that feeling occurs after contact,

original: mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / gsum 'dus pa'i reg pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa skye'o zhes gsungs pa'i mdo'i lan gdab par bya dgos so //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / gsum 'dus pa'i reg pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa skye'o zhes gsungs pa'i mdo'i lan gdab par bya dgos so //
translated: You must answer the following question: “The sutra says, ‘The eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms. Contact is the convergence of the three. Feeling, conception, and intention arise together.

original: lhan cig skyes pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: ” It says “arising together.”

original: reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa zhes ni ma gsungs na ;
analyzed: reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa zhes ni ma gsungs na ;
translated: It does not say “arising together with contact.”

original: 'di la lan gdab tu ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'di la lan gdab tu ci zhig yod /
translated: What answer can you give?

original: lhan cig ces bya ba'i sgra ni de ma thag pa la yang mthong ste /
analyzed: lhan cig ces bya ba'i sgra ni de ma thag pa la yang mthong ste /
translated: The word “together” is also seen to mean immediately before,

original: dper na byams pa dang lhan cig par 'gyur ba'i dran pa yang dag par byang chub kyi yan lag sgom par byed do zhes bya ba lta bu yin pas 'di ni khungs su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dper na byams pa dang lhan cig par 'gyur ba'i dran pa yang dag par byang chub kyi yan lag sgom par byed do zhes bya ba lta bu yin pas 'di ni khungs su mi rung ngo //
translated: as in the statement, “One cultivates the mindfulness factor of awakening that is associated with loving-kindness.” Therefore, this is not a reliable source.

original: 'o na mdo las tshor ba gang yin pa dang / sems pa gang yin pa dang / 'du shes gang yin pa dang / rnam par shes ba gang yin pa'i chos de dag ni 'dres pa yin gyi ma 'dres pa ni ma yin no zhes gang gsungs pa ji ltar drang /
analyzed: 'o na mdo las tshor ba gang yin pa dang / sems pa gang yin pa dang / 'du shes gang yin pa dang / rnam par shes ba gang yin pa'i chos de dag ni 'dres pa yin gyi ma 'dres pa ni ma yin no zhes gang gsungs pa ji ltar drang /
translated: The phenomena that are feeling, conception, volition, and consciousness are mixed, not unmixed?

original: de lta bas na tshor ba la sogs pa dag kyang ma 'dres pa'i rnam par shes pa ni med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na tshor ba la sogs pa dag kyang ma 'dres pa'i rnam par shes pa ni med do //
translated: Thus, feeling and so on are not consciousnesses that are unmixed.

original: re zhig 'dres pa'i don ci yin pa 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: re zhig 'dres pa'i don ci yin pa 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: First, we must analyze the meaning of mixed.

original: mdo de nyid las 'di skad du //🔽gang myong bar byed pa de sems par byed do //
analyzed: mdo de nyid las 'di skad du // gang myong bar byed pa de sems par byed do //
translated: The same sutra says:🔽That which experiences feels.

original: gang sems par byed pa de /🔽'dus te shes par byed do //
analyzed: gang sems par byed pa de / 'dus te shes par byed do //
translated: That which feels conceives.🔽That which conceives cognizes.

original: gang 'dus te shes par byed pa de rnam par shes par byed do zhes gsungs na /🔽ci re zhig 'di de dag gis dmigs par nges par gsungs sam /
analyzed: gang 'dus te shes par byed pa de rnam par shes par byed do zhes gsungs na / ci re zhig 'di de dag gis dmigs par nges par gsungs sam /
translated: That which cognizes cognizes distinctly.🔽Do these passages state that these mental factors are definitely observed simultaneously?

original: 'on te skad cig ma la nges par gsungs pa de mi shes so //
analyzed: 'on te skad cig ma la nges par gsungs pa de mi shes so //
translated: Or do they state that they are definitely simultaneous?

original: tshe dang drod dag lhan cig pa la 'dres pa zhes gsungs pa'i phyir skad cig ma la nges pa yin par grub bo //
analyzed: tshe dang drod dag lhan cig pa la 'dres pa zhes gsungs pa'i phyir skad cig ma la nges pa yin par grub bo //
translated: because the sutra says that lifeforce and heat are mixed together, it is established that they are ascertained to be momentary.

original: gang yang mdo las gsum 'dus pa'i reg pa zhes gsungs pas de yang ji ltar na rnam par shes pa ni yod la /🔽gsum 'dus pa ni ma yin pa 'am /
analyzed: gang yang mdo las gsum 'dus pa'i reg pa zhes gsungs pas de yang ji ltar na rnam par shes pa ni yod la / gsum 'dus pa ni ma yin pa 'am /
translated: Moreover, since the sutras state that contact is the coming together of three factors, how can it be that consciousness exists but the coming together of three factors does not?

original: yang na 'dus pa yin la reg pa ma yin /
analyzed: yang na 'dus pa yin la reg pa ma yin /
translated: Or, if the coming together of three factors exists, how can contact not exist?

original: de lta bas na gdon mi za bar rnam par shes pa thams cad la reg pa dang / reg pa dang lhan cig skyes @136b pa'i tshor ba yang 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gdon mi za bar rnam par shes pa thams cad la reg pa dang / reg pa dang lhan cig skyes @136b pa'i tshor ba yang 'dod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is certain that all consciousness is contact and that feeling arises simultaneously with contact.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i gtam gyis chog gi dkyus ma kho na rim gyis brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i gtam gyis chog gi dkyus ma kho na rim gyis brjod par bya'o //
translated: Enough of this discussion of absurd consequences. Let us now explain the main point.

original: sems las byung ba tshor ba mdor bshad zin to //
analyzed: sems las byung ba tshor ba mdor bshad zin to //
translated: The mental factor of feeling has been explained in brief.

original: de yid nye bar rgyu ba las //
analyzed: de yid nye bar rgyu ba las //
translated: The mental factor of intention is explained next.

original: rnam pa dag ni yang bco brgyad //
analyzed: rnam pa dag ni yang bco brgyad //
translated: It has eighteen types.

original: yang sems las byung ba'i tshor ba de nyid yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad rnam par gzhag pa las rnam pa bco brgyad du dbye'o //
analyzed: yang sems las byung ba'i tshor ba de nyid yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad rnam par gzhag pa las rnam pa bco brgyad du dbye'o //
translated: The eighteen manopavicāras are established on the basis of the eighteen types of vedanā that arise from the mind.

original: yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eighteen manopavicāras?

original: yid bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba drug dang / yid mi bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba drug dang / btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba drug go //🔽de dag ji ltar rnam par bzhag / gal te ngo bo nyid las na ni gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yid bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba drug dang / yid mi bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba drug dang / btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba drug go // de dag ji ltar rnam par bzhag / gal te ngo bo nyid las na ni gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: Six manopavicāras of satisfaction, six manopavicāras of dissatisfaction, six manopavicāras of equanimity.🔽How are they established?

original: yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba dag yin no //
analyzed: yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba dag yin no //
translated: If they are established according to their intrinsic nature, there are three: manopavicāras of satisfaction, dissatisfaction, equanimity.

original: 'on te mtshungs par ldan pa las na ni yid dang mthun par ldan pa'i phyir gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te mtshungs par ldan pa las na ni yid dang mthun par ldan pa'i phyir gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are established according to their association, there is one, because they are associated with the mental faculty.

original: 'on te dmigs pa las na ni gzugs la sogs pa yul drug la dmigs pa'i phyir drug tu 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dmigs pa las na ni gzugs la sogs pa yul drug la dmigs pa'i phyir drug tu 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If they are established according to their object, there are six, because they have the six sense-spheres of visible form, etc. as their objects.

original: gsum kar yang gzhag ste /
analyzed: gsum kar yang gzhag ste /
translated: They are established according to all three criteria.

original: de dag las bco lnga ni gzugs la sogs pa la nye bar rgyu ba yin te /
analyzed: de dag las bco lnga ni gzugs la sogs pa la nye bar rgyu ba yin te /
translated: Fifteen of them are called those that take form, etc. as their objects,

original: gzugs la sogs pa so sor nges pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa so sor nges pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: because they focus on form, etc. as their specific objects. They focus on unmixed objects.

original: chos la nye bar rgyu ba gsum ni rnam pa gnyi ga yin no //
analyzed: chos la nye bar rgyu ba gsum ni rnam pa gnyi ga yin no //
translated: The three that take mental objects as their objects are both.

original: yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba zhes bya ba'i don ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba zhes bya ba'i don ci ltar zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of those that take the mental faculty as their objects?

original: yid la brten nas yid bde ba la sogs pa de dag yul la nye bar rgyu ba'i phyir ro zhes grag go //
analyzed: yid la brten nas yid bde ba la sogs pa de dag yul la nye bar rgyu ba'i phyir ro zhes grag go //
translated: It is well known that they are called those that take the mental faculty as their objects because mental satisfaction, etc. take objects in dependence on the mental faculty.

original: gzhan dag na re /🔽yul dag la yid nye bar rgyu bar byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re / yul dag la yid nye bar rgyu bar byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Others say:🔽They are called those that take the mental faculty as their objects because they cause the mental faculty to take objects.

original: tshor ba'i dbang gis yid yul dag la yang dang yang du rnam par rgyu ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: tshor ba'i dbang gis yid yul dag la yang dang yang du rnam par rgyu ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Because the mental faculty repeatedly engages objects through the power of feeling.

original: lus kyi tshor ba ci'i phyir yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: lus kyi tshor ba ci'i phyir yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is bodily feeling not those that take the mental faculty as their objects?

original: 'di ni yid kho na la brten pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni yid kho na la brten pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Because it is not dependent on the mental faculty alone.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir nye bar rgyu bar byed pa yang ma yin pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir nye bar rgyu bar byed pa yang ma yin pas mi rung ngo //
translated: Because they are nonconceptual, they are not motivators.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i bde ba ci'i phyir yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba'i nang dag tu ma smos she na /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i bde ba ci'i phyir yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba'i nang dag tu ma smos she na /
translated: Why is the pleasure of the third absorption not mentioned among the mental applications?

original: dang po 'dod pa'i khams na yid kyis pa'i bde ba'i dbang po med pa'i phyir dang / de'i mi mthun pa sdug bsngal gyi yid nye bar rgyu ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes grag go //🔽gal te 'di dag yid kyi @137a * //
analyzed: dang po 'dod pa'i khams na yid kyis pa'i bde ba'i dbang po med pa'i phyir dang / de'i mi mthun pa sdug bsngal gyi yid nye bar rgyu ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes grag go // gal te 'di dag yid kyi @137a * //
translated: It is said that in the first absorption, the faculty of mental pleasure does not exist in the desire realm, and the mental application of pain that is its opposite does not exist.

original: sa pa kho na zhig yin na /🔽'o na mdo las /
analyzed: sa pa kho na zhig yin na / 'o na mdo las /
translated: If these are only on the level of the mental faculty,🔽then how do you interpret the sutra that states:

original: mig gis gzugs dag mthong nas yid bde ba'i gnas lta bu'i gzugs rnams la nye bar rgyu'o zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gang gsungs pa de ji ltar drang /
analyzed: mig gis gzugs dag mthong nas yid bde ba'i gnas lta bu'i gzugs rnams la nye bar rgyu'o zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gang gsungs pa de ji ltar drang /
translated: Having seen forms with the eye, one pursues forms that are the basis of mental pleasure.

original: de ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs ltas mngon par bsgrubs pa nyid la dgongs te gsungs par zad kyi /
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs ltas mngon par bsgrubs pa nyid la dgongs te gsungs par zad kyi /
translated: This is stated from the perspective of the mental application that is established by the group of consciousnesses.

original: 'di dag ni yid kyi sa pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni yid kyi sa pa yin te /
translated: These are on the level of the mental faculty.

original: dper na mi sdug pa lta bu mig gi rnam par shes pas mngon par bsgrubs pa yang yin la /
analyzed: dper na mi sdug pa lta bu mig gi rnam par shes pas mngon par bsgrubs pa yang yin la /
translated: For example, the unpleasant is established by the eye consciousness.

original: yid kyi sa pa yang yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yid kyi sa pa yang yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the unpleasant object is established by the eye consciousness, but it is also on the level of the mental faculty.

original: gzhan yang mthong nas zhes bya ba nas reg nas zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa'i phyir de ni klan kar mi rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan yang mthong nas zhes bya ba nas reg nas zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa'i phyir de ni klan kar mi rung ba nyid do //
translated: Moreover, it is not correct to object that the sūtra says, “Having seen a form with the eye,” up to “having mentally known a mental object with the mind.”

original: gang gis ma mthong ba nas ma reg pa'i bar du nye bar rgyu ba de yang yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gis ma mthong ba nas ma reg pa'i bar du nye bar rgyu ba de yang yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba yin no //
translated: That which does not see up to that which does not mentally know is also mental application.

original: gzhan du na 'dod pa'i khams na gzugs kyi khams la dmigs pa dag kyang gzugs la sogs pa la nye bar rgyu ba yin par mi 'gyur la ;
analyzed: gzhan du na 'dod pa'i khams na gzugs kyi khams la dmigs pa dag kyang gzugs la sogs pa la nye bar rgyu ba yin par mi 'gyur la ;
translated: Otherwise, in the desire realm, those that focus on the form realm would not be mental applications on form and so on.

original: gzugs kyi khams na 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa dag kyang dri dang ro dang reg bya la nye bar rgyu ba yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa dag kyang dri dang ro dang reg bya la nye bar rgyu ba yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And in the form realm, those that focus on the desire realm would not be mental applications on smell, taste and tactility.

original: ji ltar ches gsal ba de ltar bshad de /
analyzed: ji ltar ches gsal ba de ltar bshad de /
translated: They are explained in terms of the clearest example.

original: gang gzugs dag mthong nas sgra rnams la nye bar rgyu ba de dag yang yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba yin mod kyi dbang po dang don rnam par chad pa'i sgo nas ji ltar mi 'chol ba de ltar bshad do //
analyzed: gang gzugs dag mthong nas sgra rnams la nye bar rgyu ba de dag yang yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba yin mod kyi dbang po dang don rnam par chad pa'i sgo nas ji ltar mi 'chol ba de ltar bshad do //
translated: When one sees visible forms and is attracted to sounds, this is indeed a mental application. But, in order to avoid confusion, we speak of the mental application as being distinguished according to the sense faculty and the object-field.

original: ci gzugs gang yid bde ba'i gnas lta bu kho na yin pa nas btang snyoms kyi gnas lta bu kho na yin pa'i bar yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci gzugs gang yid bde ba'i gnas lta bu kho na yin pa nas btang snyoms kyi gnas lta bu kho na yin pa'i bar yod dam zhe na /
translated: Are there visible forms that are exclusively a basis of satisfaction, etc.?

original: rgyud nges pas ni yod kyi dmigs pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyud nges pas ni yod kyi dmigs pas ni ma yin no //
translated: Yes, but not from the point of view of their intrinsic nature, but from the point of view of the person.🔽How many of these mental applications are related to the realm of desire?

original: yang yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba 'di dag las du zhig ni 'dod pa'i khams dang ldan pa yin de dag las kyang du zhig gi dmigs pa ni ci zhig yin /
analyzed: yang yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba 'di dag las du zhig ni 'dod pa'i khams dang ldan pa yin de dag las kyang du zhig gi dmigs pa ni ci zhig yin /
translated: How many of them have for their object the realm of desire?

original: de bzhin du gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i bar du brjod par bya zhe na /🔽smras pa / 'dod pa thams cad rang dmigs can //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i bar du brjod par bya zhe na / smras pa / 'dod pa thams cad rang dmigs can //
translated: And so on up to the formless realm?🔽All the mental applications have for their domain the realm of desire.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na ni bco brgyad po thams cad yod la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na ni bco brgyad po thams cad yod la /
translated: In the realm of desire, there are eighteen mental applications.

original: de dag thams cad kyi dmigs pa yang de yin no //🔽de dag nyid kyi /🔽spyod yul gzugs can bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyi dmigs pa yang de yin no // de dag nyid kyi / spyod yul gzugs can bcu gnyis so //
translated: All of them have the same object.🔽The twelve that have form for their domain

original: gzugs kyi khams ni bcu gnyis kyi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams ni bcu gnyis kyi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The realm of form is the object of twelve.

original: dri dang ro la nye bar rgya ba drug ma gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: dri dang ro la nye bar rgya ba drug ma gtogs pa ste /
translated: The six that are devoted to odor and taste are excluded.

original: de lta na de gnyis med pa'i @137b phyir ;
analyzed: de lta na de gnyis med pa'i @137b phyir ;
translated: Thus, because odor and taste are absent there,

original: gong ma gsum gyi /🔽spyod yul zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: gong ma gsum gyi / spyod yul zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: the three that are devoted to the body are also absent there.🔽The three that are devoted to the body are excluded.

original: gzugs med pa ni chos la nye bar rgyu ba gsum gyi dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa ni chos la nye bar rgyu ba gsum gyi dmigs pa yin te /
translated: The formless realm is the object of three that are devoted to mental objects.

original: de nas gzugs la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nas gzugs la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because form, etc., are absent there.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa bshad zin to //
translated: The discussion of those that are associated with the realm of desire is now complete.

original: gzugs dang ldan pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Those that are associated with the realm of form should be mentioned next.

original: de la re zhig /
analyzed: de la re zhig /
translated: In this regard,

original: bsam gtan ni /
analyzed: bsam gtan ni /
translated: the meditative development of the immeasurables

original: gnyis na bcu gnyis /🔽yid mi bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba rnams ma gtogs so //
analyzed: gnyis na bcu gnyis / yid mi bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba rnams ma gtogs so //
translated: In the first two, there are twelve.🔽The twelve that are devoted to the realm of desire are excluded.

original: bcu gnyis po de dag kyang 'dod par 'gro bas na 'dod 'gro rnams te /🔽'dod pa'i khams la dmigs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bcu gnyis po de dag kyang 'dod par 'gro bas na 'dod 'gro rnams te /🔽'dod pa'i khams la dmigs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: yul rnam par 'dzin pa'i don la yang 'gro ba sbyor ba mthong ste /
analyzed: yul rnam par 'dzin pa'i don la yang 'gro ba sbyor ba mthong ste /
translated: We see that the word gati is used in the sense of the object of grasping.

original: 'di ji ltar 'gro zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar 'gro zhe na /
translated: How is it used in this sense?

original: 'di ni 'di ltar 'gro'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di ltar 'gro'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: In the expression: “He goes in this way. ”

original: rang la dmigs brgyad /🔽gzugs kyi khams de nyid ni de dag gi rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: rang la dmigs brgyad / gzugs kyi khams de nyid ni de dag gi rang bzhin yin te /
translated: The realm of fine-materiality is the object of eight.

original: de ni yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba brgyad kyi dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba brgyad kyi dmigs pa yin te /
translated: The realm of fine-materiality is the object of eight of the mental applications:

original: dri dang ro la nye bar rgyu ba bzhi ma gtogs so //
analyzed: dri dang ro la nye bar rgyu ba bzhi ma gtogs so //
translated: excluding the four mental applications of the sense-sphere which have smell and taste for their cognitive object.

original: gzugs med pa gnyis kyi ste /🔽chos la nye bar rgyu ba dag gi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa gnyis kyi ste / chos la nye bar rgyu ba dag gi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The realm of immateriality is the object of two.🔽The realm of immateriality is the object of two mental applications of the realm of fine-materiality, namely, those which have the factors as their cognitive object.🔽Six in the second meditation.

original: bsam gtan gnyis na drug / bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi pa dag na ni btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba drug kho na yod kyi gzhan dag ni med do //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis na drug / bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi pa dag na ni btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba drug kho na yod kyi gzhan dag ni med do //
translated: In the third and fourth meditations, there are only six mental applications of equanimity, not the others.

original: de dag drug gi / dmigs pa ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de dag drug gi / dmigs pa ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: The sense-sphere is the object of these six.

original: 'dod pa'i khams ni drug car kyi yang dmigs pa yin no //🔽rang gi bzhi'i /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams ni drug car kyi yang dmigs pa yin no // rang gi bzhi'i /
translated: The sense-sphere is the object of the six mental applications of the realm of fine-materiality.

original: gzugs kyi khams ni bzhi yin te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams ni bzhi yin te /
translated: The realm of fine-materiality is the object of four.🔽The realm of fine-materiality is the object of four mental applications of the realm of fine-materiality, excluding the mental applications of smell and taste.

original: de na dri dang ro med pa'i phyir ro //🔽gong ma gcig gi dmigs pa yin /
analyzed: de na dri dang ro med pa'i phyir ro // gong ma gcig gi dmigs pa yin /
translated: because odor and taste are absent there.🔽The formless realm is the object of one.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams ni chos la nye bar rgyu ba gcig kho na'i dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams ni chos la nye bar rgyu ba gcig kho na'i dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The formless realm is the object of the single investigation of factors.

original: gzugs dang ldan pa dag bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa dag bshad zin to //
translated: The possession of form has been explained.

original: da ni gzugs med pa dang ldan pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni gzugs med pa dang ldan pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now we must explain the possession of the formless realm.

original: gzugs med nye bar bsdogs na bzhi //
analyzed: gzugs med nye bar bsdogs na bzhi //
translated: Four in the access to the formless realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i nyi bar bsdogs ni 'dir nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi nye bar bsdogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i nyi bar bsdogs ni 'dir nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi nye bar bsdogs pa yin te /
translated: The access to the formless realm is the access to the base of infinite space.

original: de na ni gzugs dang sgra dang reg bya dang chos la nye bar rgyu ba bzhi'o //
analyzed: de na ni gzugs dang sgra dang reg bya dang chos la nye bar rgyu ba bzhi'o //
translated: There are four investigations: of form, sound, tactility, and factors.

original: de dag kyang /
analyzed: de dag kyang /
translated: These four🔽are the objects of the access to the formless realm.

original: gzugs sgra'o // de dag gi dmigs pa ni bsam gtan bzhi pa yin te /🔽gang dag gi ltar na de rnam par chad pa la dmigs pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs sgra'o // de dag gi dmigs pa ni bsam gtan bzhi pa yin te / gang dag gi ltar na de rnam par chad pa la dmigs pa yod pa yin no //
translated: The fourth absorption is their object.🔽According to those who believe that the formless realm is discontinuous, the fourth absorption is their object.

original: gang dag gi ltar na ni de dag bzlums te dmigs pa de dag gi ltar @138a * //
analyzed: gang dag gi ltar na ni de dag bzlums te dmigs pa de dag gi ltar @138a * //
translated: According to those who believe that the formless realm is continuous, the fourth absorption and the three formless bases are their object.

original: na ni de na chos la nye bar rgyu ba 'dres pa la dmigs pa gcig kho na yod do //🔽gong mar 'gro ba gcig / de na gzugs med pa'i khams la dmigs pa ni gcig kho na ste /
analyzed: na ni de na chos la nye bar rgyu ba 'dres pa la dmigs pa gcig kho na yod do // gong mar 'gro ba gcig / de na gzugs med pa'i khams la dmigs pa ni gcig kho na ste /
translated: In the second meditation, there is only one, the one that has mixed objects.

original: chos la nye bar rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: chos la nye bar rgyu ba'o //
translated: One that goes to a higher stage.🔽In the second meditation, there is only one that has the formless realm as its object, namely, the investigation of factors.🔽In the actual basis, there is only one.

original: dngos gzhi na gcig / gzugs med pa'i dngos gzhi na ne chos la nye bar rgyu ba gcig kho na yod kyi gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: dngos gzhi na gcig / gzugs med pa'i dngos gzhi na ne chos la nye bar rgyu ba gcig kho na yod kyi gzhan ni med do //
translated: In the actual basis of the formless realm, there is only one investigation of factors, but there are none others.

original: de yang / rang yul can /
analyzed: de yang / rang yul can /
translated: And that has its own realm as its object.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams kho na la dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams kho na la dmigs pa yin te /
translated: It has only the formless realm as its object.

original: gzugs med pa'i dngos gzhi rnams kyi dmigs pa ni kha cig ma yin no zhes 'og nas bshad par bya'o //🔽yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba de dag kyang ;
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i dngos gzhi rnams kyi dmigs pa ni kha cig ma yin no zhes 'og nas bshad par bya'o // yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba de dag kyang ;
translated: The objects of the actual bases of the formless realm are not all objects, as will be explained later.

original: bco brgyad thams cad zag dang bcas //
analyzed: bco brgyad thams cad zag dang bcas //
translated: All eighteen are with-outflows.

original: zag pa med pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: None are without-outflows.

original: gang zhig du dag dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig du dag dang ldan zhe na /
translated: With how many of the investigations of factors is one endowed?

original: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems ma thob pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa thams cad dang ldan no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems ma thob pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa thams cad dang ldan no //
translated: Those born in the desire realm who have not obtained the wholesome thought of the form realm are endowed with all those of the desire realm.

original: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i sa pa ni dri dang ro la dmigs pa ma gtogs pa nyon mongs ba can brgyad brgyad dang ldan no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i sa pa ni dri dang ro la dmigs pa ma gtogs pa nyon mongs ba can brgyad brgyad dang ldan no //
translated: Those of the first and second absorption levels are endowed with eight each, excluding those that focus on smell and taste.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi pa'i sa pa ni bzhi bzhi dang ldan no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi pa'i sa pa ni bzhi bzhi dang ldan no //
translated: Those of the third and fourth absorption levels are endowed with four each.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa ni nyon mongs pa can gcig kho na dang ldan no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa ni nyon mongs pa can gcig kho na dang ldan no //
translated: Those of the formless realm are endowed with just one afflicted thought.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems thob pa 'dod chags dang ma bral ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa thams cad dang ldan no //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems thob pa 'dod chags dang ma bral ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa thams cad dang ldan no //
translated: Those who have obtained the wholesome thought of the form realm but are not free from attachment are endowed with all those of the desire realm.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa ni bcu dang ldan te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa ni bcu dang ldan te /
translated: Those of the first absorption level are endowed with ten.

original: yid bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba dri dang ro la dmigs pa ma gtogs pa nyon mongs pa can bzhi dang / mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa'i btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba drug dang ldan no //
analyzed: yid bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba dri dang ro la dmigs pa ma gtogs pa nyon mongs pa can bzhi dang / mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa'i btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba drug dang ldan no //
translated: They are associated with four afflicted mental activities: the four mental activities of equanimity that focus on smell and taste in the realm of desire, and the six mental activities of equanimity in the stage of unrestricted access concentration to the first meditative absorption.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dang / gzugs med pa las skyes pa rnams dang ni snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dang / gzugs med pa las skyes pa rnams dang ni snga ma bzhin te /
translated: Those born in the second, third, and fourth meditative absorptions and in the formless realm are associated with the same mental activities as those born in the first meditative absorption.

original: srol 'dis lhag ma yang khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: srol 'dis lhag ma yang khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The remaining mental activities should be understood in the same way.

original: bsam gtan du skyes pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i btang snyoms chos la nye bar rgyu ba sbrul pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa gcig dang ldan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan du skyes pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i btang snyoms chos la nye bar rgyu ba sbrul pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa gcig dang ldan par rig par bya'o //
translated: Those born in the meditative absorptions are associated with one mental activity of equanimity that focuses on factors in the realm of desire, which is associated with the mind governing creativity.

original: gzhan dag na re yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba rnams kyi don bye brag tu smra ba lta bu 'di yang yod mod kyi mdo'i don ni gzhan du snang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba rnams kyi don bye brag tu smra ba lta bu 'di yang yod mod kyi mdo'i don ni gzhan du snang ngo //
translated: Others say that although this explanation of the mental activities is similar to that of the Vaibhāṣikas, the meaning of the scripture appears to be different.

original: gang zhig gang las 'dod chags dang bral ba de ni dmigs pa de la nye @138b bar rgyu bar rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gang las 'dod chags dang bral ba de ni dmigs pa de la nye @138b bar rgyu bar rig pa ma yin no //
translated: One who is free from attachment to a certain object does not experience that object.

original: de lta bas na yid bde ba la sogs pa zag pa dang bcas pa dag kyang thams cad ni nye bar rgyu ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na yid bde ba la sogs pa zag pa dang bcas pa dag kyang thams cad ni nye bar rgyu ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus not all mental satisfaction, etc., that is contaminated is a near-­dhyāna.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams yin te /
translated: It is the defiled mental satisfaction, etc.,

original: de dag gis yid yul rnams la nye bar rgyu bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis yid yul rnams la nye bar rgyu bar byed pa'o //
translated: because the mind is made to move toward objects by those.

original: ji ltar nye bar rgyu bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar nye bar rgyu bar byed ce na /
translated: How does it move toward them?

original: rjes su chags par byed /
analyzed: rjes su chags par byed /
translated: It moves toward them by being attached to them,

original: so sor ma brtags pa yang btang snyoms su byed pa ste /
analyzed: so sor ma brtags pa yang btang snyoms su byed pa ste /
translated: and by being indifferent to them without examining them.

original: gang dag gi gnyen por rtag tu yod pa drug gnas pa yin pa ste /
analyzed: gang dag gi gnyen por rtag tu yod pa drug gnas pa yin pa ste /
translated: The six that are always present are the antidotes to those.🔽The sūtra says:

original: mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas yid bde bar yang mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas yid bde bar yang mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: When the eye sees forms, it does not cause mental satisfaction,

original: yid mi bde bar yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: yid mi bde bar yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: it does not cause mental dissatisfaction,

original: dran pa dang ldan zhing shes bzhin du btang snyoms su gnas so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan zhing shes bzhin du btang snyoms su gnas so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: it causes the positing of mindfulness and the positing of full awareness.

original: de bzhin du yid kyis chos rnams shes nas zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yid kyis chos rnams shes nas zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Likewise, the Sūtra says, “Having known things with the mind.

original: dgra bcom pa la yang 'jig rten pa'i dge ba'i chos la dmigs pa'i yid bde ba med pa ma yin pas 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i yid nye bar rgyu ba de dgag pa ma yin par bde bar mngon no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa la yang 'jig rten pa'i dge ba'i chos la dmigs pa'i yid bde ba med pa ma yin pas 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i yid nye bar rgyu ba de dgag pa ma yin par bde bar mngon no zhes zer ro //
translated: ” But this is not to deny that the arhat has the mental satisfaction of focusing on mundane virtuous dharmas.

original: yang yid bde ba la sogs pa de dag nyid zhen ba la brten pa dang / nges par 'byung ba nyid la brten pa'i bye brag gis ston pa'i bka' sum cu rtsa drug tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang yid bde ba la sogs pa de dag nyid zhen ba la brten pa dang / nges par 'byung ba nyid la brten pa'i bye brag gis ston pa'i bka' sum cu rtsa drug tu 'gyur te /
translated: These mental satisfactions and so on are also classified as thirty six types of teacher’s words, based on the distinction between those that are dependent on attachment and those that are dependent on renunciation.

original: de dag gi bye brag ston pas bka' stsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi bye brag ston pas bka' stsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called the teacher’s words because the Teacher declared their distinctions.

original: de la zhen pa la brten pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa can dag go //
analyzed: de la zhen pa la brten pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa can dag go //
translated: Those dependent on attachment are afflicted.

original: nges par 'byung ba la brten pa rnams ni dge ba dag yin no //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba la brten pa rnams ni dge ba dag yin no //
translated: Those dependent on renunciation are virtuous.

original: de ltar na tshor ba dag ces bya bar sred pa'i yan lag 'di'i rab tu dbye ba ni du ma yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na tshor ba dag ces bya bar sred pa'i yan lag 'di'i rab tu dbye ba ni du ma yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the members of craving, which is called “sensation,” have many subdivisions.

original: yan lag lhag ma rnams ni yang mi brjod do //
analyzed: yan lag lhag ma rnams ni yang mi brjod do //
translated: The other members are not mentioned.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: bshad dang 'chad par 'gyur ba gzhan //
analyzed: bshad dang 'chad par 'gyur ba gzhan //
translated: Because they have been explained and will be explained.

original: 'dir yan lag kha cig ni bshad zin /
analyzed: 'dir yan lag kha cig ni bshad zin /
translated: Some members have already been explained here.

original: kha cig ni 'og nas 'chad de /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'og nas 'chad de /
translated: Others will be explained later.

original: de la re zhig rnam par shes pa ni /
analyzed: de la re zhig rnam par shes pa ni /
translated: Among them, consciousness has already been explained as follows:

original: rnam par shes pa so sor rnam rig pa /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa so sor rnam rig pa /
translated: Consciousness is the individual’s perception.

original: yid kyi skye mched kyang de yin zhes bshad zin to //🔽skye mched drug kyang /
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched kyang de yin zhes bshad zin to // skye mched drug kyang /
translated: It is also the mental faculty.🔽The six sense bases have already been explained as follows:

original: de dag rnams kyi rnam shes rten mig la sogs pa gzugs dang ba rnams zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyi rnam shes rten mig la sogs pa gzugs dang ba rnams zhes bshad zin to //
translated: The eye and the others are the basis of consciousness of form.

original: 'du byed dang srid pa ni las kyi mdzod kyi gnas nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du byed dang srid pa ni las kyi mdzod kyi gnas nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The members of compositional activity and becoming will be explained in the chapter on karma.

original: sred pa dang len pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i gnas kyi mdzod kyi gnas nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sred pa dang len pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i gnas kyi mdzod kyi gnas nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The members of craving and grasping will be explained in the chapter on the afflictions.

original: sngar rten cing @139a * //
analyzed: sngar rten cing @139a * //
translated: Previously, it was said that the self is not the aggregates,🔽

original: 'brel par 'byung ba de yang mdor bsdu na nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / gzhi rnams so zhes bstan pa /
analyzed: 'brel par 'byung ba de yang mdor bsdu na nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / gzhi rnams so zhes bstan pa /
translated: Previously, it was taught that dependent origination is in brief the afflictions, actions, and the basis.

original: 'dir ni nyon mongs bon bzhin //
analyzed: 'dir ni nyon mongs bon bzhin //
translated: Here, the afflictions are like seeds,

original: klu bzhin rtsva bzhin ljon shing bzhin //
analyzed: klu bzhin rtsva bzhin ljon shing bzhin //
translated: like a naga, like grass, like a tree,

original: de bzhin shun pa bzhin du 'dod //
analyzed: de bzhin shun pa bzhin du 'dod //
translated: and like a husk.

original: 'di'i sa bon la sogs pa dang chos mthun pa gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i sa bon la sogs pa dang chos mthun pa gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What are the similarities between the afflictions and seeds, etc.?

original: dper na sa bon las sdong bu dang / lo ma la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na sa bon las sdong bu dang / lo ma la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, a sprout, leaves, etc., are produced from a seed.

original: nyon mongs pa las kyang nyon mongs pa dang las dang gzhi rnams skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa las kyang nyon mongs pa dang las dang gzhi rnams skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the afflictions, actions, and the basis are produced from the afflictions.

original: dper na klu gnas pa'i mtsho ni skam par mi 'gyur ba ltar /
analyzed: dper na klu gnas pa'i mtsho ni skam par mi 'gyur ba ltar /
translated: For example, a lake inhabited by nagas does not dry up.

original: nyon mongs pa'i klan ka gnas pa'i skye ba'i mtsho yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i klan ka gnas pa'i skye ba'i mtsho yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: In the same way, the lake of birth inhabited by the nagas of the afflictions does not dry up.

original: dper na nags tshal rtsa ba nas ma phyung ba rnams ni bcad kyang slar skye bar 'gyur pa ltar /
analyzed: dper na nags tshal rtsa ba nas ma phyung ba rnams ni bcad kyang slar skye bar 'gyur pa ltar /
translated: For example, a forest that has not been pulled up by the roots will grow again even if it is cut down.

original: nyon mongs pa rtsa ba nas ma bton pa'i 'gro ba rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rtsa ba nas ma bton pa'i 'gro ba rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same is true of beings whose afflictions have not been uprooted.

original: dper na shing ljon pa rnams dus dus su me tog dang 'bras bu rnams skyed par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na shing ljon pa rnams dus dus su me tog dang 'bras bu rnams skyed par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as trees produce flowers and fruits at different times,

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kyang lan cig ma yin par nyon mongs pa dang las dang gzhi rnams kyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyang lan cig ma yin par nyon mongs pa dang las dang gzhi rnams kyi rgyu yin no //
translated: so too the afflictions are the cause of afflictions, actions, and bases, not just once, but again and again.

original: dper na shun pa dang bcas pa'i 'bras thug po che rnams ni skye bar nus kyi 'ba' zhig dag ni ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na shun pa dang bcas pa'i 'bras thug po che rnams ni skye bar nus kyi 'ba' zhig dag ni ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as grain with its husk can produce sprouts, but not when it is shelled,

original: nyon mongs pa'i thob pa'i shun pa dang bcas pa'i las skye ba gzhan du skye bar nus kyi 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i thob pa'i shun pa dang bcas pa'i las skye ba gzhan du skye bar nus kyi 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
translated: so too, action can produce a new existence when it is accompanied by the husk of the afflictions, but not by itself.

original: de ltar na re zhig nyon mongs pa sa bon la sogs pa dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig nyon mongs pa sa bon la sogs pa dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the afflictions should be understood as being like a seed, etc.

original: las ni shun bcas 'bras dang 'dra //
analyzed: las ni shun bcas 'bras dang 'dra //
translated: Action is like grain with its husk.

original: de bzhin sman dang me tog bzhin //
analyzed: de bzhin sman dang me tog bzhin //
translated: It is also like a medicine and a flower.

original: 'di la shun pa yod pas na shun pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la shun pa yod pas na shun pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: It is accompanied by the husk because it has a husk.

original: shun pa lta bu'i nyon mongs pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: shun pa lta bu'i nyon mongs pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: The defilement which is like the husk has been explained.

original: da ni shun pa dang bcas pa'i 'bras bu lta bu'i las brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni shun pa dang bcas pa'i 'bras bu lta bu'i las brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, action which is like the grain accompanied by the husk will be discussed.

original: dper na 'bru dang sman dag 'bras bu smin pa mthar phyin pa dang ldan pa de bzhin du las rnams kyang rnam par smin nas yang rnam par smin pa mngon par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na 'bru dang sman dag 'bras bu smin pa mthar phyin pa dang ldan pa de bzhin du las rnams kyang rnam par smin nas yang rnam par smin pa mngon par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as the grain and the medicine have their fruit at the end of their development, so too the actions, once their retribution is achieved, do not produce any other retribution.

original: dper na me tog 'bras bu bskyed par bya ba la nye ba'i rgyu yin pa ltar las rnams kyang rnam par smin pa bskyed par bya ba la de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na me tog 'bras bu bskyed par bya ba la nye ba'i rgyu yin pa ltar las rnams kyang rnam par smin pa bskyed par bya ba la de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as the flower is the immediate cause of the fruit, so too is action in regard to the production of its retribution.

original: gzhi ni bza' btung grub pa bzhin //
analyzed: gzhi ni bza' btung grub pa bzhin //
translated: The basis is like cooked food and drink.

original: dper na bza' ba dang btung ba grub zin pa yongs su longs spyad par bya ba 'ba' zhig yin gyi yang bskyed par bya @139b ba ma yin pa ltar rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba'i gzhi yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: dper na bza' ba dang btung ba grub zin pa yongs su longs spyad par bya ba 'ba' zhig yin gyi yang bskyed par bya @139b ba ma yin pa ltar rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba'i gzhi yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: For example, it is like food and drink that are already produced and are only to be fully enjoyed, not to be produced again.

original: rnam par smin pa las tshe rabs gzhan dag tu rnam par smin pa gzhan dang 'brel pa ni med de /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las tshe rabs gzhan dag tu rnam par smin pa gzhan dang 'brel pa ni med de /
translated: The basis called karmic maturation is also like that, because there is no connection to another karmic maturation in other lives from a karmic maturation.

original: gal te 'brel par 'gyur na ni thar par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'brel par 'gyur na ni thar par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were a connection, there would be no liberation.

original: yang tshe'i rgyun de de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba na 'di lta ste srid pa bar ma dang / skye ba'i srid pa dang / dus snga ma'i srid pa dang / 'chi ba'i srid pa dang / srid pa bzhi las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: yang tshe'i rgyun de de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba na 'di lta ste srid pa bar ma dang / skye ba'i srid pa dang / dus snga ma'i srid pa dang / 'chi ba'i srid pa dang / srid pa bzhi las mi 'da' ste /
translated: Moreover, when the continuum of life is thus dependently arisen, it does not transcend four existences: the intermediate existence, the birth existence, the prior existence and the death existence.

original: de dag ni bshad zin to //🔽srid pa bzhi po de dag las gcig tu /
analyzed: de dag ni bshad zin to // srid pa bzhi po de dag las gcig tu /
translated: They have already been explained.

original: skye ba'i srid pa nyon mongs can //
analyzed: skye ba'i srid pa nyon mongs can //
translated: From among those four existences, one is afflicted.

original: nyon mongs pa gang gis she na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gang gis she na /
translated: By which affliction?

original: rang gis ba'i nyon mongs kun //🔽chos mngon pa ba rnams na re skye ba'i srid pa sa gang yin pa de'i sa pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: rang gis ba'i nyon mongs kun // chos mngon pa ba rnams na re skye ba'i srid pa sa gang yin pa de'i sa pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis yin pa nyid de /
translated: All the defilements of the stage of existence in which the intermediate beings are born defile them.

original: gang gis nying mtshams sbyor bar dgag par bya ba'i nyon mongs pa de ni med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gang gis nying mtshams sbyor bar dgag par bya ba'i nyon mongs pa de ni med do zhes zer ro //
translated: The Abhidharmikas say: All the defilements of the stage of existence in which birth is to take place defile the intermediate beings.🔽There is no defilement that would cause them to take up birth.

original: nyon mongs pa can rnams kho nas yin gyi kun nas dkris pa chig rkya thub pa rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can rnams kho nas yin gyi kun nas dkris pa chig rkya thub pa rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is only the defilements that are autonomous, not the envelopments.

original: gnas skabs de zhan pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gnas skabs de zhan pa yin mod kyi /
translated: This is the weak point of this stage.

original: gang zhig gis gang la yang dang yang du dang / nye bar dpyad pa de la ni de'i tshe nyon mongs pa de nyid nye bar gnas par 'gyur te /🔽sngon 'phangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zhig gis gang la yang dang yang du dang / nye bar dpyad pa de la ni de'i tshe nyon mongs pa de nyid nye bar gnas par 'gyur te / sngon 'phangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The defilement that is most habitual for a given person is the one that will manifest itself at the moment of death.🔽This is the defilement that will cause the intermediate existence to manifest itself.

original: srid pa bar ma nying mtshams sbyor ba yang de bzhin du gdon mi za bar nyon mongs pa can du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma nying mtshams sbyor ba yang de bzhin du gdon mi za bar nyon mongs pa can du rig par bya'o //
translated: The same holds for the entry of the intermediate existence into the womb.

original: gzhan rnam gsum mo //
analyzed: gzhan rnam gsum mo //
translated: The other two types of action, i.e., action that produces the receptacle world and action that produces the complex of the sense-faculties, are, in their intrinsic nature, morally neutral.

original: srid pa bar ma la sogs pa srid pa gzhan gsum ni dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang gsum char yin no //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma la sogs pa srid pa gzhan gsum ni dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang gsum char yin no //
translated: The other three existences, namely intermediate existence, etc., are wholesome, unwholesome, nondefined.

original: yang srid pa 'di rnams las gang zhig gang dang ldan zhe na /🔽gzugs med gsum /
analyzed: yang srid pa 'di rnams las gang zhig gang dang ldan zhe na / gzugs med gsum /
translated: Which existence is related to which realm?

original: srid pa bar ma ma gtogs te /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma ma gtogs te /
translated: Three existences in the realm of immateriality.🔽The intermediate existence is excluded.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams ni gang du phyin par bya ba'i phyir srid pa bar ma mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba nas gzhan du na yongs su chad pa ni med do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams ni gang du phyin par bya ba'i phyir srid pa bar ma mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba nas gzhan du na yongs su chad pa ni med do //
translated: In the realm of immateriality, there is no intermediate existence that would go to the place of its plane of existence.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams dag gis ni chad pa ma smos pas srid pa bzhi po thams cad yong do zhes bya bar gnas par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams dag gis ni chad pa ma smos pas srid pa bzhi po thams cad yong do zhes bya bar gnas par byas pa yin no //
translated: The realm of desire and the realm of finemateriality are not mentioned in the above verse. It is understood that they include all four existences.

original: sems can rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ji lta ba bzhin rgyas par bshad zin to //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ji lta ba bzhin rgyas par bshad zin to //
translated: We have explained at length the dependent origination of sentient beings.

original: yang sems can rnams ji ltar gnas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang sems can rnams ji ltar gnas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How do sentient beings live?

original: 'gro ba zas kyis gnas pa yin //🔽bcom @140a * //
analyzed: 'gro ba zas kyis gnas pa yin //🔽bcom @140a * //
translated: Sentient beings live by means of nutriment.

original: ldan 'das nyid kyis mngon par mkhyen cing mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos gcig bka' stsal pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ldan 'das nyid kyis mngon par mkhyen cing mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos gcig bka' stsal pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The Blessed One, having directly known and realized, taught one Dharma:

original: sems can thams cad ni zas kyis gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni mdo'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad ni zas kyis gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni mdo'i tshig yin no //
translated: All sentient beings abide through nutriment.

original: zas rnams kyang gang dag ce na /
analyzed: zas rnams kyang gang dag ce na /
translated: What are the nutriments?

original: zas ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: zas ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are four nutriments:
