original: kham gyi zas ni rags pa dang phra ba'o //
analyzed: kham gyi zas ni rags pa dang phra ba'o //
translated: Coarse and subtle nutritive essence.

original: phra ba ni srid pa bar ma rnams kyi yin te /
analyzed: phra ba ni srid pa bar ma rnams kyi yin te /
translated: The subtle one is that of intermediate beings,

original: dri za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they consume odors.

original: lha rnams dang / bskal pa dang po pa rnams kyi yang yin te /
analyzed: lha rnams dang / bskal pa dang po pa rnams kyi yang yin te /
translated: It is also that of the gods and those in the first eon,

original: bye ma dag gi nang du til mar blugs pa bzhin du yan lag rnams kyi nang du 'jug pas rgyu mthun pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bye ma dag gi nang du til mar blugs pa bzhin du yan lag rnams kyi nang du 'jug pas rgyu mthun pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it enters the limbs like sesame oil poured into sand, and there is no excrement.

original: yang na phra mo rnams kyi yin bas phra mo ste /
analyzed: yang na phra mo rnams kyi yin bas phra mo ste /
translated: Or, it is subtle because it is that of subtle beings,

original: byis pa dang / drod gsher las skye ba la sogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: byis pa dang / drod gsher las skye ba la sogs pa'i'o //
translated: that is, of infants, those born from heat and moisture, and so on.

original: reg pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: reg pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: Contact is the second.

original: yid la sems pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: yid la sems pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: Mental intention is the third.

original: rnam par shes pa'i zas ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i zas ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is consciousness as nutriment.

original: de la kham gyi zas ni 'dod pa na //
analyzed: de la kham gyi zas ni 'dod pa na //
translated: The first is only in the realm of desire.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na ni med do //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na ni med do //
translated: It is absent in the realms of form and of the formless.

original: de'i 'dod chags dang bral ba dag der skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'dod chags dang bral ba dag der skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Beings who are detached from the realm of desire are reborn in these two realms.

original: de yang / skye mched gsum gyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de yang / skye mched gsum gyi bdag nyid do //
translated: It is made up of three sense-spheres.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dri dang ro dang reg bya'i skye mched rnams ni sna dang / lce dang lus kyis kham du bcad nas kham du byas te mid pa'i phyir thams cad kham gyi zas kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dri dang ro dang reg bya'i skye mched rnams ni sna dang / lce dang lus kyis kham du bcad nas kham du byas te mid pa'i phyir thams cad kham gyi zas kho na yin no //
translated: The sense-spheres of odor, taste and tangible are, in the realm of desire, always gross nutriment, for one swallows them after having cut them up with the teeth.

original: grib ma dang / nyi ma dang / me dang / 'od dag la yod pa de dag ji ltar zas nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: grib ma dang / nyi ma dang / me dang / 'od dag la yod pa de dag ji ltar zas nyid yin zhe na /
translated: But how can shadow, light, fire and sun be nutriment?🔽The Vaibhāṣikas say: because they are the principal cause of the growth of beings.🔽But, in this hypothesis, the shadow, etc.🔽would be nutriment in the same way that food is nutriment.

original: 'di ni phal che bar bstan pa yin no zhes grag go //
analyzed: 'di ni phal che bar bstan pa yin no zhes grag go //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas answer: the expression “gross nutriment” refers to the majority of cases.

original: gang dag mi mid la gnas par yang byed pa de dag kyang zas phra mo yin te /
analyzed: gang dag mi mid la gnas par yang byed pa de dag kyang zas phra mo yin te /
translated: But, in fact, that which is not swallowed but which, by its presence, is useful to beings, is subtle nutriment.

original: khrus dang lus mnye ba bzhin no //
analyzed: khrus dang lus mnye ba bzhin no //
translated: This is the case for the shadow, etc.

original: ci'i phyir gzugs kyi skye mched zas ma yin //
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzugs kyi skye mched zas ma yin //
translated: Why is the visible form sense-sphere not food?

original: de yang kham du byas nas mid par ni byed do zhe na /
analyzed: de yang kham du byas nas mid par ni byed do zhe na /
translated: But it is food when it is swallowed after being made into morsels.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched ma yin des //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched ma yin des //
translated: It is not food,

original: rang dbang grol la mi phan phyir //🔽zas zhes bya ba ni gang dbang po dang / 'byung ba chen po rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa yin na gzugs kyi skye mched ni med pa'i tshe rang gi dbang po'am /
analyzed: rang dbang grol la mi phan phyir // zas zhes bya ba ni gang dbang po dang / 'byung ba chen po rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa yin na gzugs kyi skye mched ni med pa'i tshe rang gi dbang po'am /
translated: because it does not benefit that which is independent and liberated.

original: de'i 'byung ba chen po rnams la phan mi 'dogs na yul ma yin pa'i phyir gzhan dang gzhan dag la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: de'i 'byung ba chen po rnams la phan mi 'dogs na yul ma yin pa'i phyir gzhan dang gzhan dag la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: Food is that which benefits the faculties and the fundamental material elements. But when the visible form sense-sphere is absent, it does not benefit either the faculty itself or the fundamental material elements of the faculty. How much less so does it benefit other faculties and other fundamental material elements.

original: gang gi tshe mthong ba na bde ba dang / yid bde bar byed pa de'i tshe yang de la dmigs pa'i bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa zas yin gyi @140b gzugs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mthong ba na bde ba dang / yid bde bar byed pa de'i tshe yang de la dmigs pa'i bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa zas yin gyi @140b gzugs ni ma yin no //
translated: When one sees something that gives rise to pleasure and satisfaction, it is the contact that is conducive to pleasure that is food, not the visible form.

original: grol ba'i phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa zas shin tu yid du mi 'ong ba mthong ba rnams la yang phan 'dogs pa med pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: grol ba'i phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa zas shin tu yid du mi 'ong ba mthong ba rnams la yang phan 'dogs pa med pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: Also, because they do not benefit those who are liberated, namely, nonreturners and arhats, when they see food that is extremely unappealing.

original: reg dang sems pa rnam shes ni //
analyzed: reg dang sems pa rnam shes ni //
translated: Contact, intention, and consciousness

original: zag bcas zas yin gsum dag na //
analyzed: zag bcas zas yin gsum dag na //
translated: are food that is appropriated.

original: reg pa gsum 'dus pa las byung ba dang / sems pa yid kyi las dang / rnam par shes pa zag pa dang bcas pa dag kho na zas yin te /
analyzed: reg pa gsum 'dus pa las byung ba dang / sems pa yid kyi las dang / rnam par shes pa zag pa dang bcas pa dag kho na zas yin te /
translated: Contact that arises from the union of the three, intention, which is mental karma, and consciousness that is associated with them are food that is appropriated.

original: khams gsum char na yang yod de /
analyzed: khams gsum char na yang yod de /
translated: They exist in the three realms.

original: ci'i phyir zag pa med pa rnams ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zag pa med pa rnams ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are uncontaminated states not food?

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re 'di ltar srid pa gso bar byed pa'i don ni zas kyi don yin na de dag ni srid pa zad par bya ba'i phyir skyes pa dag yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re 'di ltar srid pa gso bar byed pa'i don ni zas kyi don yin na de dag ni srid pa zad par bya ba'i phyir skyes pa dag yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Vaibhasikas say: Food has the meaning of nourishing existence, but they are generated to eliminate existence.

original: gzhan yang mdo las /
analyzed: gzhan yang mdo las /
translated: Moreover, a sutra states:

original: sems can byung ba rnams gnas par byed pa dang / 'tsho bar byed pa dang / srid pa tshol ba rnams la phan par byed pa yin no zhes gsungs nas zag pa med pa'i chos rnams ni de lta ma yin pas zas dag ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can byung ba rnams gnas par byed pa dang / 'tsho bar byed pa dang / srid pa tshol ba rnams la phan par byed pa yin no zhes gsungs nas zag pa med pa'i chos rnams ni de lta ma yin pas zas dag ma yin no //
translated: But the factors of existence which are not subject to decay are not nutriments.

original: re zhig byung ba ni sems can skyes pa rnams zhes bya bar yang shes na /
analyzed: re zhig byung ba ni sems can skyes pa rnams zhes bya bar yang shes na /
translated: We have seen that the first nutriment is the cause of the duration of sentient beings who have already been born.

original: srid pa tshol ba rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: srid pa tshol ba rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of the benefit of those who are seeking existence?

original: yid las byung dang srid tshol dang // dri za srid pa bar ma dang // 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: yid las byung dang srid tshol dang // dri za srid pa bar ma dang // 'grub pa'o //
translated: The intermediate existence, the gandharva, is the cause of the search for existence.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis srid pa bar ma ni brjod pa 'di dag gis gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis srid pa bar ma ni brjod pa 'di dag gis gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One has taught the intermediate existence by means of these expressions.

original: de ni yid las skyes pa'i phyir yid las byung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni yid las skyes pa'i phyir yid las byung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called manojava, “born from the mind,” because it is produced by the mind.

original: phyi'i khu chu dang khrag la sogs pas cung zad kyang rgyur byas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi'i khu chu dang khrag la sogs pas cung zad kyang rgyur byas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not produced by any external cause, semen, blood, etc.

original: srid pa tshol ba'i ngang tshul can yin pa'i phyir srid pa tshol ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa tshol ba'i ngang tshul can yin pa'i phyir srid pa tshol ba'o //
translated: It is called bhavatrsna, “thirst for existence,” because it is of the nature of the search for a new existence.

original: dri za ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: dri za ba'i phyir na /
translated: the odors of the womb.

original: dri za'o // skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir mngon par 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: dri za'o // skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir mngon par 'grub pa ste /
translated: They are called “those who are in the process of becoming” abhinirvṛtti because they are about to be born.

original: mdo las / gnod pa dang bcas pa'i lus mngon par grub nas gnod pa dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo las / gnod pa dang bcas pa'i lus mngon par grub nas gnod pa dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A sūtra says, Having actualized a body that is subject to injury, they are born in a world that is subject to injury.

original: de bzhin du mdo las /
analyzed: de bzhin du mdo las /
translated: A sūtra declares:

original: gang gis mngon par 'grub pa'i kun du sbyor ba ni spangs la skye ba'i kun du sbyor ba ni ma yin pa'i gang zag kyang yod do zhes bya ba mu bzhi gsungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang gis mngon par 'grub pa'i kun du sbyor ba ni spangs la skye ba'i kun du sbyor ba ni ma yin pa'i gang zag kyang yod do zhes bya ba mu bzhi gsungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: There are four possibilities: those who abandon the fetters that actualize but not the fetters of birth; those who abandon the fetters of birth but not the fetters that actualize; those who abandon both; and those who do not abandon either.

original: mu dang po ni phyir mi 'ong ba khams gnyis las 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: mu dang po ni phyir mi 'ong ba khams gnyis las 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: The first possibility is nonreturners who are free from attachment to both realms.

original: gnyis pa ni bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: The second is those who attain nirvāṇa in the intermediate state.

original: gsum pa ni dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: The third is arhats.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The fourth is those not included in the above.

original: yang na byung ba ni dgra bcom pa'o //🔽srid pa @141a * //
analyzed: yang na byung ba ni dgra bcom pa'o //🔽srid pa @141a * //
translated: Alternatively, those who have arisen are arhats.

original: tshol ba rnams ni srid pa dang bcas pa dag go //🔽yang zas du zhig ni sems can byung ba rnams gnas par byed pa yin /
analyzed: tshol ba rnams ni srid pa dang bcas pa dag go // yang zas du zhig ni sems can byung ba rnams gnas par byed pa yin /
translated: The searchers are those who are in the realm of desire.🔽How many nutriments contribute to the survival of sentient beings who have already arisen?

original: du zhig ni srid pa tshol ba rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa yin zhe na //
analyzed: du zhig ni srid pa tshol ba rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa yin zhe na //
translated: How many contribute to the search for existence?

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re thams cad kyang gnyi ga yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re thams cad kyang gnyi ga yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say: All four contribute to both.

original: kham gyi zas kyang de la chags pa rnams kyi yang 'byung bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: kham gyi zas kyang de la chags pa rnams kyi yang 'byung bar byed pa yin te /
translated: For, even though attached to it, the nutriment of matter contributes to the continuation of those who have already arisen,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis zas bzhi ni nad dang / 'bras dang / zug rngu'i rtsa ba yin no /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis zas bzhi ni nad dang / 'bras dang / zug rngu'i rtsa ba yin no /
translated: because the Blessed One said: “The four nutriments are the root of sickness, abscesses, and thorns,🔽and the condition for old age and death.

original: rga shi'i rkyen yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rga shi'i rkyen yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The condition of aging and death is said to be birth.🔽

original: yid la sems pa yang 'dir gnas par byed pa yin par snang ste /
analyzed: yid la sems pa yang 'dir gnas par byed pa yin par snang ste /
translated: Mental intention also contributes to the survival of sentient beings,

original: 'di skad du lo nyes kyis nyen pa'i pha zhig gis thal ba'i rkyal ba kha thur mas gtur te phye yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du lo nyes kyis nyen pa'i pha zhig gis thal ba'i rkyal ba kha thur mas gtur te phye yin no //
translated: because a father, tormented by hunger, was able to survive by thinking that his son was a piece of meat.

original: bar du bu gnyis shig yid ches par byas ba dang / de gnyis kyang de la rtog par byed cing ring mo zhig tu gnas par gyur to //
analyzed: bar du bu gnyis shig yid ches par byas ba dang / de gnyis kyang de la rtog par byed cing ring mo zhig tu gnas par gyur to //
translated: In the middle, two sons were convinced, and they too were led to reflect on it and remained there for a long time.

original: gcig gis kha phye nas thal ba yin no snyam ste re ba med par gyur pa dang shi'o /
analyzed: gcig gis kha phye nas thal ba yin no snyam ste re ba med par gyur pa dang shi'o /
translated: One opened it and thinking it was ashes, lost hope and died.

original: yang rgya mtshor gru chag ba'i mi zhig thang yin no snyam nas dbu ba'i phung po chen po zhig gi drung du song ste /
analyzed: yang rgya mtshor gru chag ba'i mi zhig thang yin no snyam nas dbu ba'i phung po chen po zhig gi drung du song ste /
translated: Also, it is said that a man whose boat was wrecked in the ocean thought it was land and went to a great mass of foam.🔽Smelling it, he lost hope and died.

original: de la kun du bsnams nas re ba med pa dang shi'o zhes grag go zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de la kun du bsnams nas re ba med pa dang shi'o zhes grag go zhes brjod do //
translated: Also, in the Enumeration of Beings, it says:

original: 'gro ba'i rnam grangs las kyang rgya mtsho chen po nas srog chags che long rnams chu nang nas skam la 'thon te bye ma can gyi thang la sgong rnams bzhag nas bye mas bkab ste slar yang rgya mtsho'i nang du 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rnam grangs las kyang rgya mtsho chen po nas srog chags che long rnams chu nang nas skam la 'thon te bye ma can gyi thang la sgong rnams bzhag nas bye mas bkab ste slar yang rgya mtsho'i nang du 'gro'o //
translated: From the great ocean, large creatures come out of the water onto the sandy shore, lay their eggs, cover them with sand, and return to the ocean.

original: de la ma gang dag gis sgo nga las brtsams te dran pas ma brjed pa'i sgo du de dag ni 'drul bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la ma gang dag gis sgo nga las brtsams te dran pas ma brjed pa'i sgo du de dag ni 'drul bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Those eggs that the mother does not forget through mindfulness do not decay.

original: gang dag gis brjed pa de dag ni 'drul bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad de /
analyzed: gang dag gis brjed pa de dag ni 'drul bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad de /
translated: Those that she forgets do decay.

original: gzhan gyi zas kyis zas dang bcas par 'gyur du 'ong ba'i phyir de ni mi brjod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan gyi zas kyis zas dang bcas par 'gyur du 'ong ba'i phyir de ni mi brjod kyi /
translated: This is not mentioned because it would be as if the eggs were nourished by the food of another.

original: 'di skad du sgo nga gang dag gis ma las brtsams nas dran pas mi brjed pas de dag ni reg ba'i gnas skabs de dran pas 'drul bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di skad du sgo nga gang dag gis ma las brtsams nas dran pas mi brjed pas de dag ni reg ba'i gnas skabs de dran pas 'drul bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: Rather, it is said that those eggs that the mother does not forget through mindfulness, beginning with the mother, do not decay because of the condition of contact with mindfulness.

original: gang dag gis brjed ba de dag ni 'drul bar 'gyur ro zhes ni brjod do //
analyzed: gang dag gis brjed ba de dag ni 'drul bar 'gyur ro zhes ni brjod do //
translated: Those that she forgets do decay.

original: yang ci'i phyir zas bzhi kho na yin no //
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir zas bzhi kho na yin no //
translated: Why are there only four sustenances?

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad srid pa rnams gso bar byed pa dag ma yin nam zhe na /🔽de ni de lta na yin mod kyi 'on kyang gtso bor bshad de /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad srid pa rnams gso bar byed pa dag ma yin nam zhe na / de ni de lta na yin mod kyi 'on kyang gtso bor bshad de /
translated: Aren’t all contaminated phenomena the sustenance of the realms of existence?🔽This is so, but they are explained as primary.

original: 'di la gnas dang ni /
analyzed: 'di la gnas dang ni /
translated: Here, the primary

original: rten ba rgyas pa'i don du gnyis //🔽srid @141b gzhan 'phen dang 'grub pa yi //
analyzed: rten ba rgyas pa'i don du gnyis // srid @141b gzhan 'phen dang 'grub pa yi //
translated: Two are for the growth of the one who is supported.

original: don du gnyis te go rims bzhin //
analyzed: don du gnyis te go rims bzhin //
translated: Two are for the projection and actualization of another existence.🔽In order,

original: gnas ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus so //
analyzed: gnas ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus so //
translated: The abode is the body together with the faculties.

original: de rgyas par byed pa ni kham gyi zas so //
analyzed: de rgyas par byed pa ni kham gyi zas so //
translated: The growth of that is by way of the food of morsel.

original: rten pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: rten pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: The one who is supported is the mind and mental factors.

original: de dag rgyas par byed pa ni reg pa ste /
analyzed: de dag rgyas par byed pa ni reg pa ste /
translated: The growth of those is by way of contact.

original: re zhig 'di gnyis ni 'dir skyes pa'i srid pa gso bar bya ba gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: re zhig 'di gnyis ni 'dir skyes pa'i srid pa gso bar bya ba gtso bo yin no //
translated: These two are the principal things for nourishing the existence that has been born.

original: yid la sems pas ni yang srid pa 'phen par byed do //
analyzed: yid la sems pas ni yang srid pa 'phen par byed do //
translated: By way of intention, another existence is projected.

original: 'phangs zin pa ni las kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i sa bon las mngon par 'grub pas 'di gnyis ni ma skyes pa'i srid pa skyes ba la gtso bor yin no //
analyzed: 'phangs zin pa ni las kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i sa bon las mngon par 'grub pas 'di gnyis ni ma skyes pa'i srid pa skyes ba la gtso bor yin no //
translated: What has been projected is actualized from the seed of consciousness that is completely soaked by karma. These two are the principal things for the birth of existence that has not yet arisen.

original: de'i phyir bzhir gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bzhir gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, four are taught.

original: snga ma gnyis ni skyes zin pa gso bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ma ma lta bu dag yin no //
analyzed: snga ma gnyis ni skyes zin pa gso bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ma ma lta bu dag yin no //
translated: The first two are like nurses, because they nourish what has already arisen.

original: phyi ma gnyis ni skyed par byed ba ma yin pa'i phyir ma lta bu dag yin no //
analyzed: phyi ma gnyis ni skyed par byed ba ma yin pa'i phyir ma lta bu dag yin no //
translated: The last two are like a mother, because they do not give birth.

original: gang la la kham yin pa de thams cad zas kyang yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gang la la kham yin pa de thams cad zas kyang yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is everything that is morsel food also nutriment?

original: kham yin la zas ma yin pa yang yod do zhes bya ba mu bzhi ste /🔽mu dang po ni kham gang la brten nas dbang po rnams nyams par 'gyur la /
analyzed: kham yin la zas ma yin pa yang yod do zhes bya ba mu bzhi ste / mu dang po ni kham gang la brten nas dbang po rnams nyams par 'gyur la /
translated: There are four possibilities:

original: 'byung ba chen po rnams kyang yongs su 'jig par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po rnams kyang yongs su 'jig par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The first possibility is morsel food on which the faculties decline and the great elements are destroyed.

original: mu gnyis pa ni zas gsum pa dag go //
analyzed: mu gnyis pa ni zas gsum pa dag go //
translated: The second possibility is the three nutriments.

original: gsum pa ni kham gang la brten nas dbang po rnams rgyas par 'gyur zhing 'byung ba chen po rnams kyang 'phel bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni kham gang la brten nas dbang po rnams rgyas par 'gyur zhing 'byung ba chen po rnams kyang 'phel bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The third possibility is morsel food on which the faculties develop and the great elements increase.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The fourth possibility is what does not include those aspects.

original: de bzhin du reg pa la sogs pas kyang ci rigs par mu bzhir bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du reg pa la sogs pas kyang ci rigs par mu bzhir bya'o //
translated: Similarly, contact and so on are to be applied in the four possibilities as appropriate.

original: reg pa la sogs pa la brten nas dbang po rnams rgyas par 'gyur zhing 'byung ba rnams kyang 'phel bar 'gyur ba de dag zas kyang ma yin pa lta yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: reg pa la sogs pa la brten nas dbang po rnams rgyas par 'gyur zhing 'byung ba rnams kyang 'phel bar 'gyur ba de dag zas kyang ma yin pa lta yod dam zhe na /
translated: Do there exist any nutriments that do not cause the faculties to grow and the primary elements to increase?

original: yod de / gzhan gyi sa pa dang / zag pa med pa rnams so //
analyzed: yod de / gzhan gyi sa pa dang / zag pa med pa rnams so //
translated: Yes, those of another realm and those that are pure.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say:

original: gang zhig zos nas za ba po la gnod par byed pa de la yang dang po phan 'dogs pa'i phyir zas yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig zos nas za ba po la gnod par byed pa de la yang dang po phan 'dogs pa'i phyir zas yin no //
translated: Food is that which benefits, even though it may harm later on.

original: zas ni dus gnyis su zas kyi bya ba byed de /
analyzed: zas ni dus gnyis su zas kyi bya ba byed de /
translated: Food performs the function of food at two times:

original: yongs su longs spyod pa'i tshe dang / 'ju ba'i tshe'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yongs su longs spyod pa'i tshe dang / 'ju ba'i tshe'o zhes zer ro //
translated: when it is enjoyed and when it is digested.

original: 'gro ba gang na zas du zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: 'gro ba gang na zas du zhig yod ce na /
translated: In which realms are there how many types of food?

original: thams cad na thams cad yod de /
analyzed: thams cad na thams cad yod de /
translated: All exist in all realms.

original: skye gnas dag na yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: skye gnas dag na yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same applies to the modes of birth.

original: dmyal ba dag na kham gyi zas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: dmyal ba dag na kham gyi zas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the food in the hells?

original: lcags kyi thu lum 'bar ba dang / zangs zhun ma @142a * //
analyzed: lcags kyi thu lum 'bar ba dang / zangs zhun ma @142a * //
translated: It is burning iron balls and molten copper.

original: yin no ; / gal te gnod par byed pa yang zas yin na ni mu ba zhi la yang gnod par 'gyur la rab tu byed pa'i gzhung kham gyi zas gang zhe na /
analyzed: yin no ; / gal te gnod par byed pa yang zas yin na ni mu ba zhi la yang gnod par 'gyur la rab tu byed pa'i gzhung kham gyi zas gang zhe na /
translated: What is oral food?

original: kham gang la brten nas dbang po rnams rgyas par 'byung zhing 'gyur ba chen po rnams kyang 'phel ba dang 'tsho ba dang nye bar 'tsho bar 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: kham gang la brten nas dbang po rnams rgyas par 'byung zhing 'gyur ba chen po rnams kyang 'phel ba dang 'tsho ba dang nye bar 'tsho bar 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: It is that upon which the faculties are based, that which increases the great elements, and that which sustains and nourishes sentient beings.

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar du rgyas par gsungs pa la yang gnod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar du rgyas par gsungs pa la yang gnod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: It would also contradict the extensive explanation of food up to consciousness.

original: rgyas par 'gyur ba'i zas la dgongs te gsungs pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: rgyas par 'gyur ba'i zas la dgongs te gsungs pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is no contradiction because it is stated with reference to food that increases.

original: nyams par 'gyur ba'i zas ni dmyal ba dag tu zas kyi mtshan nyid thob pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyams par 'gyur ba'i zas ni dmyal ba dag tu zas kyi mtshan nyid thob pa'i phyir te /
translated: Food that harms is food that obtains the characteristics of food in the hells,

original: des kyang bkres pa dang skom pa dag 'joms par nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des kyang bkres pa dang skom pa dag 'joms par nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is able to destroy hunger and thirst.

original: gzhan yang nyi tshe ba'i dmyal ba dag na mi dang 'dra bar kham gyi zas yod pa'i phyir 'gro ba lnga pa nyid du rigs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang nyi tshe ba'i dmyal ba dag na mi dang 'dra bar kham gyi zas yod pa'i phyir 'gro ba lnga pa nyid du rigs so //
translated: Moreover, in the occasional hells, food by the mouthful exists as it does among humans. Thus it is logical that there are five destinies.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The Fortunate One said:

original: gang gis phyi'i drang srong 'dod pa dag las 'dod chags dang bral ba brgya la zas byin pa bas gang gis 'dzam bu'i tshal na 'dug pa'i so so'i skye bo gcig la byin na spyin pa de bas spyin pa 'di 'bras bu ches che'o zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gis phyi'i drang srong 'dod pa dag las 'dod chags dang bral ba brgya la zas byin pa bas gang gis 'dzam bu'i tshal na 'dug pa'i so so'i skye bo gcig la byin na spyin pa de bas spyin pa 'di 'bras bu ches che'o zhes gsungs pa /
translated: “Better than giving food to a hundred non-Buddhist seers detached from the realm of desire is giving food to a single ordinary worldling who is in Jambudvīpa. This gift is better than the former and produces an immeasurably greater effect.”

original: 'dzam bu'i tshal na 'dug pa'i so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i tshal na 'dug pa'i so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is an ordinary worldling who is in Jambudvīpa?

original: kha cig na re 'dzam bu'i gling na gnas pa lto dang ldan pa dag yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re 'dzam bu'i gling na gnas pa lto dang ldan pa dag yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: It is one who is in Jambudvīpa and who has a belly.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not correct,

original: gcig ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: for the Fortunate One said: “a single one.”

original: so so'i skye bo mang po la zas byin na bsod nams mang por 'gyur gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba nyung du la zas byin pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di la khyad par ci zhig yod /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo mang po la zas byin na bsod nams mang por 'gyur gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba nyung du la zas byin pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di la khyad par ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the difference between the two?

original: gzhan dag na re byang chub sems dpa' nye ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re byang chub sems dpa' nye ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The bodhisattva is near.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni de skad du mi brjod de /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni de skad du mi brjod de /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas do not say that,

original: de la byin na dgra bcom pa bye ba la byin pa bas bsod nams che sa mang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la byin na dgra bcom pa bye ba la byin pa bas bsod nams che sa mang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because giving to him is more meritorious than giving to a hundred thousand arhats.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa thob pa so so'i skye bo yin par dgongs so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa thob pa so so'i skye bo yin par dgongs so zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, they think that this refers to an ordinary person who has obtained the factors conducive to penetrative insight.

original: 'di'i ming yang don dang mthun pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di'i ming yang don dang mthun pa ma yin la /
translated: This name is not consistent with its meaning.

original: mdo 'am bstan bcos gang las kyang 'dzam bu'i tsha la du gtogs pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa thob pa'o zhes 'ol phyir ma ba shad pas 'di ni yongs su rtog pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /
analyzed: mdo 'am bstan bcos gang las kyang 'dzam bu'i tsha la du gtogs pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa thob pa'o zhes 'ol phyir ma ba shad pas 'di ni yongs su rtog pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /
translated: No sutra or treatise explains that those who enter the forest of Jambu are definitely those who obtain the factors conducive to penetrative insight.🔽This is mere speculation.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'dzam bu'i tshal na bzhugs @142b pa kho na yin par rigs te /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'dzam bu'i tshal na bzhugs @142b pa kho na yin par rigs te /
translated: It is logical that this refers to bodhisattvas dwelling in the forest of Jambu,

original: so so'i skye bo de ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar 'dra bas de'i tshe de dag las khyad par du 'phags par gsungs so //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo de ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar 'dra bas de'i tshe de dag las khyad par du 'phags par gsungs so //
translated: because it is said that at that time they are superior to those who are free of attachment to the desire realm, since they are ordinary beings who are similar to them.

original: de ni de dag mtha' yas pa pas kyang khyad par du 'phags na /🔽brgya smos pa ni dang po'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de dag mtha' yas pa pas kyang khyad par du 'phags na / brgya smos pa ni dang po'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If they are superior to those who are free of attachment to the desire realm,🔽then what need is there to mention their superiority to those who are free of attachment to the form realm?

original: de ni gdon mi za bar de lta yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni gdon mi za bar de lta yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: This must be understood without doubt.

original: 'di ltar de ma gtogs pa'i phyi rol pa rnams las rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa khyad par du 'phags par mdzad par gyur to //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ma gtogs pa'i phyi rol pa rnams las rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa khyad par du 'phags par mdzad par gyur to //
translated: In this way, he surpasses all the outsiders, except for the perfected beings, in the result of stream-enterer.

original: de lta ma yin na 'dzam bu'i tshal du gtogs pa las kyang khyad par du 'phags pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'dzam bu'i tshal du gtogs pa las kyang khyad par du 'phags pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, he would surpass even those who are in the Rose-Apple Land.

original: sems can rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ji lta ba dang / ji ltar gnas pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ji lta ba dang / ji ltar gnas pa bshad zin to //
translated: We have explained the dependent origination of sentient beings in terms of how it occurs and how it is.

original: ji ltar tshe zad pa la sogs pas 'chi 'pho ba la yang bshad zin to //
analyzed: ji ltar tshe zad pa la sogs pas 'chi 'pho ba la yang bshad zin to //
translated: We have also explained how death and rebirth occur through the exhaustion of life and so on.

original: da ni sems gang la gnas te 'chi 'pho ba dang skye bar 'gyur ba 'di brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni sems gang la gnas te 'chi 'pho ba dang skye bar 'gyur ba 'di brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now we must explain in which mind death and rebirth occur.

original: 'chad dang mtshams sbyor 'dod chags bral ;
analyzed: 'chad dang mtshams sbyor 'dod chags bral ;
translated: Death, linking, freedom from attachment,

original: / nyams dang 'chi 'pho skye ba rnams //🔽yid kyi rnam shes kho nar 'dod //
analyzed: / nyams dang 'chi 'pho skye ba rnams // yid kyi rnam shes kho nar 'dod //
translated: degeneration, death, and rebirth

original: ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ces bya ba smos so //
translated: occur in the mental consciousness alone.

original: de dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par 'chad pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba nying mtshams sbyor ba dang / khams dang sa las 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / yongs su nyams pa dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang / chos drug po 'di dag ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na yin par 'dod kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par 'chad pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba nying mtshams sbyor ba dang / khams dang sa las 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / yongs su nyams pa dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang / chos drug po 'di dag ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na yin par 'dod kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: The six dharmas are the cutting off of the roots of good, the linking of the roots of good, the detachment from the realms and stages, the retrogressing from detachment, death, and birth. These six dharmas are of the mental consciousness alone, not of the other consciousnesses.

original: skye ba smos pa ni srid pa bar mar nyid mtshams sbyor ba bshad zin pa'i ngo bor rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba smos pa ni srid pa bar mar nyid mtshams sbyor ba bshad zin pa'i ngo bor rig par bya'o //
translated: Birth is mentioned because the intermediate existence is included in the explanation of birth.

original: tshor ba ni /🔽'chi 'pho skye ba btang snyoms la //
analyzed: tshor ba ni / 'chi 'pho skye ba btang snyoms la //
translated: The six dharmas are of the mental consciousness alone, not of the other consciousnesses.

original: 'chi 'pho ba ni 'chi 'pho ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba ni 'chi 'pho ba nyid yin no //
translated: Death is death itself.

original: skye ba ni skye ba yin no //
analyzed: skye ba ni skye ba yin no //
translated: Birth is birth itself.

original: 'di gnyis bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di gnyis bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba yin te /
translated: These two are neutral sensations, neither pleasure nor suffering,

original: de ni mi gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mi gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not clear.

original: tshor ba gzhan dag ni gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba gzhan dag ni gsal ba yin te /
translated: The other sensations are clear.

original: rnam par shes pa gsal ba dag gis 'chi 'pho ba dang skye bar ni rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gsal ba dag gis 'chi 'pho ba dang skye bar ni rung ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible for consciousness to die or be born.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de la yang /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de la yang /
translated: This mental consciousness is also not in equipoise.🔽It is not in equipoise, because it is not one-pointed.

original: rtse gcig sems med la de med //🔽'chi 'a pho ba dang skye ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rtse gcig sems med la de med // 'chi 'a pho ba dang skye ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is not in equipoise, because it is not one-pointed.

original: skal pa mi nyam pa'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir dang / mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa yin pa'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems @143a * //
analyzed: skal pa mi nyam pa'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir dang / mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa yin pa'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems @143a * //
translated: There is no death or birth in a mind in equipoise, because it is on a level that is not subject to death, because it arises from the prior performance of the act of attention, and because it is beneficial.

original: la 'chi 'pho ba 'am skye ba med do //🔽sems med pa la yang med de /
analyzed: la 'chi 'pho ba 'am skye ba med do // sems med pa la yang med de /
translated: There is no death or birth in a mindless state.

original: sems med pa la ni gnod pa bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: sems med pa la ni gnod pa bya bar mi nus so //
translated: There is no death or birth in a mindless state, because it is not possible to harm what is mindless.🔽When the body begins to disintegrate, then the mind that is connected to that body necessarily becomes manifest and then death occurs.

original: gang gi tshe de'i lus yongs su 'jig par rtsom pa de'i tshe yang de las gdon mi za bar de'i lus dang 'brel pa'i sems mngon du gyur nas phyis 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de'i lus yongs su 'jig par rtsom pa de'i tshe yang de las gdon mi za bar de'i lus dang 'brel pa'i sems mngon du gyur nas phyis 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not occur in any other way.

original: skye ba la yang sems 'chad pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa med par mi skye ba'i phyir sems med par rigs pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba la yang sems 'chad pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa med par mi skye ba'i phyir sems med par rigs pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Also, it is not reasonable that consciousness is absent at birth because there is no cause for the mind to be interrupted and because one is not born without affliction.🔽The three types of death

original: 'chi ba'i srid pa rnam pa gsum du bshad pa la /🔽dgra bcom pa ni /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i srid pa rnam pa gsum du bshad pa la / dgra bcom pa ni /
translated: The Abhidharmakosa states,

original: mya ngan 'das lung bstan min gnyis //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das lung bstan min gnyis //
translated: Arhats and those who will receive predictions have two types of death.

original: spyod lam pa dang / gal te 'dod pa'i khams na rnam par smin pa'i btang snyoms yod na rnam par smin pa'i sems la gnas nas so //
analyzed: spyod lam pa dang / gal te 'dod pa'i khams na rnam par smin pa'i btang snyoms yod na rnam par smin pa'i sems la gnas nas so //
translated: If there is karmic maturation equanimity in the desire realm, then they die while abiding in the mind of karmic maturation.

original: ci ste med na ni spyod lam pa kho na la'o //
analyzed: ci ste med na ni spyod lam pa kho na la'o //
translated: But if there is none, then they die while abiding in the mind governing demeanor.

original: ci'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa kho na la yin gyi gzhan lam yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa kho na la yin gyi gzhan lam yin zhe na /
translated: Why do they die in these two and not others?

original: de ni nyam chung ba'i phyir sems 'chad pa'i rjes su mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni nyam chung ba'i phyir sems 'chad pa'i rjes su mthun pa yin no //
translated: Because they are weak, they are compatible with the interruption of mind.

original: yang 'chi ba na lus kyi phyogs gang du rnam par shes pa 'gag ce na /
analyzed: yang 'chi ba na lus kyi phyogs gang du rnam par shes pa 'gag ce na /
translated: In what part of the body does consciousness cease at death?

original: cig car 'chi na ni yid dang bcas pa'i lus kyi dbang po mod la 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cig car 'chi na ni yid dang bcas pa'i lus kyi dbang po mod la 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If death is instantaneous, the body sense faculty ceases at the same time as the mental faculty.

original: gal te rim gyis 'chi 'pho ba na de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te rim gyis 'chi 'pho ba na de'i tshe /
translated: If death is gradual, then:

original: 'og min lhar 'gro mi skye rnams //
analyzed: 'og min lhar 'gro mi skye rnams //
translated: Those who will not be reborn in the highest🔽die in stages, their consciousness ceasing in the feet,

original: rim gyis 'chi na rkang pa dang // lte ba snying gar yid 'chi 'pho //🔽'og tu 'gro bas na 'og tu 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: rim gyis 'chi na rkang pa dang // lte ba snying gar yid 'chi 'pho // 'og tu 'gro bas na 'og tu 'gro ba ste /
translated: in the navel, or in the heart.

original: ngan song du 'gro ba rnams so //🔽mir 'gro bas na mir 'gro bas te /
analyzed: ngan song du 'gro ba rnams so // mir 'gro bas na mir 'gro bas te /
translated: Those who will go to lower realms are those who will go downward adhogamana.

original: mi'i nang du 'gro ba rnams so //🔽lhar 'gro bas na lhar 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: mi'i nang du 'gro ba rnams so // lhar 'gro bas na lhar 'gro ba ste /
translated: Those who will go to the human realm are those who will go to the human realm manusyagamana.

original: lha'i nang du 'gro ba rnams so //🔽de dag gi rnam par shes pa ni grangs bzhin du rkang pa dang / lte ba dang / snying gar 'gag go //
analyzed: lha'i nang du 'gro ba rnams so // de dag gi rnam par shes pa ni grangs bzhin du rkang pa dang / lte ba dang / snying gar 'gag go //
translated: Those who will go to the celestial realm are those who will go to the celestial realm devalokagamana.🔽The consciousness of those who will go to lower realms ceases in the feet.

original: yang mi skye bas na mi skye ba ste /🔽dgra bcom pa dag go //
analyzed: yang mi skye bas na mi skye ba ste / dgra bcom pa dag go //
translated: The consciousness of those who will go to the human realm ceases in the navel.🔽The consciousness of those who will go to the celestial realm ceases in the heart.

original: de dag gi rnam par shes pa snying khar 'gag go //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par shes pa snying khar 'gag go //
translated: The consciousness of those who will not be reborn ceases in the heart.

original: gzhan dag na re spyi bor zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re spyi bor zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that it ceases in the head.

original: de dag tu lus kyi dbang po 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag tu lus kyi dbang po 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the body sense faculty ceases in these places.

original: 'chi ba'i lus kyi dbang po ni rdo leb bsregs pa'i thog tu chus btab pa zhum par 'gyur ba bzhin du rkang pa la sogs par nub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i lus kyi dbang po ni rdo leb bsregs pa'i thog tu chus btab pa zhum par 'gyur ba bzhin du rkang pa la sogs par nub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The body sense faculty of one who is dying sinks into the feet, etc., like a fire whose fuel is exhausted and which is sinking into the earth.

original: gnad 'chad pa'i tshor bas nyen pa'i srog chags rnams ni phal cher de lta de ltar rim gyis 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnad 'chad pa'i tshor bas nyen pa'i srog chags rnams ni phal cher de lta de ltar rim gyis 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Beings who are afflicted by the pain of the severance of the vital parts die in this way, gradually.

original: gnad gcod pa ni tshul sogs kyis lus kyi phyogs 'ga' @143b zhig nyams na 'chi bar 'gyur ba de dag ni gnad rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnad gcod pa ni tshul sogs kyis lus kyi phyogs 'ga' @143b zhig nyams na 'chi bar 'gyur ba de dag ni gnad rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: The vital parts are those places where the body is damaged and one dies, such as the feet, etc.

original: de dag kyang chu dang me dang rlung gi khams rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig drag tu 'khrugs par gyur pa mtshon cha thams cad bdar bas btab pa dang 'dra bas tshor ba mi bzad pa dag gis bcad pa lta bu yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag kyang chu dang me dang rlung gi khams rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig drag tu 'khrugs par gyur pa mtshon cha thams cad bdar bas btab pa dang 'dra bas tshor ba mi bzad pa dag gis bcad pa lta bu yin gyi /
translated: The vital parts are severed by the intense disturbance of any one of the elements of water, fire, or wind, as if one were cut by a sharp weapon.

original: de dag shing gcod pa lta bur ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag shing gcod pa lta bur ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not severed as if one were cutting down a tree.

original: yang na bcad pa dang 'dra bar yang g-yo ba med pas na bcad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na bcad pa dang 'dra bar yang g-yo ba med pas na bcad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, like a cut, it is called a cut because it is immobile.

original: ci'i phyir sa'i khams kyi ma yin zhe na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir sa'i khams kyi ma yin zhe na //
translated: Why is it not the earth element?

original: skyon bzhi pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skyon bzhi pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the fourth fault does not exist.

original: rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan rnams ni skyon gsum yin pa de dag gi gtso bo ni ci rigs par chu dang me dang rlung gi khams dag yin no //
analyzed: rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan rnams ni skyon gsum yin pa de dag gi gtso bo ni ci rigs par chu dang me dang rlung gi khams dag yin no //
translated: The three humors are wind, bile, and phlegm. The principal ones among them are, respectively, the wind, fire, and water elements.

original: gzhan dag na re snod kyi 'jig rten 'jig pa dang chos mthun pas so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re snod kyi 'jig rten 'jig pa dang chos mthun pas so zhes zer ro //
translated: According to others, because it resembles the destruction of the receptacle world.

original: lha dag gi nang na ni gnad 'chad pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: lha dag gi nang na ni gnad 'chad pa med mod kyi /
translated: In the realm of the gods, there is no cutting off of the vital parts.

original: 'on kyang lha'i bu 'chi ba'i chos can la ni nye ba'i snga ltas lnga 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang lha'i bu 'chi ba'i chos can la ni nye ba'i snga ltas lnga 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: However, five signs announce the death of a god:

original: gos rnams dang rgyan rnams las sgra yid du mi 'ong ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gos rnams dang rgyan rnams las sgra yid du mi 'ong ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: his clothes and ornaments make noise;

original: lus kyi 'od chung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: lus kyi 'od chung bar 'gyur /
translated: his aura dims;

original: khrus byas pa'i chu'i thigs pa dag lus la chags par 'gyur /
analyzed: khrus byas pa'i chu'i thigs pa dag lus la chags par 'gyur /
translated: drops of water remain on his body after his bath;

original: g-yo ba'i bdag nyid can yang blo yul gcig la gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: g-yo ba'i bdag nyid can yang blo yul gcig la gnas par 'gyur /
translated: The mind, which is by nature unsteady, becomes fixed on a single object.

original: mig gnyis 'dzums pa dang 'byed pa dag srid par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mig gnyis 'dzums pa dang 'byed pa dag srid par 'gyur te /
translated: The two eyes, which are normally open, close.

original: de dag ni 'khrul pa can yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni 'khrul pa can yin no //
translated: These are the signs of error.

original: 'chi ba'i ltas lnga las ni mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i ltas lnga las ni mi 'da' ste /
translated: There are five signs of death from which there is no return:

original: gos dri ma can du 'gyur /
analyzed: gos dri ma can du 'gyur /
translated: the clothes become dirty;

original: me tog phreng rnyings par 'gyur /
analyzed: me tog phreng rnyings par 'gyur /
translated: the garland withers;

original: mchan khung gnyis nas rdul 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: mchan khung gnyis nas rdul 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: sweat appears in the armpits;

original: lus las dri da ba dag 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: lus las dri da ba dag 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: a bad smell comes from the body;

original: lha'i bu rang gi stan la mi dga' bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu rang gi stan la mi dga' bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: the young god no longer enjoys his seat.

original: sems can gyi 'jig rten 'di de ltar skye ba dang / gnas pa dang 'chi 'pho ba na bcom ldan 'das kyis tshogs gsum du bzhag ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi 'jig rten 'di de ltar skye ba dang / gnas pa dang 'chi 'pho ba na bcom ldan 'das kyis tshogs gsum du bzhag ste /
translated: When the world of sentient beings is thus born, endures, and dies, the Fortunate One establishes three groups:

original: tshogs gsum ni yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i tshogs dang / log pa nyid du nges pa'i tshogs dang / ma nges pa'i tshogs so //
analyzed: tshogs gsum ni yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i tshogs dang / log pa nyid du nges pa'i tshogs dang / ma nges pa'i tshogs so //
translated: the group definitely destined for the good, the group definitely destined for the bad, and the group not destined.

original: de la 'phags dang mtshams med byed pa dag yang dag log pa nyid du des //
analyzed: de la 'phags dang mtshams med byed pa dag yang dag log pa nyid du des //
translated: The noble ones and those who commit the actions with immediate consequence are, respectively, those who are rightly oriented and those who are wrongly oriented.

original: yang dag pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is rightness?🔽A sūtra declares:

original: mdo las gang 'dod chags gtan nas spangs pa dang / zhe sdang gtan nas spangs pa dang / gti mug gtan nas spangs pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad gtan nas spangs pa nyid ni yang dag pa nyid do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mdo las gang 'dod chags gtan nas spangs pa dang / zhe sdang gtan nas spangs pa dang / gti mug gtan nas spangs pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad gtan nas spangs pa nyid ni yang dag pa nyid do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The complete abandonment of attachment, the complete abandonment of hatred, the complete abandonment of delusion, and the complete abandonment of all the mental afflictions is rightness.

original: 'phags pa rnams gang zhe na /🔽gang dag la zag @144a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams gang zhe na / gang dag la zag @144a * //
translated: What are the noble ones?

original: pa med pa'i lam skyes pa'o //
analyzed: pa med pa'i lam skyes pa'o //
translated: Those in whom the uncontaminated path has arisen.

original: sdig pa'i chos las ring du song pas na 'phags pa rnams te /🔽gtan du 'bral ba'i thob pa rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdig pa'i chos las ring du song pas na 'phags pa rnams te / gtan du 'bral ba'i thob pa rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called noble ones because they have gone far from the dharmas of evil.🔽They are rightly oriented because they have obtained the attainment of complete separation.

original: de dag ni nyon mongs pa zad par nges pa'i phyir yang dag pa nyid du nges pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni nyon mongs pa zad par nges pa'i phyir yang dag pa nyid du nges pa dag yin no //
translated: They are rightly oriented because they are certain to exhaust the mental afflictions.

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa thob pa yang gdon mi za bar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can yin na ci'i phyir yang dag pa nyid du nges pa dag ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa thob pa yang gdon mi za bar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can yin na ci'i phyir yang dag pa nyid du nges pa dag ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are they not destined for the authentic?

original: de dag ni log pa nyid du yang nges par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de dag ni log pa nyid du yang nges par 'gyur la /
translated: They are destined for error.

original: de dag ji ltar de ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa la sogs pa ltar dus nges par yang dag pa nyid du nges pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ji ltar de ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa la sogs pa ltar dus nges par yang dag pa nyid du nges pa yang ma yin no //
translated: They are not destined for the authentic in the same way that those of definite potential are, because they are not definitely destined for the authentic at a specific time, such as after seven rebirths.

original: log pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: log pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is error?

original: dmyal ba rnams dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags te /
analyzed: dmyal ba rnams dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags te /
translated: It is the hells, animals, and ghosts.

original: 'di ni log pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni log pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called error.

original: de la mtshams med pa byed pa rnams ni dmyal bar nges pa'i phyir log pa nyid du nges pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de la mtshams med pa byed pa rnams ni dmyal bar nges pa'i phyir log pa nyid du nges pa dag yin no //
translated: Those who commit heinous acts are destined for error because they are definitely destined for the hells.

original: nges pa de dag las gzhan pa ni ma nges pa'o zhes bya bar grub ste /
analyzed: nges pa de dag las gzhan pa ni ma nges pa'o zhes bya bar grub ste /
translated: Those other than those of definite potential are not definite.

original: de dag ni rkyen la ltos na gnyi ga la brten pa nyid dang / gnyi ga la mi brten ba nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni rkyen la ltos na gnyi ga la brten pa nyid dang / gnyi ga la mi brten ba nyid kyang yin no //
translated: They are dependent on both conditions and not dependent on both.

original: sems can gyi 'jig rten bshad zin to //🔽da ni snod kyi 'jig rten bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi 'jig rten bshad zin to // da ni snod kyi 'jig rten bshad par bya ste /
translated: The world of sentient beings has been explained.🔽Now the receptacle world should be explained.

original: de la snod kyi 'jig rten gyi //
analyzed: de la snod kyi 'jig rten gyi //
translated: The receptacle world

original: gnas par 'dod pa'i 'og dag gi //
analyzed: gnas par 'dod pa'i 'og dag gi //
translated: is established by the power of the karma of sentient beings.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor rngams su ni //
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor rngams su ni //
translated: The wind maṇḍala is below,

original: sa ya drug 'bum grangs med do //🔽stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams ni 'di ltar gnas par 'dod de /
analyzed: sa ya drug 'bum grangs med do // stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams ni 'di ltar gnas par 'dod de /
translated: 600,000 yojanas thick,🔽and immeasurable in extent.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The great trichiliocosm is established in this way:

original: sems can rnams kyi las kyi dbang gis 'og na nam mkha' la brten pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor mngon par 'grub ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi las kyi dbang gis 'og na nam mkha' la brten pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor mngon par 'grub ste /
translated: By the power of the karma of sentient beings, a wind maṇḍala is established in space below,

original: de'i rngams su ni dpag tshad sa ya drug 'bum mo //
analyzed: de'i rngams su ni dpag tshad sa ya drug 'bum mo //
translated: 600,000 yojanas thick.

original: rgyar ni grangs med de /
analyzed: rgyar ni grangs med de /
translated: It is immeasurable in extent.

original: 'di ltar gang tshan po che chen po'i rdo rjes kyang gzhig par mi nus par sra ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang tshan po che chen po'i rdo rjes kyang gzhig par mi nus par sra ba yin no //
translated: It is so solid that even the great vajra of the great maṇḍala cannot destroy it.

original: de'i steng na /
analyzed: de'i steng na /
translated: Above that,

original: chu rngams 'bum phrag bcu gcig dang // stong phrag dag ni nyi shu'o //
analyzed: chu rngams 'bum phrag bcu gcig dang // stong phrag dag ni nyi shu'o //
translated: The water wheel is 1,120,000 leagues high and 320,000 leagues deep.

original: dkyil 'khor zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The wheel of water is the wheel of the water element.

original: sems can rnams kyi las dag gis rlung gi dkyil 'khor der sprin rnams 'dus nas /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi las dag gis rlung gi dkyil 'khor der sprin rnams 'dus nas /
translated: The clouds are formed by the power of the sentient beings of the third concentration.

original: char gyi rgyun gnya' shing tsam la bab pa de chu'i dkyil 'khor du 'gyur te /
analyzed: char gyi rgyun gnya' shing tsam la bab pa de chu'i dkyil 'khor du 'gyur te /
translated: The rain falls in torrents the size of the yoke-pole.

original: de'i rngams su ni dpag tshad 'bum phrag bcu gcig dang nyi khri'o //
analyzed: de'i rngams su ni dpag tshad 'bum phrag bcu gcig dang nyi khri'o //
translated: The wheel of water is 1,120,000 leagues high and 320,000 leagues deep.

original: ji ltar na chu de dag thad kar mi 'bo zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na chu de dag thad kar mi 'bo zhe na /
translated: Why does the water not flow over the edge?

original: kha cig na re sems can rnams kyi las kyi @144b dbang gis te /
analyzed: kha cig na re sems can rnams kyi las kyi @144b dbang gis te /
translated: Some say: By the power of the karma of sentient beings,

original: dper na bza' ba dang / btung ba zos pa dang / 'thung ba ma zhu ba long kar mi ltung ba bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dper na bza' ba dang / btung ba zos pa dang / 'thung ba ma zhu ba long kar mi ltung ba bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: just as food and drink that have been consumed do not fall into the intestines before they are digested.

original: sde pa gzhan dag na re sbyang gi tshul du rlung gis 'dzin to zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sde pa gzhan dag na re sbyang gi tshul du rlung gis 'dzin to zhes zer ro //
translated: Other schools say: The wind holds it like a winnowing basket.

original: yang sems can rnams kyi las kyi mthu las byung ba'i rlung dag gis chu de kun nas dkrugs pa na'o ma bskol ba spris ma chags pa'i tshul du steng ma gser du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang sems can rnams kyi las kyi mthu las byung ba'i rlung dag gis chu de kun nas dkrugs pa na'o ma bskol ba spris ma chags pa'i tshul du steng ma gser du 'gyur ro //
translated: The water of the ocean is churned by the force of the wind and becomes gold.

original: chu'i dkyil 'khor de phyis ni rngams su 'bum phrag brgyad /
analyzed: chu'i dkyil 'khor de phyis ni rngams su 'bum phrag brgyad /
translated: The circle of water is 840,000 yojanas thick.

original: lhag ma dag ni gser du 'gyur //
analyzed: lhag ma dag ni gser du 'gyur //
translated: The rest is gold.

original: lhag ma yang gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: lhag ma yang gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is the rest?

original: chu'i steng rim dpag tshad sum 'bum nyi khri gser gyi rang bzhin gyi sa gzhir gyur pa de'i chu dang gser gyi rngams bshad zin to //
analyzed: chu'i steng rim dpag tshad sum 'bum nyi khri gser gyi rang bzhin gyi sa gzhir gyur pa de'i chu dang gser gyi rngams bshad zin to //
translated: The circle of water is 320,000 yojanas thick. The rest, which is 520,000 yojanas thick, is gold.

original: chu dang gser gyi dkyil 'khor gyi //
analyzed: chu dang gser gyi dkyil 'khor gyi //
translated: The circle of water and gold🔽is 1,250,000 yojanas thick.

original: thad kar 'bum phrag bcu gnyis dang // stong phrag gsum dang brgya phrag ni //🔽phyed dang lnga rnams kho na'o //
analyzed: thad kar 'bum phrag bcu gnyis dang // stong phrag gsum dang brgya phrag ni // phyed dang lnga rnams kho na'o //
translated: The circle of water and gold is 1,250,000 yojanas thick.

original: 'di gnyi ga rgya mnyam mo //🔽khor yug tu ni sum 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di gnyi ga rgya mnyam mo // khor yug tu ni sum 'gyur ro //
translated: The circle of water and gold is the same in width.🔽The circle of Meru is three times that.

original: khor yug tu brtsi na ni sum 'gyur du 'gyur te /
analyzed: khor yug tu brtsi na ni sum 'gyur du 'gyur te /
translated: The circle of Meru is three times that, i.e., 3,750,000 yojanas.

original: dpag tshad sa ya phrag gsum dang / 'bum phrag drug dang / khri sum brgya lnga bcu'o /
analyzed: dpag tshad sa ya phrag gsum dang / 'bum phrag drug dang / khri sum brgya lnga bcu'o /
translated: The diameter of the golden circle is three million, six hundred thousand yojanas.🔽The circle of water rests on the circle of wind.🔽The circle of water is four times as thick as Sumeru.🔽The circle of gold is as thick as the circle of water and has the same dimensions.

original: gser gyi sa gzhi'i dkyil 'khor chu'i steng na gnas pa gang yin pa /🔽de la lhun po gnya' shing 'dzin //
analyzed: gser gyi sa gzhi'i dkyil 'khor chu'i steng na gnas pa gang yin pa / de la lhun po gnya' shing 'dzin //
translated: The circle of gold is the foundation of the four continents, of Sumeru and of the seven mountains.🔽The seven mountains🔽Yugandhara,🔽Īṣādhara,🔽Vinataka,

original: gshol mda' 'dzin dang seng ldeng can //
analyzed: gshol mda' 'dzin dang seng ldeng can //
translated: Aśvakarṇa,🔽Nimindhara,🔽Kailāsa,

original: de bzhin blta na sdug ri dang / rta rna dang ni rnam bdud dang // mu khyud 'dzin ri'o //🔽ri chen po brgyad po 'di dag ni gser gyi dkyil 'khor la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin blta na sdug ri dang / rta rna dang ni rnam bdud dang // mu khyud 'dzin ri'o // ri chen po brgyad po 'di dag ni gser gyi dkyil 'khor la brten pa yin te /
translated: and Mount Sudarśana,🔽are made of gold.

original: ri rab ni dbus na'o //
analyzed: ri rab ni dbus na'o //
translated: The first, Yugandhara, is thirty-two thousand leagues thick; the external diameter of the circle formed by this mountain is one hundred twenty-one thousand leagues.

original: lhag ma rnams kyis ni ri rab bskor te gnas so //🔽ri bdun gyi ra bas bskor ba de'i phyi rim gang yin pa de ni ri mu khyud 'dzin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyis ni ri rab bskor te gnas so // ri bdun gyi ra bas bskor ba de'i phyi rim gang yin pa de ni ri mu khyud 'dzin no //
translated: The other mountains are arranged in concentric belts.

original: de nas ni gling rnams yin no //🔽de'i phyi rol na ni gling bzhi dag go //
analyzed: de nas ni gling rnams yin no // de'i phyi rol na ni gling bzhi dag go //
translated: The mountains are separated from each other by seven oceans, six salty like the great ocean, the seventh made of fresh water.

original: de dag gi yang phyi rol na ni khor yug ste /🔽des ni gling bzhir khor yag tu bskor te /
analyzed: de dag gi yang phyi rol na ni khor yug ste /🔽des ni gling bzhir khor yag tu bskor te /
translated: The distance from one mountain to the next is the same, namely twenty-four thousand leagues.🔽The width of the first ocean, which is located between Yugandhara and Īṣādhara, is twenty-four thousand leagues.

original: de dag las /
analyzed: de dag las /
translated: From among those,🔽🔽

original: bdun ni gser yin te lcags so //
analyzed: bdun ni gser yin te lcags so //
translated: Seven are gold; the last is iron.

original: gnya' shing 'dzin la sogs pa'i ri bdun ni gser gyi rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: gnya' shing 'dzin la sogs pa'i ri bdun ni gser gyi rang bzhin yin no //
translated: The seven mountains, Yugandhara and so on, are made of gold.

original: khor yug ni lcags kyi rang bzhin yin no //🔽lhun po rin chen bzhi'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: khor yug ni lcags kyi rang bzhin yin no // lhun po rin chen bzhi'i rang bzhin /
translated: The last mountain, Cakravada, is made of iron.🔽Meru is made of four jewels.

original: gser gyi rang bzhin dang / dngul gyi rang bzhin dang / beed'urya'i rang bzhin dang shel gyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: gser gyi rang bzhin dang / dngul gyi rang bzhin dang / beed'urya'i rang bzhin dang shel gyi rang bzhin te /
translated: Meru, the king of mountains, is made of four jewels: gold, silver, lapis lazuli, crystal.

original: ngos bzhi dag tu grangs bzhin no //
analyzed: ngos bzhi dag tu grangs bzhin no //
translated: The four faces of Meru correspond in number to the four jewels.

original: ri rab kyi ngos gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin yin pa de'i mthus @145a * //
analyzed: ri rab kyi ngos gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin yin pa de'i mthus @145a * //
translated: The face of Meru which is of a certain jewel is resplendent with the brilliance of this jewel.🔽The face of Meru which is gold is resplendent with the brilliance of gold.🔽The face of Meru which is silver, lapis lazuli, crystal is resplendent with the brilliance of silver, lapis lazuli, crystal.🔽The sky is colored by the brilliance of Meru.

original: de'i ngos kyi nam mkha' yang de'i kha dog tu snang ste /🔽de'i ngos 'dzam bu'i gling logs bee d'urya'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: de'i ngos kyi nam mkha' yang de'i kha dog tu snang ste / de'i ngos 'dzam bu'i gling logs bee d'urya'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: The sky is colored by the brilliance of Meru.🔽The face of Meru which is turned towards Jambudvipa is made of lapis lazuli; the sky of Jambudvipa is thus resplendent with the reflection of lapis lazuli.

original: de'i 'od kyi kha dog gis 'di'i nam mkha' yang bee d'urya'i kha dog tu snang ngo zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i 'od kyi kha dog gis 'di'i nam mkha' yang bee d'urya'i kha dog tu snang ngo zhes brjod do //
translated: The other continents are situated beneath the other faces of Meru.

original: yang de dag ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: yang de dag ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
translated: How are the continents arranged with respect to Meru?

original: gser gyi rang bzhin gyi sa gzhi la char pa'i rgyun 'bab ste /
analyzed: gser gyi rang bzhin gyi sa gzhi la char pa'i rgyun 'bab ste /
translated: The rain falls on the golden ground.

original: sa bon rnam pa sna tshogs khong na yod pa'i chu de dag mthu rnam pa du ma'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i rlung dag gis bshig pa na ri de dang de dag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa bon rnam pa sna tshogs khong na yod pa'i chu de dag mthu rnam pa du ma'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i rlung dag gis bshig pa na ri de dang de dag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The water, which contains the seeds of the various objects, is agitated by the wind and forms the various mountains.

original: 'di ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gyur te /
translated: This is how it is.

original: gang rigs tha dad pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par bskyed par bya ba la ma phrad par rkyen du 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gang rigs tha dad pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par bskyed par bya ba la ma phrad par rkyen du 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: The conditions are not in contact with the effect in order to produce it, but they are of the same nature as the effect.

original: ji ltar grangs can pa rnams kyi 'gyur ba lta bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar grangs can pa rnams kyi 'gyur ba lta bu ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not as the Samkhyas believe that transformation consists of the manifestation of an existent, or the transformation of something permanent.

original: grangs can pa rnams kyi 'gyur ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: grangs can pa rnams kyi 'gyur ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the Samkhya theory of transformation?

original: rdzas gnas pa la chos gzhan log na chos gzhan 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rdzas gnas pa la chos gzhan log na chos gzhan 'byung ba'o //
translated: The Samkhyas say that a substance, remaining as it is, is transformed by the appearance of another quality and the disappearance of a previous quality.

original: 'di la nyes pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: 'di la nyes pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is wrong with this theory?

original: gnas pa gang gi chos rnams kyi bye brag brtag par bya ba'i chos can nyid med do //
analyzed: gnas pa gang gi chos rnams kyi bye brag brtag par bya ba'i chos can nyid med do //
translated: The substance, remaining as it is, is not susceptible to transformation, since it does not change its nature.

original: chos can rnams las chos can gzhan no zhes de skad du zer /
analyzed: chos can rnams las chos can gzhan no zhes de skad du zer /
translated: The Samkhyas say that the effect preexists in the cause.

original: chos de nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba tsam ni 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: chos de nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba tsam ni 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the transformation of this thing into something else is the change,

original: de lta na yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: then this is not correct.

original: 'di la mi rigs pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: 'di la mi rigs pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is incorrect about this?

original: de nyid 'di yin la /
analyzed: de nyid 'di yin la /
translated: This is the same as that,🔽but this is not like that.

original: 'dis de lta bu yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lugs 'di ni sngon ma byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis de lta bu yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lugs 'di ni sngon ma byung ba yin no //
translated: This is a new way of speaking.

original: de ltar byung ba'i gser la sogs pa las gyi  mthus bskyed pa'i rlung dag gis bsdus nas phung por byed de /🔽de dag ni ri dag tu 'ang 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar byung ba'i gser la sogs pa las gyi  mthus bskyed pa'i rlung dag gis bsdus nas phung por byed de / de dag ni ri dag tu 'ang 'gyur la /
translated: The wind created by the power of karma gathers the gold and so on and forms it into a mass.

original: gling rnams su yang 'gyur ro //🔽ri rab la sogs pa khor yug la thug pa'i ri de dag ni chu'i nang du brgyad khri dag nub bo //
analyzed: gling rnams su yang 'gyur ro // ri rab la sogs pa khor yug la thug pa'i ri de dag ni chu'i nang du brgyad khri dag nub bo //
translated: This becomes the mountains and continents.🔽The mountains, including Meru, extend down into the water to a depth of eighty thousand yojanas.

original: de dag gser gyi sa gzhi'i steng na chu dpag tshad brgyad khri yod pa der nub bo //
analyzed: de dag gser gyi sa gzhi'i steng na chu dpag tshad brgyad khri yod pa der nub bo //
translated: They rest on the golden circle.

original: chu'i steng du yang /
analyzed: chu'i steng du yang /
translated: The water extends

original: dpag tshad dag ni brgyad khri'o //
analyzed: dpag tshad dag ni brgyad khri'o //
translated: eighty thousand yojanas above the golden circle.

original: de ltar na ri rab ni 'phang du dpag tshad 'bum drug khri'o //
analyzed: de ltar na ri rab ni 'phang du dpag tshad 'bum drug khri'o //
translated: Thus Meru rises 160,000 yojanas above the water and 160,000 yojanas below it.

original: brgyad po'i 'phang du phyed phyed dbri //🔽ri rab chu'i steng du ji tsam 'phags pa de'i phyed ni gnya' shing 'dzin te /
analyzed: brgyad po'i 'phang du phyed phyed dbri // ri rab chu'i steng du ji tsam 'phags pa de'i phyed ni gnya' shing 'dzin te /
translated: The other seven are progressively half the size of the preceding one.

original: dpag tshad bzhi khri yin la /
analyzed: dpag tshad bzhi khri yin la /
translated: Yugandhara is 40,000 yojanas above the water, since it is half the size of Meru.

original: de'i phyed ni gshol mda' 'dzin to zhes bya bas /🔽de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang mu khyud 'dzin gyi phyed ni khor yug ste /
analyzed: de'i phyed ni gshol mda' 'dzin to zhes bya bas / de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang mu khyud 'dzin gyi phyed ni khor yug ste /
translated: Iṣādhara is half of that, and so on.

original: 'phang du dpag tshad sum brgya phyed dang bcu gsum yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du phyed phyed @145b kyis dbri bar rig par bya'o //🔽de dag rngams su 'phang dang mnyam //
analyzed: 'phang du dpag tshad sum brgya phyed dang bcu gsum yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du phyed phyed @145b kyis dbri bar rig par bya'o // de dag rngams su 'phang dang mnyam //
translated: The outer rim Cakravāḍa is 375 yojanas above the water.🔽The other seven mountains are equal to Meru in width.

original: de dag chu las ji tsam gyen du 'phags pa rngams su yang de tsam ste //🔽rgyar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag chu las ji tsam gyen du 'phags pa rngams su yang de tsam ste // rgyar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are as wide as they are high.

original: de dag bar bdun rol mtsho yin //
analyzed: de dag bar bdun rol mtsho yin //
translated: The seven mountain ranges are surrounded by seven oceans of water.🔽The first ocean is 800,000 yojanas wide.🔽The other six are progressively half the size of the preceding one.

original: mu khyud 'dzin la thug pa'i ri de dag gi bar bdun ni rol mtsho bdun zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mu khyud 'dzin la thug pa'i ri de dag gi bar bdun ni rol mtsho bdun zhes bya ste /
translated: The seven oceans between the mountains, from Yugandhara to Nimindhara, are called the seven oceans.

original: yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i chus gang ngo //
analyzed: yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i chus gang ngo //
translated: They are filled with water possessing eight qualities.

original: chu de ni bsil ba dang / zhim pa dang / yang pa dang / 'jam pa dang / dangs pa dang / dri nga ba med pa dang / 'thung na mgrin pa la mi gnod pa dang / 'thungs na lto la mi gnod pa'o //🔽yang de dag las /
analyzed: chu de ni bsil ba dang / zhim pa dang / yang pa dang / 'jam pa dang / dangs pa dang / dri nga ba med pa dang / 'thung na mgrin pa la mi gnod pa dang / 'thungs na lto la mi gnod pa'o // yang de dag las /
translated: The water is cool, delicious, light, soft, clear, odorless, and does not harm the throat or stomach when drunk.

original: dang po stong phrag brgyad cu'o //
analyzed: dang po stong phrag brgyad cu'o //
translated: The first is 80,000 yojanas.

original: ri rab dang gnya' shing 'dzin gyi bar gyi rol mtsho dang po ni kha tshon dpag tshad brgyad khri'o //
analyzed: ri rab dang gnya' shing 'dzin gyi bar gyi rol mtsho dang po ni kha tshon dpag tshad brgyad khri'o //
translated: The first ocean between Meru and Yugandhara is 80,000 yojanas wide.

original: de ni nang gi rgya mtsho yin //
analyzed: de ni nang gi rgya mtsho yin //
translated: That is the inner ocean.

original: rgya mtsho ni gnyis te /
analyzed: rgya mtsho ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two oceans:

original: nang gi dang phyi'i 'o //
analyzed: nang gi dang phyi'i 'o //
translated: inner and outer.

original: rol mtsho de ni nang gi rgya mtsho yin no //
analyzed: rol mtsho de ni nang gi rgya mtsho yin no //
translated: That is the inner ocean.

original: de'i ngos la sum 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i ngos la sum 'gyur ro //
translated: Its width is three times that.

original: kha tshon ni dpag tshad brgyad khri bshad do //
analyzed: kha tshon ni dpag tshad brgyad khri bshad do //
translated: Its width is explained as 80,000 yojanas.

original: ngos la ni gnya' shing 'dzin gyi 'gram nas bgrangs na sum 'gyur te /🔽dpag tshad nyis 'bum bzhi khri'o //
analyzed: ngos la ni gnya' shing 'dzin gyi 'gram nas bgrangs na sum 'gyur te / dpag tshad nyis 'bum bzhi khri'o //
translated: If one counts from the shore of Yugandhara, the distance is tripled.

original: rol mtsho gzhan ni phyed phyed do /
analyzed: rol mtsho gzhan ni phyed phyed do /
translated: The other outer oceans are half the size of the previous one.

original: // gnya' shing 'dzin nas gshol mda' 'dzin gyi bar gyi rol mtsho gnyis pa ni dang po'i phyed de /
analyzed: // gnya' shing 'dzin nas gshol mda' 'dzin gyi bar gyi rol mtsho gnyis pa ni dang po'i phyed de /
translated: The second ocean between Yugandhara and Sudarshana is half the size of the first,

original: dpag tshad bzhi khri yin la /
analyzed: dpag tshad bzhi khri yin la /
translated: It is 40,000 yojanas in height.🔽

original: gsum pa ni de'i phyed do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gsum pa ni de'i phyed do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The third is half that, and so on.

original: de bzhin du rol mtsho bdun pa ni /🔽dpag tshad stong nyis brgya lnga bcu'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rol mtsho bdun pa ni / dpag tshad stong nyis brgya lnga bcu'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The seventh ocean is 1,250 yojanas.

original: rol mtsho gzhan rnams phyed phyed kyis dbri'o //
analyzed: rol mtsho gzhan rnams phyed phyed kyis dbri'o //
translated: The other outer oceans decrease by half.

original: de dag gi srid du ni ha cang 'byams klas pa'i phyir ma bgrangs so //
analyzed: de dag gi srid du ni ha cang 'byams klas pa'i phyir ma bgrangs so //
translated: The distance of the outer oceans is not mentioned because it is too vast.

original: lhag ma phyi'i mtsho chen yin /
analyzed: lhag ma phyi'i mtsho chen yin /
translated: The rest is the outer great ocean.

original: lhag ma gang zhig ce na mu khyud 'dzin dang khor yug gi bar de'i ni phyi'i rgya mtsho chen po yin te /
analyzed: lhag ma gang zhig ce na mu khyud 'dzin dang khor yug gi bar de'i ni phyi'i rgya mtsho chen po yin te /
translated: What is the rest? The outer great ocean is between Sudarshana and Cakravada.

original: tshva sgo'i tshva chus gang ngo /
analyzed: tshva sgo'i tshva chus gang ngo /
translated: It is filled with salty water.

original: de yang kha tshon du dpag tshad 'bum phrag gsum dang stong phrag ni nyi shu gnyis so //
