analyzed: de yang kha tshon du dpag tshad 'bum phrag gsum dang stong phrag ni nyi shu gnyis so //
translated: The sides of Meru are 300,000 yojanas in height and 2,500 yojanas in width.

original: de la ri rab kyi ngos bzhi ni gling bzhi ste /🔽de la ni 'dzam bu'i gling ste ngos gsum la /
analyzed: de la ri rab kyi ngos bzhi ni gling bzhi ste / de la ni 'dzam bu'i gling ste ngos gsum la /
translated: The four sides of Meru are the four continents.🔽Jambudvīpa is triangular, 2,000 yojanas on each side.

original: stong phrag gnyis po shing rta'i dbyibs //
analyzed: stong phrag gnyis po shing rta'i dbyibs //
translated: It has the shape of a cart.

original: de'i ngos gsum la dpag tshad nyis stong nyis stong yod la /
analyzed: de'i ngos gsum la dpag tshad nyis stong nyis stong yod la /
translated: It has three sides of 2,000 yojanas each, and one side of 350 yojanas.

original: de'i dbyibs kyang shing rta dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de'i dbyibs kyang shing rta dang 'dra'o //
translated: It has the shape of a cart.

original: de'i dbus su gser gyi rang bzhin gyi sa gzhi la gang du byang chub sems dpa' ba zhugs nas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin skyed par mdzad pa rdo rje'i gdan mngon par 'grub ste /🔽de ni lus sam sa phyog  gzhan @146a * //

analyzed: stong phrag phyed dang brgyad yin no //

analyzed: de bzhin du lam ring por mi 'gro'o //

analyzed: de dag thams cad kyi rnam par gzhag pa yang ming yin pas de'i mtha' yang brjod par bya ste /

analyzed: ming gi mtha' ni yi ge ste /
translated: The limit of name is the syllable.

original: dper na ba lang zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ba lang zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the name of a cow.

original: yang skad cig ma'i tshad ji tsam zhe na /
analyzed: yang skad cig ma'i tshad ji tsam zhe na /
translated: What is the measure of an instant?

original: rkyen rnams tshogs na ji srid du chos kyi bdag nyid thob ba'am /
analyzed: rkyen rnams tshogs na ji srid du chos kyi bdag nyid thob ba'am /
translated: As long as the conditions are assembled, the self of dharmas is obtained.

original: chos 'gro phan ji srid du rdul phra rab nas rdul phra rab gzhan du 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: chos 'gro phan ji srid du rdul phra rab nas rdul phra rab gzhan du 'gro ba yin no //
translated: As long as the dharmas are not destroyed, the subtle particle moves from one subtle particle to another.

original: chos mngon pa rnams na re skyes bu stobs dang ldan pa'i se gol gtogs pa tsam gyis skad cig ma drug cu rtsa lnga 'da'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: chos mngon pa rnams na re skyes bu stobs dang ldan pa'i se gol gtogs pa tsam gyis skad cig ma drug cu rtsa lnga 'da'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The Abhidharmikas say: In the time it takes a strong man to snap his fingers, 65 moments elapse.

original: de la phra rab rdul dang ni //
analyzed: de la phra rab rdul dang ni //
translated: In that, the subtle particle,

original: rdul phran dang ni de bzhin du //🔽lcags chu ri bong lug dang glang //
analyzed: rdul phran dang ni de bzhin du // lcags chu ri bong lug dang glang //
translated: the atom, and likewise the copper particle,🔽the water particle, the rabbit particle, the sheep particle, the ox particle,

original: nyi zer rdul dang sro ma dang // de las byung dang de bzhin du //
analyzed: nyi zer rdul dang sro ma dang // de las byung dang de bzhin du //
translated: the louse egg, the barley grain, and the finger joint

original: sor tshigs zhes bya gong bdun 'gyur //
analyzed: sor tshigs zhes bya gong bdun 'gyur //
translated: are each seven times larger than the previous.

original: rdul phra rab la sogs pa 'di dag ni gong nas gong du bdun 'gyur du rig par bya ste /🔽rdul phra rab bdun la ni rdul phran no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab la sogs pa 'di dag ni gong nas gong du bdun 'gyur du rig par bya ste / rdul phra rab bdun la ni rdul phran no //
translated: These subtle particles and so on should be known to be seven times larger than the previous.🔽Seven subtle particles make one atom.

original: rdul phran bdun la ni lcags rdul lo //
analyzed: rdul phran bdun la ni lcags rdul lo //
translated: Seven atoms make one copper particle.

original: de dag bdun la ni chu rdul lo //
analyzed: de dag bdun la ni chu rdul lo //
translated: Seven of those make one water particle.

original: de dag bdun la ni ri bong gi rdul lo //🔽de dag bdun la ni lug rdul lo //
analyzed: de dag bdun la ni ri bong gi rdul lo // de dag bdun la ni lug rdul lo //
translated: Seven of those is a rabbit particle.🔽Seven of those is a sheep particle.

original: de dag bdun la ni glang rdul lo //
analyzed: de dag bdun la ni glang rdul lo //
translated: Seven of those is an ox particle.

original: de dag bdun la ni nyi zer rdul lo //🔽de dag bdun la ni sro ma'o //
analyzed: de dag bdun la ni nyi zer rdul lo // de dag bdun la ni sro ma'o //
translated: Seven of those is a sun ray particle.🔽Seven of those is a louse egg.

original: sro ma bdun la ni de las byung ba ste /
analyzed: sro ma bdun la ni de las byung ba ste /
translated: Seven louse eggs is one louse.

original: sro ma las byung ba ni shig cis bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽shig bdun la ni nas so //
analyzed: sro ma las byung ba ni shig cis bya ba'i tha tshig go // shig bdun la ni nas so //
translated: A louse is the same as a barley grain.

original: nas bdun la ni sor mo'i tshigs so //
analyzed: nas bdun la ni sor mo'i tshigs so //
translated: Seven barley grains is one finger width.🔽Three finger widths is one cubit.

original: sor mo'i tshigs gsum la ni sor mo zhes bya bar grags pa nyid pas ma bshad do //
analyzed: sor mo'i tshigs gsum la ni sor mo zhes bya bar grags pa nyid pas ma bshad do //
translated: The cubit is well known, so it is not explained.

original: ngos su bya ba ni /🔽sor ni nyi shu bzhi la khru //
analyzed: ngos su bya ba ni / sor ni nyi shu bzhi la khru //
translated: The measurements of distance are as follows:🔽Twenty-four finger widths is one cubit.

original: khru bzhi la ni gzhu gang ngo //
analyzed: khru bzhi la ni gzhu gang ngo //
translated: Four cubits is one bow-length.

original: 'dom gang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dom gang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One bow-length is one fathom.

original: de dag lnga brgya rnams la ni //
analyzed: de dag lnga brgya rnams la ni //
translated: Five hundred of those is one krosa.

original: rgyang grags de la dgon par 'dod //
analyzed: rgyang grags de la dgon par 'dod //
translated: That is considered a wilderness.

original: gzhu lnga brgya la ni rgyang grags te /
analyzed: gzhu lnga brgya la ni rgyang grags te /
translated: Five hundred bows is one krosa.

original: grong nas rgyang grags tsam gyi thag la ni dgon pa yin par 'dod do //🔽de brgyad dpag tshad ces bya'o //
analyzed: grong nas rgyang grags tsam gyi thag la ni dgon pa yin par 'dod do // de brgyad dpag tshad ces bya'o //
translated: The monastery is one krośa from the village.🔽Eight of these make one krośa.

original: rgyang grags de dag brgyad la dpag tshad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rgyang grags de dag brgyad la dpag tshad ces bya'o //
translated: Eight of these are one krośa.

original: dpag tshad kyi tshad ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: dpag tshad kyi tshad ni bshad zin to //
translated: The measure of a krośa has been explained.

original: da ni lo'i tshad brjod par bya ste /🔽skad cig ma brgya nyi shu la /
analyzed: da ni lo'i tshad brjod par bya ste / skad cig ma brgya nyi shu la /
translated: Now the measure of a year will be explained.🔽Twenty-four of these are one instant.

original: de yi skad cig / skad cig ma brgya nyi shul de'i skad cig go //🔽de dag kyang /🔽drug cu la ni thang cig go //
analyzed: de yi skad cig / skad cig ma brgya nyi shul de'i skad cig go // de dag kyang / drug cu la ni thang cig go //
translated: Twenty-four of these are one instant.🔽Sixty of these are one second.

original: de'i skad cig drug cu la ni thang cig ces bya'o //🔽yud tsam nyin zhag zla gsum ni //🔽gong nas gong du sum cur 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i skad cig drug cu la ni thang cig ces bya'o // yud tsam nyin zhag zla gsum ni // gong nas gong du sum cur 'gyur //
translated: Sixty of these are one second.🔽Thirty of these are one period.🔽Thirty of these are one period.

original: thang @155b cig sum cu la yud tsam mo //
analyzed: thang @155b cig sum cu la yud tsam mo //
translated: Thirty of these are one day and night.

original: yud tsam sum cu la ni nyin zhag gcig go //
analyzed: yud tsam sum cu la ni nyin zhag gcig go //
translated: Thirty of these are one day and night.

original: res 'ga' ni mtshan mo ring ngo //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni mtshan mo ring ngo //
translated: Sometimes the night is longer,

original: res 'ga' ni thung ngo //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni thung ngo //
translated: sometimes shorter,

original: res 'ga' ni mnyam mo //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni mnyam mo //
translated: and sometimes equal.

original: nyin zhag sum cu la ni zla ba gcig go //
analyzed: nyin zhag sum cu la ni zla ba gcig go //
translated: Thirty of these are one month.

original: zhag mi thub dang bcas pa yi //
analyzed: zhag mi thub dang bcas pa yi //
translated: The year has twelve months,

original: zla ba bcu gnyis la lo gcig go //
analyzed: zla ba bcu gnyis la lo gcig go //
translated: with an intercalary month from time to time.

original: dgun rnams kyi zla ba bzhi dang / dpyid rnams kyi zla ba bzhi dang / dbyar rnams kyi zla ba bzhi ste /
analyzed: dgun rnams kyi zla ba bzhi dang / dpyid rnams kyi zla ba bzhi dang / dbyar rnams kyi zla ba bzhi ste /
translated: Four months of winter, four months of spring, and four months of summer.

original: de dag zla ba bcu gnyis po de dag zhag mi thub dang bcas pa la lo gcig go //
analyzed: de dag zla ba bcu gnyis po de dag zhag mi thub dang bcas pa la lo gcig go //
translated: These twelve months make up the year, with an intercalary month from time to time.

original: lo la ni zhag gcig gi shol drug dor te /
analyzed: lo la ni zhag gcig gi shol drug dor te /
translated: In the course of a year, six days are subtracted,

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: dgun dang dpyid dang dbyar rnams kyi //
analyzed: dgun dang dpyid dang dbyar rnams kyi //
translated: In the course of the four months of winter,

original: zla ba phyed dang gnyis 'das nas//
analyzed: zla ba phyed dang gnyis 'das nas//
translated: two halfmonths are subtracted;🔽in the course of the four months of summer,🔽two halfmonths are subtracted;🔽in the course of the four months of spring,

original: zla ba phyed ni lus pa na //🔽mkhas pas zhag mi thub pa dor //
analyzed: zla ba phyed ni lus pa na // mkhas pas zhag mi thub pa dor //
translated: two halfmonths are subtracted.🔽The year is thus of 360 days.

original: lo'i tshad bshad zin to //🔽da ni bskal pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: lo'i tshad bshad zin to // da ni bskal pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: The kalpa has been mentioned;🔽but what is the extent of a kalpa?

original: bskal ba rnam pa mang bshad pa //
analyzed: bskal ba rnam pa mang bshad pa //
translated: The kalpa is of many types:🔽small kalpa, kalpa of disappearance, kalpa of creation, great kalpa.

original: bar gyi bskal pa dang / 'jig pa'i bskal pa dang / 'chags pa'i bskal pa dang / bskal pa chen po'i //
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa dang / 'jig pa'i bskal pa dang / 'chags pa'i bskal pa dang / bskal pa chen po'i //
translated: The small kalpa is the time required for the life of humans to

original: de la re zhig /'jig pa'i bskal pa dmyal ba yi //🔽srid pa med nas snod zad pa //
analyzed: de la re zhig /'jig pa'i bskal pa dmyal ba yi //🔽srid pa med nas snod zad pa //
translated: pass from a maximum of 80,000 years to a minimum of 10 years.🔽The kalpa of disappearance is the time required for the life of humans to pass from a maximum of 80,000 years to a length of 10 years.

original: dmyal ba dag nas sems can mi srid pa nas bzung ste snod zad pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: dmyal ba dag nas sems can mi srid pa nas bzung ste snod zad pa'i bar ro //
translated: The world is destroyed from the destruction of the hells up to the destruction of the physical cosmos.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of this destruction?

original: 'jig pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: 'jig pa ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of destruction:

original: 'gro ba 'jig pa dang / khams 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'jig pa dang / khams 'jig pa'o //
translated: destruction of the world spheres and destruction of the realms of sentient beings.

original: yang gnyis te /
analyzed: yang gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of destruction of the world spheres:

original: sems can 'jig pa dang snod 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: sems can 'jig pa dang snod 'jig pa'o //
translated: destruction of the physical cosmos and destruction of sentient beings.

original: gang sems can rnams dmyal ba dag nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur zhing skye bar mi 'gyur ba de lta bu'i dus kyang yod de /
analyzed: gang sems can rnams dmyal ba dag nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur zhing skye bar mi 'gyur ba de lta bu'i dus kyang yod de /
translated: There is a time when sentient beings die in the hells and are not reborn there.

original: da ni 'jig pa'i bskal pa mgo brtsam pa yin te /🔽gang 'jig rten 'di chags nas bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur 'dug pa de las ni nges par 'byung ba zhes brjod par bya la /
analyzed: da ni 'jig pa'i bskal pa mgo brtsam pa yin te / gang 'jig rten 'di chags nas bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur 'dug pa de las ni nges par 'byung ba zhes brjod par bya la /
translated: The present eon of duration has begun.🔽The eon that lasts from the time the world is formed until the time it remains is called the eon of creation.

original: gang bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur 'jig par 'gyur ba de la ni zhugs pa zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gang bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur 'jig par 'gyur ba de la ni zhugs pa zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: The eon that lasts for twenty intermediate eons during which the world is destroyed is called the eon of destruction.

original: gang gi tshe dmyal ba dag na sems can 'ga' yang ma lus par gyur pa de tsam gyis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dmyal ba dag na sems can 'ga' yang ma lus par gyur pa de tsam gyis 'di lta ste /
translated: When no sentient beings remain in the hells, the destruction of sentient beings in the hells is finished.

original: dmyal ba 'jig pas 'jig rten 'di zhig pa yin no //
analyzed: dmyal ba 'jig pas 'jig rten 'di zhig pa yin no //
translated: The world is destroyed by the destruction of the hells.

original: de'i tshe gang la nges par dmyal ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i las yod pa de ni 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag tu 'phen par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe gang la nges par dmyal ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i las yod pa de ni 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag tu 'phen par 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, those who have the action to be experienced in hell are projected into another universe where there are hells.

original: dud 'gro myong bar 'gyur ba dang / yi dags myong bar 'gyur ba yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dud 'gro myong bar 'gyur ba dang / yi dags myong bar 'gyur ba yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same for animals and hungry ghosts.

original: rgya mtsho chen po na 'khod pa'i dud 'gro rnams ni sngar 'jig go //
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po na 'khod pa'i dud 'gro rnams ni sngar 'jig go //
translated: The animals that live in the great ocean perish first.

original: mi dang lhan cig rgyu ba rnams ni de dag mi dang @156a * //🔽lhan cig tu'o //
analyzed: mi dang lhan cig rgyu ba rnams ni de dag mi dang @156a * // lhan cig tu'o //
translated: Those that live with humans perish with the humans.🔽Those that live in the sky perish with the gods of the heaven of the Thirty-three.

original: gang mi rnams dag gi nang na sems can gang yang rung ba bdag nyid kyis slob dpon med par chos nyid kyis thob pa'i bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa de lta bu'i dus kyang yod de /
analyzed: gang mi rnams dag gi nang na sems can gang yang rung ba bdag nyid kyis slob dpon med par chos nyid kyis thob pa'i bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa de lta bu'i dus kyang yod de /
translated: There is a time when, among humans, a certain being enters, by the power of actions, into the first meditation, which is free from the defilements of the realm of desire.

original: de de las langs nas tshig tu kye ma dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba ni bde ba yin no //
analyzed: de de las langs nas tshig tu kye ma dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba ni bde ba yin no //
translated: Having risen from this meditation, he exclaims: “Happy is the joy-pleasure born of detachment! Calm is the joy-pleasure born of detachment!”

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba ni zhi ba yin no zhes kyang smra la /
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba ni zhi ba yin no zhes kyang smra la /
translated: The pleasure and joy born of seclusion is peace.

original: sgra de thos nas sems can de dag kyang snyoms par 'jug cing /
analyzed: sgra de thos nas sems can de dag kyang snyoms par 'jug cing /
translated: Hearing this sound, sentient beings enter meditative attainment and

original: shi nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur te /🔽gang gi tshe 'dzam bu'i gling na sems can 'ga' yang ma lus par gyur na de tsam gyis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: shi nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur te / gang gi tshe 'dzam bu'i gling na sems can 'ga' yang ma lus par gyur na de tsam gyis 'di lta ste /
translated: after death they are born in the Brahma realm.🔽When no sentient beings remain in Jambudvīpa, this much is the destruction of the world

original: 'dzam bu'i gling 'jig pas 'jig rten 'di zhig pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling 'jig pas 'jig rten 'di zhig pa yin no //
translated: through the destruction of Jambudvīpa.

original: shar gyi lus 'phags dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan 'jig pa dag kyang de bzhin du brjod par bya ste /🔽gang gi tshe mi dag gi nang na sems can 'ga' yang ma lus par gyur pa de tsam gyis na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: shar gyi lus 'phags dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan 'jig pa dag kyang de bzhin du brjod par bya ste / gang gi tshe mi dag gi nang na sems can 'ga' yang ma lus par gyur pa de tsam gyis na 'di lta ste /
translated: The destruction of Videha in the east, Godaniya in the west and Kuru in the north should be stated in the same way.🔽When no sentient beings remain among humans, this much is the destruction of the world

original: mi 'jig pas 'jig rten 'di zhig pa yin no //
analyzed: mi 'jig pas 'jig rten 'di zhig pa yin no //
translated: through the destruction of humans.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha dag gi nang du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha dag gi nang du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: The gods of the northern Kuru live in the desire realm.

original: de na 'dod chags dang bral ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na 'dod chags dang bral ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not free from attachment.

original: de bzhin du rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha dag na /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha dag na /
translated: Similarly, the gods of the Caturmaharajakayika

original: yang bsam gtan dang po bskyed pa nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang bsam gtan dang po bskyed pa nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: generate the first absorption and are reborn in the Brahma world.

original: gang gi tshe de na sems can 'ga' yang ma lus par gyur na de tsam gyis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de na sems can 'ga' yang ma lus par gyur na de tsam gyis 'di lta ste /
translated: When no sentient beings remain there,

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris 'jig pas 'jig rten 'di zhig pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris 'jig pas 'jig rten 'di zhig pa yin no //
translated: the world has been destroyed by the destruction of the Caturmaharajakayika gods.

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed 'jig pa'i bar du yang de bzhin du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed 'jig pa'i bar du yang de bzhin du brjod par bya ste /
translated: The same should be said for the destruction of the Paranirmitavasavartin gods.

original: gang gi tshe 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha dag gi nang na sems can 'ga' yang ma lus par gyur pa de tsam gyis na 'di lta ste 'dod pa'i khams 'jig pas 'jig rten 'di zhig pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha dag gi nang na sems can 'ga' yang ma lus par gyur pa de tsam gyis na 'di lta ste 'dod pa'i khams 'jig pas 'jig rten 'di zhig pa yin no //
translated: When no sentient beings remain in the desire realm, the world has been destroyed by the destruction of the desire realm.

original: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten na yang sems can gang yang rung ba zhig chos nyid kyis thob pa'i bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten na yang sems can gang yang rung ba zhig chos nyid kyis thob pa'i bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: When a sentient being enters meditative attainment in the second absorption obtained by the power of the Dharma in the Brahma world,

original: langs nas tshig tu kye ma ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba ni bde ba yin no //
analyzed: langs nas tshig tu kye ma ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba ni bde ba yin no //
translated: he rises and says, “Oh! The pleasure and joy born of concentration is blissful.

original: kye ma ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba ni zhi ba yin no zhes smra ba /
analyzed: kye ma ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba ni zhi ba yin no zhes smra ba /
translated: Oh! The pleasure and joy born of concentration is peaceful.”

original: sems can gzhan dag gis kyang sgra de thos nas snyoms par 'jug @156b cing shi nas kyang 'od gsal gyi lha dag gi nang du skye bar 'gyur te /🔽gang gi tshe tshangs pa'i 'jig rten na sems can 'ga' yang ma lus par gyur na de tsam gyis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems can gzhan dag gis kyang sgra de thos nas snyoms par 'jug @156b cing shi nas kyang 'od gsal gyi lha dag gi nang du skye bar 'gyur te / gang gi tshe tshangs pa'i 'jig rten na sems can 'ga' yang ma lus par gyur na de tsam gyis 'di lta ste /
translated: Other sentient beings hear his words and they too enter meditative attainment and when they die, they are born among the Abhasvara gods.

original: sems can 'jig pas 'jig rten 'di zhig pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can 'jig pas 'jig rten 'di zhig pa yin no //
translated: When no sentient beings remain in the Brahma world, this world system has disintegrated due to the destruction of sentient beings.

original: de'i 'og tu sems can rnams kyi da 'phen pa'i las yongs su zad pa dang / snod stong pas 'di nyid nas kun nas nyi ma bdun byung nas rim gyis sa dang ri rab kyi bar du ma lus par sreg par byed do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems can rnams kyi da 'phen pa'i las yongs su zad pa dang / snod stong pas 'di nyid nas kun nas nyi ma bdun byung nas rim gyis sa dang ri rab kyi bar du ma lus par sreg par byed do //
translated: the seven suns appear in this world and gradually burn up the earth and even Mount Meru.

original: rab tu 'bar ba de nyid las me lce rlung gis khyer nas tshangs pa'i gzhal med khang gi bar du sreg par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu 'bar ba de nyid las me lce rlung gis khyer nas tshangs pa'i gzhal med khang gi bar du sreg par 'gyur ro //
translated: The tongues of flame carried by the wind burn up the abodes of the Brahmas.

original: me lce de dang de'i sa pa kho nar rig par bya ste ;
analyzed: me lce de dang de'i sa pa kho nar rig par bya ste ;
translated: The tongues of flame belong to the realm where they arise.

original: ris mi mthun pa'i skyon dag 'gro ba ni med de /
analyzed: ris mi mthun pa'i skyon dag 'gro ba ni med de /
translated: They do not move to other realms.

original: de dang 'brel pa las byung ba nyid kyi phyir de nyid las zhes bshad de /
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa las byung ba nyid kyi phyir de nyid las zhes bshad de /
translated: The expression “from there” is used because the tongues of flame arise in connection with the realm of desire.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i me ni gzugs na spyod pa dang 'brel par byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i me ni gzugs na spyod pa dang 'brel par byed do //
translated: The fire of the realm of desire is connected with the fire of the realm of fine-materiality.

original: de bzhin du 'jig pa gzhan dag la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig pa gzhan dag la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same holds for the other destructions, as is appropriate in each case.

original: de ltar na dmyal ba dag na sems can rnams 'chi 'pho ba dang mi skye ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de ltar na dmyal ba dag na sems can rnams 'chi 'pho ba dang mi skye ba nas bzung ste /
translated: Thus, in the hells, sentient beings die and transmigrate and are not born.🔽

original: snod rnams zad pa'i bar gyi dus de ni 'jig pa'i bskal pa zhes bya'o //🔽'chags pa dang po'i rlung ni dmyal ba srid pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: snod rnams zad pa'i bar gyi dus de ni 'jig pa'i bskal pa zhes bya'o // 'chags pa dang po'i rlung ni dmyal ba srid pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Thus the period from the time sentient beings die in the hells and are not reborn there until the physical cosmos is destroyed is called the eon of destruction.🔽The wind that first arises in the eon of formation lasts until the hells are formed.

original: dang po'i rlung nas bzung ste dmyal ba dag nas sems can srid pa'i bar te /
analyzed: dang po'i rlung nas bzung ste dmyal ba dag nas sems can srid pa'i bar te /
translated: The wind that first arises in the eon of formation lasts until the hells are formed.

original: de ltar 'jig rten zhig pa ni nam mkha' tsam lus par yun ring du gnas so //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten zhig pa ni nam mkha' tsam lus par yun ring du gnas so //
translated: Thus the world remains destroyed for a long time, until only space remains.

original: yang rim gyis sems can rnams kyi las kyi dbang gis nam mkha' la snod rnams kyi snga ltas su gyur pa rlung 'jam po 'jam po dag ldang ste /
analyzed: yang rim gyis sems can rnams kyi las kyi dbang gis nam mkha' la snod rnams kyi snga ltas su gyur pa rlung 'jam po 'jam po dag ldang ste /
translated: Then, due to the power of the karma of sentient beings, a subtle wind arises in space, which is a sign that the physical cosmos will form.

original: de'i tshe 'jig rten 'di zhig nas bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur 'dug pa gang yin pa de las ni nges par byung ba zhes brjod par bya la /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'jig rten 'di zhig nas bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur 'dug pa gang yin pa de las ni nges par byung ba zhes brjod par bya la /
translated: The period when this world is destroyed and remains destroyed for twenty intermediate eons is called the eon of destruction.

original: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur 'chags par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni nye bar 'ongs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur 'chags par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni nye bar 'ongs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The period of twenty intermediate eons during which the world remains formed is called the present.

original: de nas rlung de dag skye ba na ji skad bshad pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas rlung de dag skye ba na ji skad bshad pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor du 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, when the winds arise, the circle of wind arises as previously described.

original: de'i 'og tu rim gyis chu'i dkyil 'khor dang / gser gyi rang bzhin gyis gzhi chen po dang / gling rnams dang / ri rab la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa'i rim pa dang tshul du thams cad 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rim gyis chu'i dkyil 'khor dang / gser gyi rang bzhin gyis gzhi chen po dang / gling rnams dang / ri rab la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa'i rim pa dang tshul du thams cad 'byung ngo //
translated: Then, gradually, the circle of water, the great ground of gold, the continents, Meru, etc., arise in the manner and order previously described.

original: dang por ni tshangs pa'i gzhal med khang 'byung ngo //🔽de'i 'og tu ni 'thab bral pa'i bar du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dang por ni tshangs pa'i gzhal med khang 'byung ngo // de'i 'og tu ni 'thab bral pa'i bar du 'byung ngo //
translated: First, the palace of Brahma appears.🔽Then, the other abodes of the gods of the realm of desire appear, up to the Yāma gods.

original: de'i 'og tu @157a * //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu @157a * //
translated: Then,

original: ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa ste /
translated: the circle of wind, etc., appear.

original: de tsam gyis na 'di lta ste snod chags pas 'jig rten 'di chags pa yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyis na 'di lta ste snod chags pas 'jig rten 'di chags pa yin no //
translated: At that moment, the world is formed, that is, the receptacle world is formed.

original: de nas sems can gang yang rung ba zhig 'od gsal dag nas shi 'phos nas tshangs pa'i gzhal med khang stong par skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de nas sems can gang yang rung ba zhig 'od gsal dag nas shi 'phos nas tshangs pa'i gzhal med khang stong par skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: Then, when a certain sentient being dies in Ābhāsvara Heaven and is reborn in the empty Brahma palace,

original: sems can gzhan dag kyang de nas shi 'phos nas tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gzhan dag kyang de nas shi 'phos nas tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: other sentient beings also die in Ābhāsvara Heaven and are reborn in the Brahma Heaven of Limited Radiance.

original: de'i 'og tu tshangs ris dag dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dag dang / 'phrul dga' dag nas rim gyis byang gi sgra mi snyan pa dang / ba lang spyod dang / shar gyi lus 'phags po dang / 'dzam bu'i gling dang / yi dgas rnams dang /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu tshangs ris dag dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dag dang / 'phrul dga' dag nas rim gyis byang gi sgra mi snyan pa dang / ba lang spyod dang / shar gyi lus 'phags po dang / 'dzam bu'i gling dang / yi dgas rnams dang /
translated: Then, in order, they are reborn in the Heaven of Brilliance, the Heaven of Extensive Rewards, the Heaven of the Thirty-three, the Heaven Free from Strife, the Heaven of Joy, the Heaven of Delighting in Creation, the Heaven of the Masters of Others’ Creations, the Northern Kuru, the western continent of Godānīya, the eastern continent of Videha, Jambudvīpa, the hungry ghosts,

original: dud 'gro rnams dang / dmyal ba dag gi nang du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dud 'gro rnams dang / dmyal ba dag gi nang du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: the animals, and the hells.

original: gang mjug tu 'jig pa de dang por 'chags pa 'di ni chos nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang mjug tu 'jig pa de dang por 'chags pa 'di ni chos nyid yin no //
translated: This is the natural order of the world’s formation and destruction.

original: gang gi tshe dmyal ba dag na sems can 'ga' zhig skyes par gyur pa de'i tshe 'jig rten 'di bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur 'chags pa gang yin pa de las ni nges par byung ba yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dmyal ba dag na sems can 'ga' zhig skyes par gyur pa de'i tshe 'jig rten 'di bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur 'chags pa gang yin pa de las ni nges par byung ba yin la /
translated: When a sentient being is born in the hells, then the world has been destroyed for twenty small kapas.🔽When the world has been destroyed for twenty small kapas, then the world will remain destroyed for twenty small kapas.

original: chags nas bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur 'dug par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni nye bar 'ongs pa yin no //🔽bar gyi bskal pa dpag med nas //
analyzed: chags nas bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur 'dug par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni nye bar 'ongs pa yin no // bar gyi bskal pa dpag med nas //
translated: The world remains destroyed for twenty small kapas.

original: tshe lo bcu pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: tshe lo bcu pa'i bar du'o //
translated: From the time when the life expectancy is infinite, it decreases until it is ten years in length.

original: 'jig rten chags pa na mi rnams kyi tshe dpag tu med pa la bar gyi bskal pa bcu dgur 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten chags pa na mi rnams kyi tshe dpag tu med pa la bar gyi bskal pa bcu dgur 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the world is in the process of creation, the life expectancy of humans is infinite.

original: tshe dpag tu med pa nas 'grib pa na tshe lo bcu pa'i bar du 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshe dpag tu med pa nas 'grib pa na tshe lo bcu pa'i bar du 'gyur te /
translated: When it decreases, it decreases from infinite to ten years in length.

original: 'di ni chags nas gnas pa rnams kyi bar gyi bskal pa dang po yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni chags nas gnas pa rnams kyi bar gyi bskal pa dang po yin no //
translated: This is the first small kalpa of the creation period.

original: de nas yar skye mar 'bri ba'i //
analyzed: de nas yar skye mar 'bri ba'i //
translated: From this point on, the increase and decrease take place

original: bskal pa / gzhan ni bco brgyad dang // de nas yar skye ba dang mar 'bri ba gzhan bco brgyad de /
analyzed: bskal pa / gzhan ni bco brgyad dang // de nas yar skye ba dang mar 'bri ba gzhan bco brgyad de /
translated: The other eighteen are of increase and decrease.🔽Then there are eighteen other periods of increase and decrease.

original: bar gyi bskal pa gzhan bco brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa gzhan bco brgyad du 'gyur ro //

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /

analyzed: tshe lo bcu pa de dag kyang yar skye bar 'gyur ba na rim gyis tshe lo brgyad khri'i bar 'gyur /
translated: When the life expectancy of humans increases from ten years to eighty thousand years, this constitutes one intermediate eon.

analyzed: yang mar 'bri bar 'gyur ba na tshe lo bcu par 'gyur ba 'di ni bar gyi bskal pa gnyis pa yin te /
translated: When the life expectancy of humans decreases from ten years to eighty thousand years, this constitutes a second intermediate eon.

original: de lta bu bco brgyad kyi bar dang / yar skye ba ni gcig yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu bco brgyad kyi bar dang / yar skye ba ni gcig yin te /
translated: There are eighteen such periods of increase and decrease.

original: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shu pa gcig ni yar skye ba kho na yin gyi mar 'grib pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shu pa gcig ni yar skye ba kho na yin gyi mar 'grib pa ni ma yin no //
translated: One period of increase is not followed by a period of decrease.

analyzed: mi rnams kyi tshe lo bcu pa dag las tshe lo @157b brgyad khri pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: The life expectancy of humans increases from ten years to eighty thousand years.

original: yang mar skye ba de dag ji tsam du yang skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang mar skye ba de dag ji tsam du yang skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How long does it take for the life expectancy to decrease from eighty thousand years to ten years?

original: de dag tshe ni brgyad khri'i bar //
analyzed: de dag tshe ni brgyad khri'i bar //
translated: The life expectancy of humans increases to eighty thousand years.

original: de las yar ni mi skye'o //
analyzed: de las yar ni mi skye'o //
translated: The world does not increase beyond this limit.

original: bar gyi bskal pa gzhan rnams kyi yar skye ba dang mar 'grib pa'i dus ji srid par bar gyi bskal pa dang po'i mar 'grib pa dang tha ma'i yar skye ba'i dus kyang de srid pas thams cad dus mnyam pa yin no //🔽de ltar 'jig rten chags pa 'di //
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa gzhan rnams kyi yar skye ba dang mar 'grib pa'i dus ji srid par bar gyi bskal pa dang po'i mar 'grib pa dang tha ma'i yar skye ba'i dus kyang de srid pas thams cad dus mnyam pa yin no // de ltar 'jig rten chags pa 'di //
translated: The time of the increase of the first intermediate kalpa is equal to the time of the decrease of the last intermediate kalpa.

original: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur gnas //
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur gnas //
translated: The world stays created for twenty intermediate kalpas.🔽The world stays created for twenty intermediate kalpas.🔽The time of creation is equal to the time of the world’s duration.🔽The time of the creation of the world is equal to the time of the duration of the world.🔽The time of the creation of the world is equal to the time of its disappearance.

original: de ltar na bar gyi bskal pa'i tshul 'dis 'jig rten 'di bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur chags nas gnas so //🔽dus ji srid du chags nas gnas pa'i dus de srid kho nar /
analyzed: de ltar na bar gyi bskal pa'i tshul 'dis 'jig rten 'di bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur chags nas gnas so // dus ji srid du chags nas gnas pa'i dus de srid kho nar /
translated: The time of the disappearance of the world is equal to the time of its duration.🔽The time of the disappearance of the world is equal to the time of its creation.

analyzed: 'chags pa dang ni 'jig pa dang // zhig nas 'dug pa dag mnyam mo // bar gyi bskal pa nyi shu kho nar 'chags so // nyi shur 'jig go //

original: nyi shur zhig nas 'dug go //
analyzed: nyi shur zhig nas 'dug go //
translated: The time of the disappearance of the world is equal to the time of its creation.🔽The

original: gal te yang de'i tshe yar skye ba dang mar 'grib pa mi 'jug tu zin kyang dus ni mnyam par yongs su brtsi'o //
analyzed: gal te yang de'i tshe yar skye ba dang mar 'grib pa mi 'jug tu zin kyang dus ni mnyam par yongs su brtsi'o //
translated: If, at that time, the world is not in the process of creation or dissolution, then the eon is considered as having a duration equal to the sum of these periods.

original: de la bar gyi bskal pa gcig tu snod rnams 'chags so //
analyzed: de la bar gyi bskal pa gcig tu snod rnams 'chags so //
translated: One intermediate eon is required for the world to be created;

original: bar gyi bskal pa bcu dgur gnas par byed do //
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa bcu dgur gnas par byed do //
translated: nineteen for it to be created and for the world to remain created;

original: bar gyi bskal pa gcig tu snod rnams 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa gcig tu snod rnams 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: one for the world to be destroyed;

original: bcu dgur stong par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcu dgur stong par 'gyur ro //
translated: nineteen for the world to be destroyed and for the world to remain destroyed.

original: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shu phrag bzhi po de dag ni brgyad cur 'gyur te /
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shu phrag bzhi po de dag ni brgyad cur 'gyur te /
translated: Four groups of twenty intermediate eons make eighty intermediate eons.

original: de dag brgyad cu la bskal chen //🔽bskal pa chen po'i tshad ni de yin no //
analyzed: de dag brgyad cu la bskal chen // bskal pa chen po'i tshad ni de yin no //
translated: Eighty of these make a great eon.

original: bskal pa'i rang bzhin ci zhe na /
analyzed: bskal pa'i rang bzhin ci zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of the great eon?

original: phung po lnga'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: phung po lnga'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The great eon is of the nature of the five aggregates.

analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa de bskal pa de dag gang zhe na /
translated: The acquisition of the quality of Buddhahood requires three asaṃkhyeyas of great eons.

original: bskal pa chen por bshad pa gang yin pa /
analyzed: bskal pa chen por bshad pa gang yin pa /
translated: What is the measure of a great eon?

original: de grangs med gsum la sangs rgyas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de grangs med gsum la sangs rgyas 'byung ngo //
translated: The Buddha arises after three measureless eons.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis so //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis so //

analyzed: grangs med pa la grangs kyi mtha' med na ji ltar gsum nyid du brjod ce na /

original: de ni de ltar rig par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ni de ltar rig par mi bya'o //
translated: It should not be understood in that way.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /🔽mdo sil bu las /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / mdo sil bu las /
translated: What then?🔽In the Sutra of Fragments it is said:

original: grangs ni gnas gzhan drug cu dag go zhes 'byung ngo /
analyzed: grangs ni gnas gzhan drug cu dag go zhes 'byung ngo /
translated: A measure is sixty eons.

original: drug cu gang zhe na /
analyzed: drug cu gang zhe na /

analyzed: gcig ste gnyis pa ma yin pa ni gnas gzhan dang po yin no // gcig bcu ni gnyis pa yin no //
translated: One is the first eon.🔽Ten ones are ten.

original: bcu phrag bcu la ni brgya ste gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: bcu phrag bcu la ni brgya ste gsum pa yin no //
translated: Ten tens are one hundred, which is the third.

analyzed: brgya phrag bcu la ni stong ngo // stong @158a * // phrag bcu la ni khri'o //

analyzed: khri phrag bcu la ni 'bum mo // 'bum phrag bcu la ni sa ya'o //

analyzed: sa ya phrag bcu la ni bye ba'o // bye ba phrag bcu la ni dung phyur ro //

analyzed: dung phyur phrag bcu la ni ther 'bum mo //
translated: Ten billions are ten billion.

analyzed: gtams phrag bcu la ni gtams chen no ; / gtams chen phrag bcu la ni dkrigs so //

original: dkrigs phrag bcu la ni dkrigs chen no //
analyzed: dkrigs phrag bcu la ni dkrigs chen no //
translated: Ten gambhīras is a mahāgambhīra.

original: dkrigs chen phrag bcu la ni mi 'khrugs pa'o //
analyzed: dkrigs chen phrag bcu la ni mi 'khrugs pa'o //

analyzed: mi 'khrugs pa phrag bcu la ni mi 'khrugs pa chen po'o //

analyzed: mi 'khrugs pa chen po phrag bcu la ni khyad phyin no // khyad phyin phrag bcu la ni khyad phyin chen po'o //

analyzed: khyad phyin chen po phrag bcu la ni pang steng ngo //

analyzed: pang steng phrag bcu la ni pang steng chen po'o // pang steng chen po phrag bcu la ni ded 'dren no //

original: ded 'dren phrag bcu la ni ded 'dren chen po'o //🔽ded 'dren chen po phrag bcu la ni mtha' snang ngo /
analyzed: ded 'dren phrag bcu la ni ded 'dren chen po'o // ded 'dren chen po phrag bcu la ni mtha' snang ngo /

analyzed: stobs mig phrag bcu la ni stobs mig chen po'o //
translated: Ten mahāsaṃjñās are a mahāsaṃjñā.

original: stobs mig chen po phrag bcu la ni grangs med pa ste /
analyzed: stobs mig chen po phrag bcu la ni grangs med pa ste /
translated: Ten asaṃkhyeyas to the power of ten is a mahāsaṃkhyeya.

original: bar gyi gnas brgyad ni ma rnyed do //🔽de ltar na gnas gzhan drug cur phyin pa de dag tu phyin pa'i bskal pa ni /
analyzed: bar gyi gnas brgyad ni ma rnyed do // de ltar na gnas gzhan drug cur phyin pa de dag tu phyin pa'i bskal pa ni /
translated: The eight intermediate places are not found.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the eons that are traversed in going to the other sixty places are called asaṃkhyeyakalpas.

original: de nas yang bzlog nas bgrang ste /
analyzed: de nas yang bzlog nas bgrang ste /
translated: Then, again, one counts in reverse.

original: de ltar na grangs med pa gsum zhes bya ba'i rnam pa thams cad du yongs su bgrang bar mi nus pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na grangs med pa gsum zhes bya ba'i rnam pa thams cad du yongs su bgrang bar mi nus pas ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is called three asaṃkhyeyas, but it is not that one cannot count them in every way.

original: 'o na yang byang chub sems dpa' smon lam btab pa rnams dus ring po kho nas mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na yang byang chub sems dpa' smon lam btab pa rnams dus ring po kho nas mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: But do bodhisattvas who have made prayers take a long time to fully awaken?

original: ci de de ltar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ci de de ltar 'gyur ram /
translated: What is the point of that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du dka' ba brgya stong gis bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //🔽gal te thar pa'i go skabs gzhan de lta ma yin pa yang yod na go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du dka' ba brgya stong gis bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro // gal te thar pa'i go skabs gzhan de lta ma yin pa yang yod na go //
translated: Bodhisattvas, through the six perfections, will fully awaken to supreme enlightenment after a long time, through the great collections of merit and wisdom, with hundreds of thousands of hardships.

original: de dag ci'i phyir 'bad pa 'di snyed cig rtsom par byed ce na /
analyzed: de dag ci'i phyir 'bad pa 'di snyed cig rtsom par byed ce na /
translated: If there is another way to liberation, why do they undertake so much effort?

original: de dag ni ji ltar na gzhan dag kyang sdug bsngal gyi chu bo chen po las yongs su bskyab par nus par 'gyur snyam du gzhan gyi don du 'bad pa rtsom par byed do //
analyzed: de dag ni ji ltar na gzhan dag kyang sdug bsngal gyi chu bo chen po las yongs su bskyab par nus par 'gyur snyam du gzhan gyi don du 'bad pa rtsom par byed do //
translated: They undertake effort for the sake of others, thinking, How can I be able to protect others from the great river of suffering?

original: 'di dag gi gzhan gyi don gyis bdag gi don du 'gyur ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag gi gzhan gyi don gyis bdag gi don du 'gyur ba gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the benefit for them in benefiting others?

original: de dag gi gzhan gyi don gang yin pa de nyid bdag gi don te /
analyzed: de dag gi gzhan gyi don gang yin pa de nyid bdag gi don te /
translated: That very benefit of others is their own benefit,

original: de 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they desire that.

original: da ni su zhig 'di la dad par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: da ni su zhig 'di la dad par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Now, who will have faith in this?

original: bdag gso bar byed pa'i snying rje med pa rnams kyis 'di la dad par dka' ba ni bden no //
analyzed: bdag gso bar byed pa'i snying rje med pa rnams kyis 'di la dad par dka' ba ni bden no //
translated: It is true that it is difficult for those who are without compassion to have faith in this.

original: snying rje can rnams kyis dad par byas zin pa yin te /
analyzed: snying rje can rnams kyis dad par byas zin pa yin te /
translated: But those who have compassion have already had faith in it.

original: dper na 'di na snying rje med pa la goms pa kha cig rang gi don med bzhin du yang gzhan nyon mongs pa la mngon par dga' ba dmigs pa de bzhin du snying rje la goms pa dag rang gi don med bzhin du yang gzhan la phan par🔽bya ba la mngon par dga' ba yod do snyam du yid ches par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na 'di na snying rje med pa la goms pa kha cig rang gi don med bzhin du yang gzhan nyon mongs pa la mngon par dga' ba dmigs pa de bzhin du snying rje la goms pa dag rang gi don med bzhin du yang gzhan la phan par bya ba la mngon par dga' ba yod do snyam du yid ches par bya'o //
translated: Just as one observes that some people, who are accustomed to being without compassion, delight in the suffering of others, even though it does not serve their own purpose, in the same way, one should have confidence that those who are accustomed to compassion delight in helping others, even though it does not serve their own purpose.

original: yang dper na 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid mngon par mi shes pa dag goms pa'i dbang gis @159a * //
analyzed: yang dper na 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid mngon par mi shes pa dag goms pa'i dbang gis @159a * //
translated: Moreover, it is just as one observes that some people, who are not aware of the characteristics of the conditioned, delight in the cessation of suffering, which is unconditioned, through the power of habituation.

original: 'dus byas bdag med par gyur pa dag la bdag tu chags pa bskyed nas rgyu des sdug bsngal dag nyams su myong par 'gyur ba de bzhin du goms pa'i dbang gis de dag las bdag tu chags pa bzlog nas /
analyzed: 'dus byas bdag med par gyur pa dag la bdag tu chags pa bskyed nas rgyu des sdug bsngal dag nyams su myong par 'gyur ba de bzhin du goms pa'i dbang gis de dag las bdag tu chags pa bzlog nas /
translated: Having generated attachment to a self in things that are compounded and have no self, one experiences suffering due to that cause.🔽

original: gzhan dag la lta ba bskyed de /
analyzed: gzhan dag la lta ba bskyed de /
translated: In the same way, through the power of practice, one should generate the view that the self is in others, and should reverse the attachment to the self that is in oneself.🔽Through that cause, one should experience suffering.

original: rgyu des sdug bsngal dag myong bar 'gyur ro snyam du yid ches par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu des sdug bsngal dag myong bar 'gyur ro snyam du yid ches par bya'o //
translated: One should have confidence in this.

original: gang gzhan dag gi sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gang gzhan dag gi sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: One should establish another kind of self, which is pained by the pain of others,

original: gzhan dag gi bde bas bde bar 'gyur gyi /🔽bdag nyid kyi ni ma yin pa de lta bu'i rigs gzhan kho na yang 'grub ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi bde bas bde bar 'gyur gyi / bdag nyid kyi ni ma yin pa de lta bu'i rigs gzhan kho na yang 'grub ste /
translated: and which is pleased by the pleasure of others,🔽but not by one’s own pleasure.

original: de lta ni rang gi don du mi blta'o //
analyzed: de lta ni rang gi don du mi blta'o //
translated: In this way, one should not regard one’s own self.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: dman pa de dang de'i thabs kyis rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i bde ba don du gnyer /
analyzed: dman pa de dang de'i thabs kyis rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i bde ba don du gnyer /
translated: “The inferior person seeks the pleasure that is in his own continuum by whatever means.

original: 'bring po sdug bsngal ldog pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'bring po sdug bsngal ldog pa kho na'o //
translated: The middling person seeks only to avoid pain.

original: bde min gang phyir de ni sdug bsngal gnas yin phyir //
analyzed: bde min gang phyir de ni sdug bsngal gnas yin phyir //
translated: Because it is the basis of suffering.

original: dam pa rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i sdug bsngal rnams kyis gzhan dag la ni bde ba dang // sdug bsngal gtan ldog kho na don gnyer gang phyir de yi sdug bsngal gyis de sdug bsngal phyir //🔽yang ci sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams yar skye ba'i tshe 'byung ngam /
analyzed: dam pa rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i sdug bsngal rnams kyis gzhan dag la ni bde ba dang // sdug bsngal gtan ldog kho na don gnyer gang phyir de yi sdug bsngal gyis de sdug bsngal phyir // yang ci sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams yar skye ba'i tshe 'byung ngam /
translated: The noble ones, because they have suffering in their own continuum, seek the happiness of others and the complete destruction of their suffering, because they are pained by the suffering of others.

original: 'on te mar 'grib pa'i tshe 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mar 'grib pa'i tshe 'byung zhe na /
translated: Do the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, appear when the life expectancy of humans is increasing, or when it is decreasing?

original: mar ni 'grib pa yi /🔽brgya yi bar la de dag 'byung //
analyzed: mar ni 'grib pa yi / brgya yi bar la de dag 'byung //
translated: They appear when it is decreasing.🔽They appear when the life expectancy is one hundred years.

original: skye dgu rnams kyi tshe lo brgyad khri ba mar 'grib pa nas brtsams pa nas mi rnams kyi tshe lo brgya pa yin pa'i bar 'dir sangs rgyas rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye dgu rnams kyi tshe lo brgyad khri ba mar 'grib pa nas brtsams pa nas mi rnams kyi tshe lo brgya pa yin pa'i bar 'dir sangs rgyas rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They appear when the life expectancy of humans is decreasing from eighty thousand years to one hundred years.

original: ci'i phyir yang skye ba'i dus su ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yang skye ba'i dus su ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why do they not appear when the life expectancy increases?

original: de'i tshe sems can rnams skyo bar dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe sems can rnams skyo bar dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because beings are then difficult to move.

original: ci'i phyir brgya las mar 'grib pa'i tshe ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir brgya las mar 'grib pa'i tshe ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why not when it decreases from one hundred years?

original: de'i tshe snyigs ma lnga po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe snyigs ma lnga po 'di lta ste /
translated: At that time, the five degenerations are very strong:

original: tshe'i snyigs ma dang / dus kyi snyigs ma dang / nyon mongs pa'i snyigs ma dang / lta ba'i snyigs ma dang / sems can gyi snyigs ma shin tu lhag pa yin te /
analyzed: tshe'i snyigs ma dang / dus kyi snyigs ma dang / nyon mongs pa'i snyigs ma dang / lta ba'i snyigs ma dang / sems can gyi snyigs ma shin tu lhag pa yin te /
translated: the degeneration of life, the degeneration of view, the degeneration of afflictions, the degeneration of sentient beings, and the degeneration of time.

original: mar 'grib pa'i 'og tu ni tshe la sogs pa tha chad yin no //
analyzed: mar 'grib pa'i 'og tu ni tshe la sogs pa tha chad yin no //
translated: When life decreases below one hundred years, life and so on become very degenerate.

original: ngan snyigs su gyur pa'i phyir snyigs ma dag ces bya'o ;
analyzed: ngan snyigs su gyur pa'i phyir snyigs ma dag ces bya'o ;
translated: They are called degenerations because they are the worst of the worst.

original: / gnyis kyis ni go rims bzhin du srog dang yo byad rgud par byed do //
analyzed: / gnyis kyis ni go rims bzhin du srog dang yo byad rgud par byed do //
translated: Two cause the degeneration of life and resources.

original: gnyis kyis ni 'dod pa'i bsod nyams dang bdag ngal ba la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: gnyis kyis ni 'dod pa'i bsod nyams dang bdag ngal ba la sogs pa'am /
translated: Two cause the degeneration of virtue, either through the degeneration of enjoyment of desire realm objects and the degeneration of self mortification,

original: yang na khyim pa'am rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyi dbang du byas nas dge ba'i phyogs rkud par byed do //
analyzed: yang na khyim pa'am rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyi dbang du byas nas dge ba'i phyogs rkud par byed do //
translated: or through the degeneration of the side of virtue in terms of the householder and monastic.

original: gcig gis ni lus @159b rgud par byed do //
analyzed: gcig gis ni lus @159b rgud par byed do //
translated: One causes the degeneration of body.

original: bong tshod dang / gzugs dang / nad med pa dang / stobs dang / blo dang / dran pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / brtan pa nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bong tshod dang / gzugs dang / nad med pa dang / stobs dang / blo dang / dran pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / brtan pa nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their size, beauty, health, strength, intelligence, memory, diligence, and firmness deteriorate.🔽When do pratyekabuddhas appear?

original: yang rang sangs rgyas rnams dus gang du 'byung zhe na /🔽rang sangs rgyas rnams gnyi ga la /
analyzed: yang rang sangs rgyas rnams dus gang du 'byung zhe na / rang sangs rgyas rnams gnyi ga la /
translated: Pratyekabuddhas appear in both🔽the ascending and descending eons.

original: yar skye ba la yang 'byung /🔽mar 'grib pa na yang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yar skye ba la yang 'byung / mar 'grib pa na yang 'byung ngo //
translated: Pratyekabuddhas appear in both ascending and descending eons.

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Pratyekabuddhas are of two types:

original: tshogs shing spyod pa rnams dang / bse ru lta bu rnams so //
analyzed: tshogs shing spyod pa rnams dang / bse ru lta bu rnams so //
translated: those who live in groups and those who are like rhinoceroses.

original: de la tshogs shing spyod pa rnams ni nyan thos kyi rigs su gyur pa sngon du 'gro ba'i rang rgyal ba rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la tshogs shing spyod pa rnams ni nyan thos kyi rigs su gyur pa sngon du 'gro ba'i rang rgyal ba rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who live in groups are called “former rhinoceroses” who were previously followers of the śrāvaka vehicle.

original: gzhan dag na re so so'i skye bo sngon du 'gro ba dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re so so'i skye bo sngon du 'gro ba dag kyang yod de /
translated: Others say that there are also those who were previously ordinary beings.

original: gang dag gzhan du nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams bskyed pa tshe 'di la bdag nyid kyis lam mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes zer zhing /
analyzed: gang dag gzhan du nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams bskyed pa tshe 'di la bdag nyid kyis lam mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes zer zhing /
translated: Some say: Those who definitely generate the factors conducive to penetrative insight in other lives fully awaken to the path on their own in this life.🔽They recite the following ancient account:🔽Five hundred ascetics were tormented by intense austerities and met a monkey who lived with a pratyekabuddha.

original: 'di skad du re zhig ri la dka' thub can lnga brgya zhig dka' thub drag po dag gis gdung bar byas pa na rang sangs rgyas dang lhan cig gnas gnas pa'i spre'u zhig dang phrad nas de'i spyod lam bstan pas rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub mngon par🔽rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du grag go zhes sngon gyi gtam 'don par byed do //
analyzed: 'di skad du re zhig ri la dka' thub can lnga brgya zhig dka' thub drag po dag gis gdung bar byas pa na rang sangs rgyas dang lhan cig gnas gnas pa'i spre'u zhig dang phrad nas de'i spyod lam bstan pas rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du grag go zhes sngon gyi gtam 'don par byed do //
translated: They saw the monkey's conduct and through that they fully awakened to pratyekabuddha enlightenment.

original: 'phags pa dag cig yin na ni dka' thub drag po dag gis gdung bar mi 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa dag cig yin na ni dka' thub drag po dag gis gdung bar mi 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: If they were āryas, they would not have been tormented by intense austerities.

original: bse ru lta bu rnams ni re re gnas pa dag yin no //
analyzed: bse ru lta bu rnams ni re re gnas pa dag yin no //
translated: Rhinoceros-like pratyekabuddhas live alone.

original: rang sangs rgyas de dag las /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas de dag las /
translated: From among those pratyekabuddhas,

original: bse ru bskal pa brgya'i rgyus bskal pa chen po brgyar byang chub kyi tshogs dag la spyod pas bse ru lta bur 'gyur ro //🔽lung med par bdag gcig pu'i phyir sangs rgyas pas rang sangs rgyas dag ste /
analyzed: bse ru bskal pa brgya'i rgyus bskal pa chen po brgyar byang chub kyi tshogs dag la spyod pas bse ru lta bur 'gyur ro // lung med par bdag gcig pu'i phyir sangs rgyas pas rang sangs rgyas dag ste /
translated: The rhinoceros-like one, by the cause of a hundred great aeons, becomes a rhinoceros-like one through practicing the accumulations for enlightenment for a hundred great aeons.🔽The solitary realizers are so called because they attain enlightenment without relying on a teacher, and because they teach the Dharma for the sake of themselves alone.

original: de dag ni bdag nyid 'dul bar byed kyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni bdag nyid 'dul bar byed kyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
translated: They are self-tamed, but not others.

original: 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the reason for this?

original: re zhig so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa'i phyir chos ston par mi spyod pa yang ma yin la //
analyzed: re zhig so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa'i phyir chos ston par mi spyod pa yang ma yin la //
translated: They are not those who do not engage in teaching the Dharma because they have attained the correct discriminations.

original: de dag gis sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi bstan pa rjes su dran nas yang chos ston par spyod do //🔽thugs rje med par yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag gis sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi bstan pa rjes su dran nas yang chos ston par spyod do // thugs rje med par yang ma yin te /
translated: They engage in teaching the Dharma because they recollect the teachings of the buddhas of the past.

original: sems can thams cad la phan gdags pa'i don du rdzu 'phrul ston pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan gdags pa'i don du rdzu 'phrul ston pa'i phyir ro /
translated: They are not those who lack compassion because they display miracles for the sake of benefiting all sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams skal ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sems can rnams skal ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not those who do not teach the Dharma because sentient beings lack good fortune.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba dag kyang yod do //
translated: There are also those who are detached through the mundane path.

original: 'o na ji lta zhe na /🔽sngon @160a * //
analyzed: 'o na ji lta zhe na / sngon @160a * //
translated: But how is this?

original: goms pa'i dbang gis bsod snyoms la mos pa'i phyir sems can rnams chos zab mo 'dzin du 'jug pa'i don du byed par mi spro ste /
analyzed: goms pa'i dbang gis bsod snyoms la mos pa'i phyir sems can rnams chos zab mo 'dzin du 'jug pa'i don du byed par mi spro ste /
translated: They are not capable of penetrating the profound Dharma, because they are attached to the enjoyment of the pleasures of the senses, due to the force of their previous habituation.

original: skye dgu rgyun phyogs su 'gro ba rnams ni rgyun phyogs las bzlog par bkri bar dka'o //
analyzed: skye dgu rgyun phyogs su 'gro ba rnams ni rgyun phyogs las bzlog par bkri bar dka'o //
translated: It is difficult to turn beings away from the current of samsara.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba dang 'du 'dzis skrag pas 'khor yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ba spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba dang 'du 'dzis skrag pas 'khor yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ba spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are afraid of distraction and of the bustle of a large retinue.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba rnams nam 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba rnams nam 'byung zhe na /
translated: When do the wheel-turning kings appear?

original: 'khor los sgyur ba 'byung ba ni //🔽stong phrag brgyad cu las mi 'phyi //🔽mi rnams kyi tshe dpag tu med pa nas brgyad khri'i bar du 'khor los sgyur ba rnams 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba 'byung ba ni // stong phrag brgyad cu las mi 'phyi // mi rnams kyi tshe dpag tu med pa nas brgyad khri'i bar du 'khor los sgyur ba rnams 'byung ngo //
translated: The wheel-turning kings appear🔽when the life expectancy is decreasing from infinite to eighty thousand years.

original: 'og tu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'og tu ni ma yin te /
translated: They do not appear when the life expectancy is decreasing from eighty thousand to one hundred years.

original: de bas thung ba'i tshe ni phun sum tshogs pa de'i snod ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas thung ba'i tshe ni phun sum tshogs pa de'i snod ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a life shorter than this is not a suitable receptacle for this perfection.

original: de dag ni rgyal srid 'khor los sgyur ba'i dang tshul can yin pas 'khor los sgyur ba rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ni rgyal srid 'khor los sgyur ba'i dang tshul can yin pas 'khor los sgyur ba rnams so //
translated: They are cakravartins, “universal monarchs,” because they have a wheel cakra.

original: de dag kyang rnam pa bzhi ste /🔽gser dngul zangs lcags 'khor lo can //
analyzed: de dag kyang rnam pa bzhi ste / gser dngul zangs lcags 'khor lo can //
translated: There are four types of cakravartins.🔽There are four types of cakravartins, according to whether their wheel is of gold, silver, copper, or iron.

original: gang dag la gser dang / dngul dang / zangs dang / lcags kyi 'khor lo dag yod pa ste /🔽de dag gi dang po ni mchog yin no //🔽gnyis pa ni nye ba'i mchog yin no //
analyzed: gang dag la gser dang / dngul dang / zangs dang / lcags kyi 'khor lo dag yod pa ste / de dag gi dang po ni mchog yin no // gnyis pa ni nye ba'i mchog yin no //
translated: The first has a wheel of gold; the second, a wheel of silver; the third, a wheel of copper; and the fourth, a wheel of iron.

original: gsum pa ni 'bring yin no //🔽bzhi pa ni tha ma'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni 'bring yin no // bzhi pa ni tha ma'o //
translated: The first is the best; the second is almost as good as the first; the third is middling; the fourth is the worst.

original: de dag gling gcig gling gnyis dang // gsum dang bzhi la mas rim bzhin //
analyzed: de dag gling gcig gling gnyis dang // gsum dang bzhi la mas rim bzhin //
translated: The cakravartins with a wheel of iron reign over one continent; those with a wheel of copper, over two continents; those with a wheel of silver, over three continents; those with a wheel of gold, over four continents.

original: gang la lcags kyi 'khor lo yod pa de ni gling gcig gi bdag po yin no //
analyzed: gang la lcags kyi 'khor lo yod pa de ni gling gcig gi bdag po yin no //
translated: The cakravartin whose wheel is iron reigns over one continent.

original: gang la zangs kyi yod pa de ni gnyis kyi'o //
analyzed: gang la zangs kyi yod pa de ni gnyis kyi'o //
translated: The cakravartin whose wheel is copper reigns over two continents.

original: gang la dngul gyi yod pa de ni gsum gyi'o //
analyzed: gang la dngul gyi yod pa de ni gsum gyi'o //
translated: The cakravartin whose wheel is silver reigns over three continents.🔽The cakravartin whose wheel is gold reigns over the four continents.

original: gang la gser gyi yod pa de ni gling bzhi la dbang ba yin te /
analyzed: gang la gser gyi yod pa de ni gling bzhi la dbang ba yin te /
translated: One who possesses a golden wheel rules over the four continents.

original: 'di ni btags pa las bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni btags pa las bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught in the Abhidharma.🔽A sutra states:

original: mdo las ni gtso bo smos pa'i phyir rgyal po rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba gang zhig tshes bco lnga la gso sbyong gi dus de kho nar mgo bkrus gso sbyong bsten nas khang bzangs kyi thog tu blon po'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba la🔽shar phyogs nas 'khor lo rin po che rtsibs stong pa /🔽lte ba dang bcas pa /
analyzed: mdo las ni gtso bo smos pa'i phyir rgyal po rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba gang zhig tshes bco lnga la gso sbyong gi dus de kho nar mgo bkrus gso sbyong bsten nas khang bzangs kyi thog tu blon po'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba la shar phyogs nas 'khor lo rin po che rtsibs stong pa / lte ba dang bcas pa /
translated: A king of the royal caste who is anointed to the princely rank, on the fifteenth day of the month, the day of confession, having washed his head and taken on the vows of confession, is seated on the upper floor of the palace surrounded by his assembly of ministers.🔽From the east, the precious wheel appears.

original: mu khyud dang bcas pa /
analyzed: mu khyud dang bcas pa /
translated: It has a thousand spokes, a hub and a circumference.

original: rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs pa /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs pa /
translated: It is complete in every aspect.

original: mdzes pa / mkhan bzos ma byas pa /
analyzed: mdzes pa / mkhan bzos ma byas pa /
translated: It is beautiful, not man-made,🔽and is the nature of divine gold.

original: lha rdzas thams cad gser gyi rang bzhin 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal ba'i rgyal po yin no zhes gser gyi 'khor lo gcig kho nar gsungs so //
analyzed: lha rdzas thams cad gser gyi rang bzhin 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal ba'i rgyal po yin no zhes gser gyi 'khor lo gcig kho nar gsungs so //
translated: He who possesses this golden wheel is a universal monarch.

original: 'khor los sgyur @160b ba'i rgyal po de dag ni 'di ltar 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur @160b ba'i rgyal po de dag ni 'di ltar 'byung ste /
translated: These universal monarchs appear in this way.

original: lhan cig gnyis min sangs rgyas bzhin //
analyzed: lhan cig gnyis min sangs rgyas bzhin //
translated: Two do not appear simultaneously, like Buddhas.🔽A sutra declares:

original: mdo las gang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gnyis snga phyi med par 'jig rten du 'byung ba ni gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med de /
analyzed: mdo las gang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gnyis snga phyi med par 'jig rten du 'byung ba ni gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med de /
translated: It is impossible and inconceivable that two Tathagatas, Arhats, Perfectly Enlightened Ones could appear in the world without one preceding and the other following.

original: 'di ni gnas med kyi /
analyzed: 'di ni gnas med kyi /
translated: This is impossible.

original: gcig gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
analyzed: gcig gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
translated: But it is possible that one appears.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dag ji lta bar 'khor los sgyur ba dag kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs so /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dag ji lta bar 'khor los sgyur ba dag kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs so /
translated: Just as it is for Tathagatas, so it is for universal monarchs.

original: 'dir ni 'di dpyad par bya ste /🔽ci 'dir stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams la 'jig rten du 'dod dam /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'di dpyad par bya ste / ci 'dir stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams la 'jig rten du 'dod dam /
translated: Here, this should be investigated:

original: 'on te 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad yin zhe na /
translated: Is the world considered to be the trichiliocosm or is it all world systems?

original: kha cig na re gzhan du sangs rgyas dag mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: kha cig na re gzhan du sangs rgyas dag mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Some say: Buddhas do not appear elsewhere.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi mthu thogs pa yod par 'gyur du 'ong ngo /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi mthu thogs pa yod par 'gyur du 'ong ngo /
translated: It would be as if the Bhagavān’s power were obstructed.

original: bcom ldan 'das gcig kho nas thams cad du yang spyod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gcig kho nas thams cad du yang spyod do //
translated: The Bhagavān alone acts everywhere.

original: gang du bcom ldan 'das gcig gis gdul bya rnams gdul bar mi spyod pa de ni gzhan gyis kyang mi spyod do //
analyzed: gang du bcom ldan 'das gcig gis gdul bya rnams gdul bar mi spyod pa de ni gzhan gyis kyang mi spyod do //
translated: Where one Bhagavān does not act to tame disciples, another Bhagavān also does not act.

original: mdo las kyang /
analyzed: mdo las kyang /
translated: Also, a sūtra says:

original: sh'a ri'i bu gal te la la zhig khyod kyi thang du 'ongs nas 'di skad du /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu gal te la la zhig khyod kyi thang du 'ongs nas 'di skad du /
translated: Śāriputra, if someone came to your presence and asked:

original: da ltar dge slong ngam /
analyzed: da ltar dge slong ngam /
translated: “Are there any bhikṣus or

original: bram ze gang yang rung /
analyzed: bram ze gang yang rung /
translated: brāhmaṇas

original: dge sbyong goo ta ma dang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge sbyong goo ta ma dang 'di lta ste /
translated: who are equal to the śramaṇa Gautama

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba la mnyam zhing mnyam pa 'ga' zhig yod dam zhes 'dri bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba la mnyam zhing mnyam pa 'ga' zhig yod dam zhes 'dri bar 'gyur na /
translated: in terms of complete enlightenment?”

original: de skad du dris na ji skad du lan gdab /
analyzed: de skad du dris na ji skad du lan gdab /
translated: If asked this, how would you answer?

original: bcun pa gal te la la zhig bdag gi thad du mchis nas 'di skad du 'dri bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: bcun pa gal te la la zhig bdag gi thad du mchis nas 'di skad du 'dri bar 'gyur na /
translated: O Honored One, if someone came to my presence and asked this,

original: de la bdag gis 'di skad ces da ltar dge slong ngam /
analyzed: de la bdag gis 'di skad ces da ltar dge slong ngam /
translated: I would answer: “There are no bhikṣus or

original: bram ze yang rung /
analyzed: bram ze yang rung /
translated: or a brahmin,

original: bcom ldan 'das dang mnyam zhing mnyam pa ni 'ga' yang med do zhes dris pa'i lan gdab bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dang mnyam zhing mnyam pa ni 'ga' yang med do zhes dris pa'i lan gdab bar bgyi'o //
translated: there is no one equal to the Bhagavān.

original: btsun pa de ci'i slad du zhe na /🔽gang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gnyis snga phyi med par 'jig rten du 'byung ba ni gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med de /
analyzed: btsun pa de ci'i slad du zhe na / gang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gnyis snga phyi med par 'jig rten du 'byung ba ni gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med de /
translated: “Venerable, why is that?🔽Because it is not possible for two tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas to appear in the world without one preceding and the other following.

original: 'di ni gnas med do zhes bcom ldan 'das las thos shing mngon sum du bzung ba'i slad du'o zhes gsungs so zhes zer ro /🔽'o na gang bcom ldan 'das kyis tshangs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'di ni gnas med do zhes bcom ldan 'das las thos shing mngon sum du bzung ba'i slad du'o zhes gsungs so zhes zer ro / 'o na gang bcom ldan 'das kyis tshangs pa'i mdo las /
translated: This is impossible.”🔽“Well then, how do you interpret the statement in the Brahma Sutra:

original: nga ni stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bar 'di la dbang bsgyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa ji ltar drang zhe na /🔽bstan @161a * //
analyzed: nga ni stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bar 'di la dbang bsgyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa ji ltar drang zhe na / bstan @161a * //
translated: ‘I rule over this trichiliocosm’?🔽“

original: pa 'di ni dgongs pa can yin no //
analyzed: pa 'di ni dgongs pa can yin no //
translated: This teaching is provisional.

original: 'di la dgongs pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la dgongs pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is its intention?

original: mngon par 'du mdzad pa mi mnga' bar de srid du rnam par gzigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'du mdzad pa mi mnga' bar de srid du rnam par gzigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, without any effort, he sees them for as long as he wishes.

original: mngon par 'du mdzad na ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyan gyi yul mtha' yas pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par 'du mdzad na ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyan gyi yul mtha' yas pa yin no //
translated: If he does make an effort, then the object of his eye is infinite.

original: sde pa gzhan dag na re 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag na yang sangs rgyas rnams bzhugs so //
analyzed: sde pa gzhan dag na re 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag na yang sangs rgyas rnams bzhugs so //
translated: Other schools believe that the Buddhas exist in other universes.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: mang po zhig mnyam du tshogs dag la zhugs par snang la /
analyzed: mang po zhig mnyam du tshogs dag la zhugs par snang la /
translated: Because many Bodhisattvas are seen simultaneously entering the Great Vehicle's stages.

original: gcig tu sangs rgyas mang po zhig cig car 'byung bar yang mi rung la //
analyzed: gcig tu sangs rgyas mang po zhig cig car 'byung bar yang mi rung la //
translated: It is not possible for many Buddhas to appear simultaneously in one universe.

original: 'byung ba la bgegs byed pa 'ga' yang med pas gdon mi za bar 'jig rten gzhan dag tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'byung ba la bgegs byed pa 'ga' yang med pas gdon mi za bar 'jig rten gzhan dag tu 'byung ngo //
translated: Since there is nothing to obstruct their appearance, they must appear in other universes.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams dag kyang mtha' yas pas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku tshe bskal par bzhugs kyang /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams dag kyang mtha' yas pas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku tshe bskal par bzhugs kyang /
translated: Since universes are infinite, even if the Lord were to live for aeons,

original: 'dir ji lta bar mtha' yas pa gzhan dag tu mdzad par mi spyod na mi'i tshes lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: 'dir ji lta bar mtha' yas pa gzhan dag tu mdzad par mi spyod na mi'i tshes lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: he would not be able to act in infinite universes as he does in this one. What need is there to mention human life?

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das ji ltar mdzad ce na /🔽gang zag 'di'i dbang po 'di ni dus 'di srid kyis yul che ge mo zhig tu gang 'di la brten nas nyes pa 'di yongs su spangs shing yan lag 'di nye bar bsgrubs pa'i phyir sbyor ba 'dis nam skyes pa ni skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das ji ltar mdzad ce na / gang zag 'di'i dbang po 'di ni dus 'di srid kyis yul che ge mo zhig tu gang 'di la brten nas nyes pa 'di yongs su spangs shing yan lag 'di nye bar bsgrubs pa'i phyir sbyor ba 'dis nam skyes pa ni skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: How does the Bhagavat act in this way?

original: ma rdzogs pa ni yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar mkhyen pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: ma rdzogs pa ni yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar mkhyen pa lta bu yin no //
translated: He knows that this faculty of this person will, in this much time, in such a place, by relying on such a person, by abandoning such faults and by accomplishing such virtues, be generated if not generated, and will be perfected if not already perfected.

original: 'di la khungs su gang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gnyis snga phyi med par 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med do zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di phyung ba gang yin pa de
analyzed: 'di la khungs su gang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gnyis snga phyi med par 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med do zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di phyung ba gang yin pa de
translated: The scriptural reference that is cited here, namely, “It is impossible and it cannot occur that two tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas appear in the world without one preceding and the other following,”

original: nyid kyang 'jig rten gyi khams gcig gi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa zhig gam /
analyzed: nyid kyang 'jig rten gyi khams gcig gi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa zhig gam /
translated: is stated with reference to a single world system.

original: 'on te thams cad kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa zhig ces dpyad par bya'o //🔽'khor los sgyur ba rnams kyang 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan du yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te thams cad kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa zhig ces dpyad par bya'o // 'khor los sgyur ba rnams kyang 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan du yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Or else, the Buddha spoke from the point of view of the totality of the universes.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba bkag pa'i phyir sangs rgyas bzhin no //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba bkag pa'i phyir sangs rgyas bzhin no //
