original: 'di lta bur sus kyang 'di dag ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dag yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta bur sus kyang 'di dag ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dag yin no //
translated: No one can determine that these are earth, water, fire, and wind,

original: 'di dag ni de dag gi gzugs la sogs pa yin no zhes nges par mi zin la /
analyzed: 'di dag ni de dag gi gzugs la sogs pa yin no zhes nges par mi zin la /
translated: or that these are their forms, etc.

original: mig dang reg pa'i gzung ba dag yin par yang dam bca'o //
analyzed: mig dang reg pa'i gzung ba dag yin par yang dam bca'o //
translated: We also maintain that they are the objects of the eye and of touch.

original: bal dang ras bal dang le brgan rtsi dang gur gum tshig pa dag la de dag gi blo med pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa kho na la de'i blo 'jug par zad do //
analyzed: bal dang ras bal dang le brgan rtsi dang gur gum tshig pa dag la de dag gi blo med pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa kho na la de'i blo 'jug par zad do //
translated: The cognition of wool, cotton, saffron, and turmeric does not occur in their ashes, but only in their forms, etc.

original: chos byed las skye ba byung ba la bum par yongs su shes pa ni dbyibs 'dra ba'i phyir phreng ba bzhin te /
analyzed: chos byed las skye ba byung ba la bum par yongs su shes pa ni dbyibs 'dra ba'i phyir phreng ba bzhin te /
translated: The cognition of a pot occurs in the elements that are the cause of the pot, because of the similarity of shape, as in the case of a row.

original: rtags ma mthong bar yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtags ma mthong bar yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cognition of a pot does not occur when the marks are not seen.

original: yang na byis ba blo rdol ba lta bu dag las su zhig gus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na byis ba blo rdol ba lta bu dag las su zhig gus par 'gyur te /
translated: Or, who would respect those whose minds are like a child’s?

original: de dag dgag pa ni re zhig bzhag go //
analyzed: de dag dgag pa ni re zhig bzhag go //
translated: We will set aside for the moment the refutation of these.

original: yang 'jig pa de dag gi rtse mo gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang 'jig pa de dag gi rtse mo gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the summit of these destructions?

original: bsam gtan gnyis sogs gsum po ni //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis sogs gsum po ni //
translated: The third is the second meditation, etc.

original: de dag gi rtse go rims bzhin //
analyzed: de dag gi rtse go rims bzhin //
translated: The three summits are respectively🔽The summit of cyclic existence is the fourth meditation.

original: 'jig pa'i rtse mo gsum la mes 'jig pa'i rtse mo ni bsam gtan gnyis pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rtse mo gsum la mes 'jig pa'i rtse mo ni bsam gtan gnyis pa yin te /
translated: The summit of the destruction by fire is the second meditation.

original: de man chad sreg par byed do //
analyzed: de man chad sreg par byed do //
translated: The fire burns up to there.

original: chus 'jig pa'i rtse mo ni bsam gtan gsum pa yin te /
analyzed: chus 'jig pa'i rtse mo ni bsam gtan gsum pa yin te /
translated: The summit of the destruction by water is the third meditation.

original: man chad srul bar byed do //
analyzed: man chad srul bar byed do //
translated: The water seeps up to there.

original: rlung gis 'jig pa'i rtse mo ni bsam gtan bzhi pa yin te /
analyzed: rlung gis 'jig pa'i rtse mo ni bsam gtan bzhi pa yin te /
translated: The summit of the destruction by wind is the fourth meditation.

original: man chad 'thor bar byed do //
analyzed: man chad 'thor bar byed do //
translated: The wind blows up to there.

original: 'jig pa'i lhag ma gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i lhag ma gang yin pa de ni /
translated: That which remains after the destruction

original: rtse mo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtse mo zhes bya'o //
translated: is called the summit.

original: yang de'i phyir bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang bsam gtan gsum pa dag me dang chu dang rlung dag gis 'jig ce na /
analyzed: yang de'i phyir bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang bsam gtan gsum pa dag me dang chu dang rlung dag gis 'jig ce na /
translated: Why is the first, second and third meditation destroyed by fire, water and wind?

original: de yi skyon dang chos mthun phyir //
analyzed: de yi skyon dang chos mthun phyir //
translated: Because of the similarity of the vices and the qualities.

original: bsam gtan dang po na ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag skyon yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po na ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag skyon yin te /
translated: In the first meditation, initial inquiry and investigation are vices,

original: de dag kyang yid yongs su gdung bar byed pa dag yin pa'i phyir me'i bsal pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang yid yongs su gdung bar byed pa dag yin pa'i phyir me'i bsal pa dag yin no //
translated: because they trouble the mind and because they are like fire.

original: gnyis pa na ni dga' ba skyon yin te ;
analyzed: gnyis pa na ni dga' ba skyon yin te ;
translated: In the second, joy is the fault.

original: de yang shin tu sbyangs pa dang ldan pas lus mnyen par byed pa dag yin pa'i phyir chu'i bskal pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang shin tu sbyangs pa dang ldan pas lus mnyen par byed pa dag yin pa'i phyir chu'i bskal pa yin no //
translated: Since they are flexibility that softens the body, they are the eon of water.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mdo las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mdo las /
translated: Therefore a sutra declares:

original: de ni lus kyi mkhrang po zad par med pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi dbang po 'gags so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni lus kyi mkhrang po zad par med pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi dbang po 'gags so zhes gsungs so //
translated: The faculty of pain ceases because the solidity of the body is exhausted.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa la ni dbugs @165b rngub pa dang dbugs 'byung ba dag ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa la ni dbugs @165b rngub pa dang dbugs 'byung ba dag ste /
translated: In the third absorption, inhalation and exhalation are the faults.

original: da dag kyang rlung kha na yin pas snyoms par 'jug pa'i bsam gtan gang na nang gi skyon ji lta bar skye ba'i bsam gtan de na phyi rol gyi yang de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: da dag kyang rlung kha na yin pas snyoms par 'jug pa'i bsam gtan gang na nang gi skyon ji lta bar skye ba'i bsam gtan de na phyi rol gyi yang de lta bu yin no //
translated: Since they are wind, the internal faults of the meditative attainment of any absorption are the external faults of that absorption.

original: ci'i phyir sas 'jig pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sas 'jig pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are they not destroyed by earth?

original: snod ces bya ba nis kho na yin la de ni me dang chu dang rlung dag dang mi mthun gyi sa dang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: snod ces bya ba nis kho na yin la de ni me dang chu dang rlung dag dang mi mthun gyi sa dang ni ma yin no //
translated: The term vessel refers to the physical cosmos, which is incompatible with fire, water and wind, but not with earth.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa ni ji ltar mi 'jig ce na /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa ni ji ltar mi 'jig ce na /
translated: Why is the fourth absorption not destroyed?

original: bzhi pa na med mi g-yo'i phyir //
analyzed: bzhi pa na med mi g-yo'i phyir //
translated: There is no destruction in the fourth meditation, because it is not subject to change.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bsam gtan bzhi pa ni nang gi skyon dang bral ba'i phyir mi g-yo ba zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bsam gtan bzhi pa ni nang gi skyon dang bral ba'i phyir mi g-yo ba zhes gsungs te /
translated: The Blessed One has said that the fourth meditation is not subject to change because it is free from the internal faults.

original: de'i phyir de'i phyi'i skyon yang mi 'jug pas de na 'jig pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i phyi'i skyon yang mi 'jug pas de na 'jig pa med do //
translated: Therefore, since external faults do not penetrate there, there is no destruction there.

original: gzhan dag na re gnas gtsang ma'i mthus yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gnas gtsang ma'i mthus yin te /
translated: Others say that it is by the power of the pure abodes.

original: de dag gis gzugs med pa dag tu 'jug par yang mi nus la //
analyzed: de dag gis gzugs med pa dag tu 'jug par yang mi nus la //
translated: Beings in the fourth meditation cannot enter the formless realm,

original: gzhan du yang 'gro bar mi nus so zhes zer ro //🔽'o na bsam gtan bzhi pa'i snod rtag par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan du yang 'gro bar mi nus so zhes zer ro // 'o na bsam gtan bzhi pa'i snod rtag par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: nor can they go elsewhere.🔽But then the receptacle of the fourth meditation would be permanent.

original: mi rtag de yi gzhal med khang //
analyzed: mi rtag de yi gzhal med khang //
translated: The receptacle of the fourth meditation is impermanent,

original: sems can bcas te 'byung 'jig phyir //
analyzed: sems can bcas te 'byung 'jig phyir //
translated: because it arises and perishes along with the sentient beings who live there.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa ni sa gzhi gcig tu 'brel pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa ni sa gzhi gcig tu 'brel pa ma yin no //
translated: The fourth meditation is not a single receptacle for all sentient beings.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: gnas gzhan du rnam par chad pa yin te skar ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gnas gzhan du rnam par chad pa yin te skar ma bzhin no //
translated: It is divided into different places, like the stars.

original: de na sems can gang dang gang skye ba'am 'chi 'pho yang rung ste /
analyzed: de na sems can gang dang gang skye ba'am 'chi 'pho yang rung ste /
translated: When a sentient being is born or dies there,

original: de ni gzhal med khang dang bcas te skye zhing 'chi 'pho bas de la rtag pa nyid med do //
analyzed: de ni gzhal med khang dang bcas te skye zhing 'chi 'pho bas de la rtag pa nyid med do //
translated: The world is created and destroyed with its palaces. It is not eternal.

original: yang 'jig pa de dag go rims gang gis 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: yang 'jig pa de dag go rims gang gis 'byung zhe na /
translated: In what order do these destructions occur?

original: re zhig par chad med par ni //
analyzed: re zhig par chad med par ni //
translated: First, there is no destruction of the physical world without destruction of sentient beings.

original: me yis bdun no //
analyzed: me yis bdun no //
translated: Seven by fire,🔽one by water,

original: mes 'jig pa bdun 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mes 'jig pa bdun 'byung ngo //
translated: then seven by fire,

original: de'i 'og tu ni /🔽chu yis gcig / mes 'jig pa bdun gyi mjug thogs su chu dag gis 'jig pa 'byung ngo //🔽de ltar chu bdun thal nas kyang /🔽me yis bdun no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni / chu yis gcig / mes 'jig pa bdun gyi mjug thogs su chu dag gis 'jig pa 'byung ngo // de ltar chu bdun thal nas kyang / me yis bdun no //
translated: then one by wind.🔽After the seven by fire,🔽seven by fire again.🔽After the seven by water,

original: rim pa des na chus 'jig pa bdun thal nas yang mes 'jig pa bdun 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rim pa des na chus 'jig pa bdun thal nas yang mes 'jig pa bdun 'byung ngo //
translated: then one by wind.

original: de nas ni /🔽mjug tu rlung gis 'jig pa yin //
analyzed: de nas ni / mjug tu rlung gis 'jig pa yin //
translated: Then,🔽at the end, one by wind.

original: de nas ni mjug tu rlung gis 'jig pa gcig 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nas ni mjug tu rlung gis 'jig pa gcig 'byung ngo //
translated: After the seven by water, there is one by wind.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na ;
translated: Why is this?

original: sems can de dag gi snyoms par 'jug pa'i khyad par las lus dag gnas pa'i khyad par ji lta bar snod rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sems can de dag gi snyoms par 'jug pa'i khyad par las lus dag gnas pa'i khyad par ji lta bar snod rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The duration of the world is determined by the duration of the life expectancy of the sentient beings who inhabit it.

original: de dag ni mes 'jig pa lnga bcu rtsa drug dang / chus 'jig pa bdun dang rlung gis 'jig pa gcig yin te /🔽de ltar bshad nas btags pa'i bshad @166a * //
analyzed: de dag ni mes 'jig pa lnga bcu rtsa drug dang / chus 'jig pa bdun dang rlung gis 'jig pa gcig yin te / de ltar bshad nas btags pa'i bshad @166a * //
translated: These are fifty-six destructions by fire, seven by water, and one by wind.

original: pa dge rgyas kyi lha rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa drug cu rtsa bzhi'i zhes bya ba legs par drangs pa yin no //
analyzed: pa dge rgyas kyi lha rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa drug cu rtsa bzhi'i zhes bya ba legs par drangs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the Abhidharmakośa statement, “The lifespan of the gods of the Subhakṛtsna heaven is forty-six eons,” is well cited.

original: chos mngon pa'i mdzod kyi bshad pa las 'jig rten bstan pa zhes bya ba mdzod kyi gnas gsum pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i mdzod kyi bshad pa las 'jig rten bstan pa zhes bya ba mdzod kyi gnas gsum pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes exposition of the third chapter of the Abhidharmakośabhāṣya, called “The World.”

original: // / yang sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten rnam pa mang po sna tshogs pa bshad pa gang yin pa de sus byas she na /
analyzed: // / yang sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten rnam pa mang po sna tshogs pa bshad pa gang yin pa de sus byas she na /
translated: Who creates the various sentient beings and the physical cosmos that have been explained?

original: sus kyang blo sngon du btang ste byas pa ni med do //
analyzed: sus kyang blo sngon du btang ste byas pa ni med do //
translated: No one created them by first conceiving of them in the mind.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /🔽sems can rnams kyi /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na / sems can rnams kyi /
translated: If that is so, how are they created?

original: las las 'jig rten sna tshogs skyes //
analyzed: las las 'jig rten sna tshogs skyes //
translated: They are created from the karma of sentient beings.🔽The world arises from the karma of sentient beings.

original: gal te las las skyes nas ci'i phyir sems can rnams kyi las dag gis gur gum dang ; tsan dan la sogs pa ches dga' dga' lta bur skyes par 'gyur la de dag gi lus ni ma yin zhe na /🔽sems can 'dren mar byed pa rnams kyi las de lta bu dag kho na gang rma lta bur gyur pa'i lus dag dang / de'i tshe gnyen por gyur pa longs spyod dga' dga' lta bu dag kyang skye'i /
analyzed: gal te las las skyes nas ci'i phyir sems can rnams kyi las dag gis gur gum dang ; tsan dan la sogs pa ches dga' dga' lta bur skyes par 'gyur la de dag gi lus ni ma yin zhe na / sems can 'dren mar byed pa rnams kyi las de lta bu dag kho na gang rma lta bur gyur pa'i lus dag dang / de'i tshe gnyen por gyur pa longs spyod dga' dga' lta bu dag kyang skye'i /
translated: If they arise from action, why are the actions of sentient beings the cause of the arising of the most delightful perfumes, such as those of saffron and sandalwood, and not the cause of their bodies?🔽The actions of sentient beings who are not upright are the cause of bodies that are like wounds and of delightful objects that are remedies for those bodies.

original: lha 'dren mar byed pa ma yin pa rnams kyi ni gnyi ga yang dga' dga' lta bu dag yin no //
analyzed: lha 'dren mar byed pa ma yin pa rnams kyi ni gnyi ga yang dga' dga' lta bu dag yin no //
translated: The actions of sentient beings who are upright are the cause of both bodies and objects that are delightful.

original: las de yang gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: las de yang gang zhig ce na /
translated: What are these actions?

original: de ni sems pa dang des byas //
analyzed: de ni sems pa dang des byas //
translated: They are intention and that which is produced by intention.

original: mdo las ni gnyis te /
analyzed: mdo las ni gnyis te /
translated: The Sūtra says that there are two kinds of action:

original: sems pa dang bsams pa'i las so zhes gang gsungs pa la /🔽bsams pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: sems pa dang bsams pa'i las so zhes gang gsungs pa la / bsams pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: intention and the action that is the intended object.🔽What is the intended object?

original: sems pas byas pa de yin no //
analyzed: sems pas byas pa de yin no //
translated: It is that which is produced by intention.

original: las gnyis po de dag ni gsum yin te /
analyzed: las gnyis po de dag ni gsum yin te /
translated: These two kinds of action are threefold.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnams so //🔽las 'di dag ji ltar rnam par gzhag ci rten las sam /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnams so // las 'di dag ji ltar rnam par gzhag ci rten las sam /
translated: Action of body, speech and mind.

original: 'on te ngo bo nyid las sam /
analyzed: 'on te ngo bo nyid las sam /
translated: How are these actions established? Are they established according to their basis, or according to their intrinsic nature, or according to their instigation?

original: 'on te kun nas slong ba las gal te rten las yin na ni thams cad lus la brten pa'i phyir lus kyi las gcig pur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te kun nas slong ba las gal te rten las yin na ni thams cad lus la brten pa'i phyir lus kyi las gcig pur 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are established according to their basis, then all actions are based on the body, and so all actions would be bodily actions.

original: gal te ngo bo nyid las yin na ni de dag gi las gcig pur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid las yin na ni de dag gi las gcig pur 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are established according to their intrinsic nature, then all actions would be mental actions, because the intrinsic nature of all actions is the same.

original: gal te kun nas slong ba las yin na ni thams cad kyang yid kyi kun nas bslang ba'i phyir yid kyi las gcig pur 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te kun nas slong ba las yin na ni thams cad kyang yid kyi kun nas bslang ba'i phyir yid kyi las gcig pur 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If they are established according to their instigation, then all actions are instigated by the mental faculty, and so all actions would be mental actions.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re rgyu gsum gyis go rims bzhin du gsum rnam par gzhag go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re rgyu gsum gyis go rims bzhin du gsum rnam par gzhag go zhes zer ro //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say that the three are established according to their basis, their intrinsic nature and their instigation, respectively.🔽Intention is mental action.

original: de la / sems pa yid kyi las yin no //🔽sems pa ni yid kyi las yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la / sems pa yid kyi las yin no // sems pa ni yid kyi las yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Intention is mental action.

original: des bskyed lus dang ngag gi las //
analyzed: des bskyed lus dang ngag gi las //
translated: Bodily and vocal actions are produced by it.

original: sems las skyes pa gang yin pa bsams pa'i las zhes gsungs pa de dag @166b ni lus dang ngag gi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems las skyes pa gang yin pa bsams pa'i las zhes gsungs pa de dag @166b ni lus dang ngag gi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: These actions are bodily and vocal actions.

original: de dag rnam rig rnam rig min //
analyzed: de dag rnam rig rnam rig min //
translated: They are informative action and non-informative action.

original: lus dang ngag gi las de dag ni so sor rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rang bzhin dag tu rig par bya'o //🔽de la'ang / lus rnam rig byed dbyibs su 'dod //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las de dag ni so sor rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rang bzhin dag tu rig par bya'o // de la'ang / lus rnam rig byed dbyibs su 'dod //
translated: Bodily and vocal actions are, respectively, informative action and non-informative action.🔽The bodily action is shape.

original: sems kyi dbang gis lus de dang de ltar gnas pa ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi dbang gis lus de dang de ltar gnas pa ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed yin no //
translated: The bodily action is shape, for the body is arranged in this or that shape through the force of thought.

original: gzhan dag na re 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'gro ba yin te /
translated: According to other masters, bodily action is movement, for the body is moved in this or that direction.🔽The eye is moved by the mind, but the eye does not move by itself.🔽The Vaibhāṣikas of Kaśmīr say that bodily action is shape.

original: lus g-yo ba las yin gyi mig g-yo ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te /🔽de dag la /🔽'gro min gang phyir 'dus byas ni //🔽skad cig pa yin zhes bya ba brjod do //
analyzed: lus g-yo ba las yin gyi mig g-yo ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te / de dag la / 'gro min gang phyir 'dus byas ni // skad cig pa yin zhes bya ba brjod do //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas of Kaśmīr say that bodily action is shape.🔽The Vaibhāṣikas of Kaśmīr say that bodily action is shape.🔽The Vaibhāṣikas of Kaśmīr say that bodily action is shape.🔽The Vaibhāṣikas of Kaśmīr say that bodily action is shape.🔽The Vaibhāṣikas of Kaśmīr say that bodily action is shape.🔽The Vaibhāṣikas of Kaśmīr say that bodily action is shape.🔽The Vaibhāṣikas of Kaśmīr say that bodily action is shape.🔽The Vaibhāṣikas of Kaśmīr say that bodily action is shape.🔽The Vaibhāṣikas of Kaśmīr say that bodily action is shape.🔽The Vaibhāṣikas of Kaśmīr say that bodily action is shape.🔽The Vaibhāṣikas of Kaśmīr say that bodily action is shape.🔽The Vaibhāṣikas of Kaśmīr say that bodily action is shape.🔽The Vaibhāṣikas of Kaśmīr say that bodily action is shape.🔽The Vaibhāṣikas of Kaśmīr say that bodily action is shape.🔽The Vaibhāṣikas of Kaśmīr say that bodily action is shape.🔽The Vaibhāṣikas of Kaśmīr say that bodily action is shape.🔽The Vaibhāṣikas of Kaśmīr say that bodily action is shape.

original: skad cig ces bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
analyzed: skad cig ces bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas of Kaśmīr say that bodily action is shape.

original: bdag nyid du red ma thag tu 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid du red ma thag tu 'jig pa'o //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas of

original: de 'di la yod pas na skad cig pa ste dbyug pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de 'di la yod pas na skad cig pa ste dbyug pa bzhin no //
translated: It is momentary because it possesses this characteristic, like a stick.

original: 'dus byas thams cad bdag nyid thob pa las phan chad du med pa'i phyir gang du skyes pa de nyid du 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad bdag nyid thob pa las phan chad du med pa'i phyir gang du skyes pa de nyid du 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since all conditioned things do not exist beyond the attainment of their own nature, they perish in the very place where they arise.

original: de ni yul gzhan du 'pho bar rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yul gzhan du 'pho bar rig pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that they are known to move to another place.

original: de lta bas na lus kyi las ni 'gro ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na lus kyi las ni 'gro ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus bodily action is not movement.

original: gal te thams cad skad cig par grub par gyur na ni de de lta yin no //
analyzed: gal te thams cad skad cig par grub par gyur na ni de de lta yin no //
translated: If it were established that everything is momentary, then that would be so.🔽But you should understand that it is not established.

original: 'di'i grub pa kho nar khong du chud par gyis shig / ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di'i grub pa kho nar khong du chud par gyis shig / ga las she na /
translated: Why?

original: 'dus byas ni gdon mi za bar 'jig phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas ni gdon mi za bar 'jig phyir ro //
translated: Because conditioned things certainly perish.

original: dngos po rnams 'jig pa ni rgyu med pa las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams 'jig pa ni rgyu med pa las byung ba yin no //
translated: The destruction of things occurs without a cause.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: bya ba'i rgyu yin na 'jig pa yang med pa yin pas med pa gang yin pa de la ni ci zhig byar yod /
analyzed: bya ba'i rgyu yin na 'jig pa yang med pa yin pas med pa gang yin pa de la ni ci zhig byar yod /
translated: If the cause of destruction were activity, then destruction would be nonexistent. But what could be done by that which is nonexistent?

original: rgyu med pa las byung ba'i 'jig pa de ni dngos po skyed pa tsam la ma yin na phyis kyang mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: rgyu med pa las byung ba'i 'jig pa de ni dngos po skyed pa tsam la ma yin na phyis kyang mi 'byung ste /
translated: That cessation which occurs without a cause does not occur merely with the production of a thing, nor does it occur later,

original: dngos po mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the thing is the same.

original: 'on te gzhan du gyur pa yin no zhe na /🔽de nyid gzhan du gyur pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan du gyur pa yin no zhe na / de nyid gzhan du gyur pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But if it is a transformation,🔽it is not logical that it is a transformation of that very thing,

original: de nyid de dang mtshan nyid mi mthun par ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid de dang mtshan nyid mi mthun par ni mi rung ngo //
translated: because it is not possible that that very thing has a different characteristic.

original: shing la sogs pa dag me dang 'brel pa las 'jig par yang mthong la mthong ba las brling ba'i tshad ma yang med pas thams cad kyi 'jig pa ni rgyu med pa las byung ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: shing la sogs pa dag me dang 'brel pa las 'jig par yang mthong la mthong ba las brling ba'i tshad ma yang med pas thams cad kyi 'jig pa ni rgyu med pa las byung ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But we see that such things as wood are destroyed by contact with fire, and there is no valid cognition that is stronger than perception. Therefore, the destruction of all things does not occur without a cause.

original: re zhig khyod shing la sogs pa dag me dang 'brel pa las 'jig par blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ji lta bur sems /
analyzed: re zhig khyod shing la sogs pa dag me dang 'brel pa las 'jig par blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ji lta bur sems /
translated: But how do you think that such things as wood are seen to be destroyed by contact with fire?

original: de yod na de dag la yang mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod na de dag la yang mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not appear to exist when that exists.

original: re zhig 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: re zhig 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: This should be investigated:

original: ci me dang 'brel ba las shing la sogs pa zhig ste /
analyzed: ci me dang 'brel ba las shing la sogs pa zhig ste /
translated: Is it that the fuel, etc., are destroyed by their relationship with fire,

original: de'i phyir mi snang ba zhig yin nam /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi snang ba zhig yin nam /
translated: and therefore do not appear?

original: 'on te rang nyid zhig la gzhan @167a * //
analyzed: 'on te rang nyid zhig la gzhan @167a * //
translated: Or is it that they are destroyed by themselves, and other things are not produced,

original: dag kyang ma skyes pas de'i phyir mi snang ste dper na rlung dang phrad pa las mar me dang lag pa dang phrad pa las dril bu'i sgra lta bu zhig yin /
analyzed: dag kyang ma skyes pas de'i phyir mi snang ste dper na rlung dang phrad pa las mar me dang lag pa dang phrad pa las dril bu'i sgra lta bu zhig yin /
translated: and therefore do not appear, like the flame of a lamp and the sound of a drum, due to their contact with wind and the hand?

original: de lta bas na don 'di ni rjes su dpag pas bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na don 'di ni rjes su dpag pas bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, this matter should be established by inference.

original: 'di la rjes su dpag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la rjes su dpag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the inference here?

original: re zhig med pa ni bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir zhes ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: re zhig med pa ni bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir zhes ni bshad zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that what is nonexistent is not an action.

original: yang na / rgyu med pa las 'ga' mi 'byung //
analyzed: yang na / rgyu med pa las 'ga' mi 'byung //
translated: And also: Nothing arises without a cause.

original: gal te 'jig pa rgyu dang ldan pa zhig tu gyur na skye ba bzhin du 'ga' yang rgyu med pa las mi 'gyur ba zhig na skad cig ma blo dang sgra dang me lce dag 'jig pa rgyu med pa las byung ba yang mthong bas 'di rgyu la🔽ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'jig pa rgyu dang ldan pa zhig tu gyur na skye ba bzhin du 'ga' yang rgyu med pa las mi 'gyur ba zhig na skad cig ma blo dang sgra dang me lce dag 'jig pa rgyu med pa las byung ba yang mthong bas 'di rgyu la ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: If cessation were to have a cause, then like arising, it would not occur without a cause. But since the cessation of momentary minds, sounds, and flames is seen to occur without a cause, it does not depend on a cause.

original: gang zhig blo yang blo gzhan gyis 'jig la sgra yang sgra gzhan gyis 'jig go snyam du sems pa de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig blo yang blo gzhan gyis 'jig la sgra yang sgra gzhan gyis 'jig go snyam du sems pa de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is illogical to think that a mind is destroyed by another mind and a sound is destroyed by another sound.

original: blo gnyis phrad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo gnyis phrad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because two minds do not make contact.

original: the tshom can dang nges pa'i shes pa dag dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dag dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag phrad par ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: the tshom can dang nges pa'i shes pa dag dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dag dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag phrad par ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is illogical for a mind of doubt and a mind of definite knowledge, or for a mind of pleasure and a mind of pain, or for a mind of attachment and a mind of aversion to make contact.

original: gang gi tshe blo dang sgra gsal ba nyid dag gi mjug thogs su blo dang sgra mi gsal ba 'byung ba de'i che  ji ltar na mi gsal ba rigs mthun pa'i chos kyi gsal ba 'jig par 'gyur /🔽gang yang gnas pa'i rgyu med pa'am /
analyzed: gang gi tshe blo dang sgra gsal ba nyid dag gi mjug thogs su blo dang sgra mi gsal ba 'byung ba de'i che  ji ltar na mi gsal ba rigs mthun pa'i chos kyi gsal ba 'jig par 'gyur / gang yang gnas pa'i rgyu med pa'am /
translated: When a clear mind or sound is immediately followed by an unclear mind or sound, how could the clear one cease and the unclear one arise as a homogeneous phenomenon?🔽Also, it is illogical to think that the flames of a fire are destroyed by the absence of a cause for their endurance

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa'i dbang gis me lce dag 'jig go snyam du sems pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa'i dbang gis me lce dag 'jig go snyam du sems pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: or by virtue and nonvirtue,

original: med pa ni rgyu yin par 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa ni rgyu yin par 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: because it is not suitable for a nonexistent to be a cause.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu chos dang chos ma yin pa dag kyang skad cig skad cig nyid la 'jug pa thob pa dang bgegs byed par 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu chos dang chos ma yin pa dag kyang skad cig skad cig nyid la 'jug pa thob pa dang bgegs byed par 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: Also, it is not suitable for virtue and nonvirtue to be the causes of arising and cessation, respectively, because they are obtained and obstructed in each moment.

original: rgyu yongs su brtags pa 'di yang 'dus byas thams cad la bya bar nus pas brtsad mi dgos so //
analyzed: rgyu yongs su brtags pa 'di yang 'dus byas thams cad la bya bar nus pas brtsad mi dgos so //
translated: This examination of causes can be applied to all conditioned phenomena, so there is no need to analyze them further.

original: gal te shing la sogs pa dag 'jig pa me dang 'brel ba'i rgyu las byung ba zhig yin na de lta na ni tshos byed las skyes pa rnams kyi tshos pa dang / ches tshos pa dang / ches cher tshos pa byung bal /
analyzed: gal te shing la sogs pa dag 'jig pa me dang 'brel ba'i rgyu las byung ba zhig yin na de lta na ni tshos byed las skyes pa rnams kyi tshos pa dang / ches tshos pa dang / ches cher tshos pa byung bal /
translated: If the destruction of wood and so on arises from a cause that is related to fire, then in that case, the cause would be the destroyer.

original: rgyu yang 'jig pa por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu yang 'jig pa por 'gyur ro //
translated: The cause would be the destroyer.

original: rgyu nyid 'jig pa por 'gyur ba ji lta zhe na /🔽me dang 'brel pa gang las tshos byed las skyes pa 'byung ba de nyid dam de dang 'dra ba las tshos pa dang / ches tshos pa dang / ches cher tshos pa byung na de dag 'jig pas rgyu nyid de dag gi 'jig pa por 'gyur ba'am @167b yang na rgyu bye brag med par 'gyur ro //🔽gang las sam /🔽gang dag 'dra ba las de dag 'byung ba nyid dam /
analyzed: rgyu nyid 'jig pa por 'gyur ba ji lta zhe na / me dang 'brel pa gang las tshos byed las skyes pa 'byung ba de nyid dam de dang 'dra ba las tshos pa dang / ches tshos pa dang / ches cher tshos pa byung na de dag 'jig pas rgyu nyid de dag gi 'jig pa por 'gyur ba'am @167b yang na rgyu bye brag med par 'gyur ro // gang las sam / gang dag 'dra ba las de dag 'byung ba nyid dam /
translated: How could the cause itself be the destroyer?

original: de dang 'dra ba las yang med par 'gyur ba ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba las yang med par 'gyur ba ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: The cause from which the product of the cause arises in relation to fire, or from which the product of the cause arises in relation to fire, or from which the product of the cause arises original: re zhig me lce gzhan dag las rgyu tha dad par yongs su brtag par ni bya la reg na /
analyzed: re zhig me lce gzhan dag las rgyu tha dad par yongs su brtag par ni bya la reg na /
translated: If you imagine that the flame is a different cause from the other flames,

original: thal ba dang kha ba dang rtsva dang nyi ma dang chu dang sa dang 'brel pa las smin byed las skyes pa'i bye brag byung ba la gang la brtag par bya /
analyzed: thal ba dang kha ba dang rtsva dang nyi ma dang chu dang sa dang 'brel pa las smin byed las skyes pa'i bye brag byung ba la gang la brtag par bya /
translated: then what would you imagine in the case of the differences that arise from the ripening of karma, such as the contact of ashes, snow, grass, the sun, water, earth, and so on?

original: 'o na gang chu bskol bzad par 'gyur ba de la me dang 'brel pa dag ci zhig byed ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang chu bskol bzad par 'gyur ba de la me dang 'brel pa dag ci zhig byed ci zhe na /
translated: But what function does the contact of fire perform in the case of water that is boiled until it completely evaporates?

original: mthu'i sgo nas me'i khams 'phel bar byed cing de'i mthus na chu'i tshogs nyam chung zhing nyam chung bar 'gyur la shin tu nyam chung ba'i bar du gyur pa dang / mjug tu rgyun yang rgyun chags par mi byed de /
analyzed: mthu'i sgo nas me'i khams 'phel bar byed cing de'i mthus na chu'i tshogs nyam chung zhing nyam chung bar 'gyur la shin tu nyam chung ba'i bar du gyur pa dang / mjug tu rgyun yang rgyun chags par mi byed de /
translated: The fire element increases through its power and through its power the collection of water becomes weaker and weaker until finally the stream is not renewed.

original: 'di la me dang 'brel ba dag gis ni 'di byed do //
analyzed: 'di la me dang 'brel ba dag gis ni 'di byed do //
translated: The contact of fire performs this function in this case.

original: de lta bas na dngos po rnams 'jig pa la rgyu ni med kyi rang nyid 'jig pa'i ngang can yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa na byung ba tsam gyis 'jig pa'i phyir 'di dag skad cig ma la 'jig par yang grub la skad cig ma la 'jig pa'i phyir
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po rnams 'jig pa la rgyu ni med kyi rang nyid 'jig pa'i ngang can yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa na byung ba tsam gyis 'jig pa'i phyir 'di dag skad cig ma la 'jig par yang grub la skad cig ma la 'jig pa'i phyir
translated: Thus, things do not have a cause for their cessation. When they cease, it is because they are by nature subject to cessation. Since they cease merely by arising, it is established that they cease moment by moment.

original: 'gro ba yang med do //
analyzed: 'gro ba yang med do //
translated: Since they cease moment by moment, they do not move.

original: yul gzhan dag tu 'dab chags par 'byung ba las 'gro bar mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed par zad de rtsva'i me bzhin no //
analyzed: yul gzhan dag tu 'dab chags par 'byung ba las 'gro bar mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed par zad de rtsva'i me bzhin no //
translated: They merely give rise to the conceit “I am moving” because they arise in a continuous series in different places, like the flame of a lamp.

original: 'gro ba med na lus kyi rnam par rig byed de dbyibs yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: 'gro ba med na lus kyi rnam par rig byed de dbyibs yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: Since they do not move, the bodily intimation is shape.

original: mdo sde pa rnams na re dbyibs ni rdzas su med de /
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams na re dbyibs ni rdzas su med de /
translated: The Sautrantikas say that shape does not exist as a real substance.

original: phyogs gcig gi sgor kha dog phal cher byung ba la gzugs ring por zhes 'dogs par byed /
analyzed: phyogs gcig gi sgor kha dog phal cher byung ba la gzugs ring por zhes 'dogs par byed /
translated: When color occurs predominantly in one direction, it is designated as long.

original: de nyid la ltos nas nyung ngur byung ba la thung du zhes 'dogs par byed /
analyzed: de nyid la ltos nas nyung ngur byung ba la thung du zhes 'dogs par byed /
translated: When it occurs in a lesser degree, it is designated as short.

original: phyogs bzhir mang por byung ba la gru bzhi zhes 'dogs par byed /
analyzed: phyogs bzhir mang por byung ba la gru bzhi zhes 'dogs par byed /
translated: The four sides are designated as long because they appear to be many in the four directions.

original: thams cad du mnyam pa na lham pa zhes 'dogs par byed de /
analyzed: thams cad du mnyam pa na lham pa zhes 'dogs par byed de /
translated: The round shape is designated as round because it appears to be the same everywhere.

original: thams cad kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: All the rest are similar.

original: dper na mgal me phyogs gzhan gcig tu myur du 'dab chags par snang ba ni ring po'o snyam du shes la /
analyzed: dper na mgal me phyogs gzhan gcig tu myur du 'dab chags par snang ba ni ring po'o snyam du shes la /
translated: For example, when a firebrand is moved quickly in one direction, it appears to be long.

original: thams cad du snang na zlum po'o snyam du shes kyi dbyibs rdzas su gzhan yod pa ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: thams cad du snang na zlum po'o snyam du shes kyi dbyibs rdzas su gzhan yod pa ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: When it appears everywhere, it is understood to be round. But it is not that a different substantial shape exists.

original: gal te yod na ni /
analyzed: gal te yod na ni /
translated: If it did exist,

original: gnyis gzung 'gyur /
analyzed: gnyis gzung 'gyur /
translated: it would be apprehended by two sense faculties.

original: mig gis mthong na yang ring po'o snyam du shes par 'gyur la /
analyzed: mig gis mthong na yang ring po'o snyam du shes par 'gyur la /
translated: If it were seen by the eye, it would be understood as long.

original: lus kyi dbang po reg na yang shes par 'gyur bas 'di dbang po gnyis kyi gzung bar 'gyur ba zhig na /🔽gzugs kyi @168a * //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po reg na yang shes par 'gyur bas 'di dbang po gnyis kyi gzung bar 'gyur ba zhig na / gzugs kyi @168a * //
translated: If it were touched by the body sense faculty, it would be understood as short. Therefore it would be apprehended by two sense faculties.

original: skye mched la ni gnyis kyis 'dzin pa med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: skye mched la ni gnyis kyis 'dzin pa med do zhes zer ro //
translated: But the form base is not apprehended by two sense faculties.

original: yang na ji ltar reg bya la ring po la sogs par 'dzin pa ltar kha dog la yang de bzhin du yid ches par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na ji ltar reg bya la ring po la sogs par 'dzin pa ltar kha dog la yang de bzhin du yid ches par bya'o //
translated: Or else, just as one apprehends a tangible as long, etc., one should believe that one apprehends a color in the same way.

original: de la ni reg bya dang lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir dran pa tsam yin gyi mngon sum du 'dzin pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de la ni reg bya dang lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir dran pa tsam yin gyi mngon sum du 'dzin pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: In this case, it is only memory, because it is associated with the tangible; it is not a direct perception.

original: dper na me'i gzugs mthong nas de'i tsha ba'i dran pa 'byung ba dang / me tog gi dri bsnams nas de'i kha dog gi dran pa 'byung ba bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na me'i gzugs mthong nas de'i tsha ba'i dran pa 'byung ba dang / me tog gi dri bsnams nas de'i kha dog gi dran pa 'byung ba bzhin no zhe na /
translated: For example, when one sees the form of fire, one remembers its heat; when one smells the odor of a flower, one remembers its color.

original: 'di la ni 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir gzhan gyis gzhan dran par rigs kyi gang las 'di nges par dran par 'gyur ba reg bya las ni cung zad kyang dbyibs gang la yang nges par med do //
analyzed: 'di la ni 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir gzhan gyis gzhan dran par rigs kyi gang las 'di nges par dran par 'gyur ba reg bya las ni cung zad kyang dbyibs gang la yang nges par med do //
translated: But in this case, there is no error, and it is proper that one thing should be remembered because of another. But one does not remember the tangible at all in the perception of shape.

original: 'on te lhan cig spyod par nges pa med kyang nges par dbyibs dran par 'gyur na ni kha dog kyang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te lhan cig spyod par nges pa med kyang nges par dbyibs dran par 'gyur na ni kha dog kyang 'gyur ro //
translated: If one remembers the shape without the tangible, one should also remember the color.

original: yang na ni kha dog bzhin du dbyibs kyang nges par mi 'gyur ba zhig na de lta yang ma yin par reg bya las 'di dran par ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na ni kha dog bzhin du dbyibs kyang nges par mi 'gyur ba zhig na de lta yang ma yin par reg bya las 'di dran par ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Or else, like color, shape would not be determined. But this is not the case. It is not logical to remember shape through the sense of touch.

original: ri mos bkram pa la dbyibs du ma snang ba'i phyir mang po yang phyogs gcig par 'gyur ba zhig na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ri mos bkram pa la dbyibs du ma snang ba'i phyir mang po yang phyogs gcig par 'gyur ba zhig na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, in a painting, many shapes appear in a single place. Therefore, many shapes would be in a single place. But this is not logical.

original: kha dog bzhin no //
analyzed: kha dog bzhin no //
translated: Like color.

original: de lta bas na dbyibs ni rdzas su med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na dbyibs ni rdzas su med do //
translated: Therefore, shape does not exist as a substance.

original: gang yang thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs cung zad yod pa de ni gdon mi za bar rdul phra rab la yod pa yin na de rdul la med de /
analyzed: gang yang thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs cung zad yod pa de ni gdon mi za bar rdul phra rab la yod pa yin na de rdul la med de /
translated: Moreover, whatever form exists that is impeded, without a doubt it exists in the most subtle particle. But that does not exist in a particle.

original: ring po la sogs pa'i dbyibs ni rdul phra rab la med do //
analyzed: ring po la sogs pa'i dbyibs ni rdul phra rab la med do //
translated: Length, etc., shape does not exist in a particle.

original: de lta bas na dbyibs ni mang po de ltar gnas pa dag kho na la ring po la sogs pa 'dogs par zad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na dbyibs ni mang po de ltar gnas pa dag kho na la ring po la sogs pa 'dogs par zad do //
translated: Therefore, length, etc., is only imputed to many things that exist in that way.

original: 'on te dbyibs kyi rdul phra rab dag kho na de ltar gnas pa la ring po la sogs pa'i ming 'dogs par 'dod na ni de dag ma grub pa'i phyir de ni phyogs 'dzin pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: 'on te dbyibs kyi rdul phra rab dag kho na de ltar gnas pa la ring po la sogs pa'i ming 'dogs par 'dod na ni de dag ma grub pa'i phyir de ni phyogs 'dzin pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: But if you assert that the shape of the subtle particles of form is designated as long, etc., then that is mere partisanship, because they are not established.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid rnams grub na ni de dag bsags pa cung bar 'gyur na dbyibs kyi yan lag rnams ni kha dog la sogs pa de bzhin du rang gi ngo bor grub pa yang med na de dag bsags pa lta zhig ga la yod /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid rnams grub na ni de dag bsags pa cung bar 'gyur na dbyibs kyi yan lag rnams ni kha dog la sogs pa de bzhin du rang gi ngo bor grub pa yang med na de dag bsags pa lta zhig ga la yod /
